diagram_descriptions: A graphic depicting two stylized hands, one black and one gray, interacting with a geometric shape resembling a folded paper boat or sail. The black hand is above, holding the apex of the shape. The gray hand is below, cupping the base. The geometric shape is divided vertically into two triangles, with the top halves shaded gray and the bottom halves black. Below the geometric shape, text reads "Convention 1994" and "The Annual Collection". At the top, text reads "The Friends of The Origami Center of America".
A circular logo with a stylized origami boat inside.
A triangular label with the text "FROM THE LILLIAN OPPENHEIMER COLLECTION" in black text on a white background.
A circular logo with the text "ALICE GRAY CHALLENGE" around the perimeter and "AG" in the center, with a stylized origami bird above the "AG".

tools_reference.name: Valley Fold
tools_reference.use: Indicates a fold that goes away from the user, creating a valley.

tools_reference.name: Mountain Fold
tools_reference.use: Indicates a fold that comes towards the user, creating a mountain peak.

tools_reference.name: Crease
tools_reference.use: A line indicating where a fold should be made.

tools_reference.name: Hidden/X-Ray
tools_reference.use: Indicates a line or edge that is hidden from view or represents an internal structure.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing a square with a dashed horizontal line in the center and a curved arrow indicating a fold downwards, representing a Valley Fold.
Diagram showing a square folded in half vertically with a dashed line, and a shaded rectangle to the right, representing the result of a Valley Fold.
Diagram showing a square with a dashed horizontal line in the center and a curved arrow indicating a fold upwards, representing a Mountain Fold.
Diagram showing a square folded in half vertically with a dashed line, and a rectangle to the right, representing the result of a Mountain Fold.
Diagram showing a square with a solid horizontal line in the center, representing a Crease.
Diagram showing a square folded in half vertically with a solid line, representing the result of a Crease.
Diagram showing a diamond shape with dotted lines indicating internal folds, and a square with dotted lines and an 'X' shape, representing Hidden/X-Ray.
Diagram showing a square folded in half vertically with dotted lines and an 'X' shape, representing the result of a Hidden/X-Ray fold.

projects.name: Arrows

steps.instruction: Fold Forward
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper is shown. An arrow indicates folding the top edge down to the bottom edge, creating a horizontal crease. The resulting shape is a rectangle. Another diagram shows the rectangle folded in half vertically, with a dashed line indicating the crease. A final diagram shows the paper folded in half vertically, with the right side folded over the left.

steps.instruction: Fold Behind
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper is shown. An arrow indicates folding the top edge down to the bottom edge, creating a horizontal crease. The resulting shape is a rectangle. Another diagram shows the rectangle folded in half vertically, with a dashed line indicating the crease. A final diagram shows the paper folded in half vertically, with the left side folded over the right.

steps.instruction: Fold And Unfold
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper is shown. An arrow indicates folding the top edge down to the bottom edge, creating a horizontal crease. The resulting shape is a rectangle. Another diagram shows the rectangle folded in half vertically, with a dashed line indicating the crease. A final diagram shows the paper unfolded, with a horizontal crease.

steps.instruction: Sink/Reverse/Push In
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper is shown. A downward pointing triangle symbol is shown, followed by a diamond shape with a dashed line across the top. An arrow indicates folding the top point down to the center. Another diagram shows the diamond shape with the top point folded down. A third diagram shows the paper folded in half vertically, with a dashed line. A fourth diagram shows the paper folded into a narrow rectangle with a diagonal crease.

steps.instruction: Turn Over
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper is shown. An arrow indicates turning the paper over. The resulting shape is a square.

steps.instruction: Rotate 90, 1/2 Turn, Ect.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper is shown. A circle with '1/2' inside and a curved arrow indicates a half turn. The resulting shape is a square. Another diagram shows a square piece of paper with the bottom right corner folded up. A final diagram shows a square piece of paper with the bottom right corner folded up and to the left.

steps.instruction: Repeat
steps.visual_description: A vertical line with a downward arrow is shown. A rectangle is shown. A diamond shape is shown with dashed lines indicating folds. Arrows indicate folding the sides inwards. A final diagram shows a kite-like shape with a vertical line down the center.

projects.finished_product_description: Instructions for folding various arrow shapes and related folds.

projects.name: Stretched Bird Base

steps.instruction: Start with a square piece of paper. Pre-crease by folding all four corners to the center, creating diagonal and horizontal/vertical creases.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with dashed lines indicating valley folds from each corner to the center, forming an 'X' and a '+' shape. Arrows point inwards from the edges, suggesting bringing the edges to the center.

steps.instruction: Open the paper and then fold the bottom point up to the top, and the side points inwards, forming a kite shape. The top layer is shown being opened up.
steps.visual_description: A partially folded shape, with the top layer being opened up from the center. Shaded areas indicate the folded-in parts. An arrow indicates the opening motion.

steps.instruction: Flatten the opened top layer, forming a diamond shape with two flaps pointing downwards. The top point is closed.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with two flaps pointing downwards. Dashed lines indicate potential future folds or existing creases.

steps.instruction: The top layer is shown with the side flaps being pulled outwards from the center.
steps.visual_description: The diamond shape from the previous step, with arrows indicating the side flaps being pulled outwards.

steps.instruction: Flatten the pulled-out side flaps. The top point is then folded downwards.
steps.visual_description: The shape with the side flaps extended horizontally. An arrow indicates the top point being folded downwards.

steps.instruction: The final 'Stretched Bird Base' is formed.
steps.visual_description: A flattened diamond shape with two points extending horizontally and a central vertical fold.

projects.finished_product_description: A fundamental origami base, the Stretched Bird Base, characterized by its flattened diamond shape with two horizontal points.

projects.name: Blintzed Bird Base

steps.instruction: Start with a square piece of paper. Fold all four corners to the center, creating a smaller square (Blintz Base).
steps.visual_description: A square with dashed lines indicating valley folds from each corner to the center, and arrows pointing inwards from the corners. The central shaded area represents the folded-in corners, forming a smaller square.

steps.instruction: With the Blintz Base, open the top layer from the center.
steps.visual_description: The Blintz Base with the top layer being opened upwards, indicated by an arrow.

steps.instruction: Flatten the opened top layer, forming a diamond shape with two flaps pointing downwards. Dashed lines indicate existing creases or future folds on these flaps. A small 'X' symbol is on the top point.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with two flaps pointing downwards. Dashed lines indicate existing creases. A small 'X' symbol is on the top point.

steps.instruction: The top layer is shown with the side flaps being pulled outwards from the center.
steps.visual_description: The diamond shape from the previous step, with arrows indicating the side flaps being pulled outwards. The 'X' symbol is still on the top point.

steps.instruction: Flatten the pulled-out side flaps. The top point is then folded downwards.
steps.visual_description: The shape with the side flaps extended horizontally. An arrow indicates the top point being folded downwards. The 'X' symbol is still on the top point.

steps.instruction: The final 'Blintzed Bird Base' is formed.
steps.visual_description: A flattened shape with a central vertical fold and two horizontal points, similar to the Stretched Bird Base but with a slightly different initial structure.

projects.finished_product_description: A fundamental origami base, the Blintzed Bird Base, which starts with a Blintz fold and results in a flattened shape with two horizontal points.

diagram_descriptions: A graphic illustration of two hands holding a sailboat. The top hand is black and appears to be forming a circle with its thumb and index finger, with the other fingers extended. The sailboat is depicted as a diamond shape divided into two triangles by a vertical line, with a rectangular base. The bottom hand is gray and is holding the base of the sailboat.
The text "THE ANNUAL COLLECTION" is printed in bold, black, sans-serif font at the bottom of the page.

projects.name: Man in the Moon

steps.instruction: Mountain crease twice in half, first horizontally and then vertically.
steps.visual_description: A dollar bill is shown with dashed lines indicating horizontal and vertical creases. Arrows indicate folding.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold on existing crease. The right half of the dollar should go behind the left half. Turn model 90.
steps.visual_description: A dollar bill is shown folded in half vertically. A circular arrow indicates turning the model 90 degrees. A 90 symbol is shown.

steps.instruction: Airplane fold from the top. The two valley folds should meet on the center vertical line.
steps.visual_description: A diagram shows the top of the folded dollar bill. Arrows indicate folding the top corners down to meet the center vertical line, forming an airplane fold.

steps.instruction: With the front layer, valley fold the raw edge from the bottom up to where the bottom ends of the airplane folds meet. Repeat the same procedure with the layer underneath. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: A diagram shows the model from the front. An arrow indicates folding the bottom edge upwards to meet the point where the airplane folds end. A horizontal dashed line indicates the fold line. A small diagram shows the model from the side with an arrow indicating a fold.

tips: Use a crisp dollar bill.
Completed moon is less than 1/8 the size of a regular dollar.
Model is a variation of the traditional boat.
projects.finished_product_description: A paper boat folded from a dollar bill, resembling a 'Man in the Moon'.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing a dollar bill being folded horizontally and vertically.
Diagram showing a dollar bill folded in half vertically and turned 90 degrees.
Diagram showing the top of the folded dollar bill with arrows indicating an airplane fold.
Diagram showing the front of the folded dollar bill with an arrow indicating a valley fold upwards.
Diagram showing the side view of the folded dollar bill with an arrow indicating a fold.

projects.name: Traditional Boat

steps.instruction: Valley fold again as shown. Repeat on the other side.
steps.visual_description: A paper model, shaped like a house with a triangular roof and rectangular base. The front layer of the rectangular base is valley folded upwards, indicated by a dashed line and an arrow pointing up and to the left. The fold line is parallel to the bottom edge.

steps.instruction: Get ready for a squash fold. Mountain fold along the center vertical line, while holding on to the top corners where the circles are. After that, the two bottom corners will meet. Turn model 90.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular paper model with a triangular top flap. Two small circles mark the top corners of the rectangular base. A vertical dashed line runs down the center. Two curved arrows at the bottom indicate the bottom corners being brought together. A circular arrow with '90' indicates rotating the model clockwise.

steps.instruction: You now see two flaps facing you. Valley fold those ends along the center vertical line. This step will make the next step easier. Repeat on the other side.
steps.visual_description: A diamond-shaped paper model with visible layers. A vertical dashed line runs down the center. Two horizontal arrows point towards the center from the left and right sides of the diamond, indicating valley folds of the outer flaps towards the center line.

steps.instruction: With the front layer, valley fold from the bottom to the top of the diamond. This is where you see Washington's nose. Repeat on the other side.
steps.visual_description: A diamond-shaped paper model. The bottom point of the front layer is valley folded upwards along a horizontal dashed line, indicated by an arrow pointing up. This fold creates a new horizontal edge near the top of the diamond.

steps.instruction: Do another squash. Mountain fold along the center vertical line, and then the bottom corners will meet. Turn model 90.
steps.visual_description: A triangular paper model, similar to the shape in step 6 but inverted. A vertical dashed line runs down the center. Two curved arrows at the bottom indicate the bottom corners being brought together. A circular arrow with '90' indicates rotating the model clockwise.

steps.instruction: Pull out the two ends that stand up around Washington's face. You will notice that the bottom will start to come forward. This will happen on both sides. As the boat stretches to its natural position, the valley folds will come automatically.
steps.visual_description: A diamond-shaped paper model with two prominent vertical flaps at the top. Two diagonal arrows point outwards from the sides of the model, indicating the pulling of the ends. The bottom of the model is shown expanding outwards with a curved line.

steps.instruction: The traditional boat is complete.
steps.visual_description: A completed origami boat model, viewed from the side. It has a flat bottom and two pointed ends, resembling a traditional paper boat.

projects.finished_product_description: A traditional origami paper boat.

projects.name: Origami Moon

steps.instruction: Turn the boat 90 and then do a crimp to taste. Repeat on the other side as well. The boat will start to bend into the shape of a moon.
steps.visual_description: The completed origami boat model from step 11, now rotated 90 degrees clockwise. A diagonal arrow points inwards from the top-right edge, indicating a crimp fold being made. A circular arrow with '90' indicates rotating the model clockwise.

steps.instruction: The moon is complete.
steps.visual_description: A completed origami moon model, showing a distinct crescent shape with a curved outer edge and a more pointed inner curve.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami model shaped like a crescent moon.

projects.name: $ Bill Butterfly

steps.instruction: Begin with a two dollar bill, greenside up. Precrease in half the long side then fold in half the short side and pinch the edges.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular piece of paper with a vertical dashed line down the center. Two curved arrows indicate folding the long sides towards the center. A horizontal dashed line with arrows indicates folding the short sides.

steps.instruction: Crimp, Using the precrease marks as guide lines. There are no definite points for the mountain folds.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle with a central vertical line. Dashed lines form a 'V' shape from the bottom center, extending upwards and outwards. Arrows indicate crimping along these lines.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold in half.
steps.visual_description: A partially folded piece of paper, showing a central vertical dashed line with small circles. The bottom edges are folded upwards. An arrow indicates a mountain fold along the central vertical line.

steps.instruction: Valley fold both sides along the angle bisectors.
steps.visual_description: A partially folded piece of paper, showing a triangular flap on the left side. Dashed lines indicate angle bisectors, and arrows show valley folds on both sides.

steps.instruction: Lift the top layer.
steps.visual_description: A folded piece of paper, showing a flap being lifted upwards from the top layer.

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: Origami folding sequence to create a butterfly.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami butterfly made from a dollar bill.

diagram_descriptions: Diagrams illustrating the origami folding steps for a dollar bill butterfly.

projects.name: Origami Bird

steps.instruction: Fold the top flap down diagonally, then fold the bottom edge up to meet the diagonal crease. Fold the right flap inwards.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with dashed lines indicating folds. The top flap is folded down diagonally, and the bottom edge is folded up to meet the crease. The right flap is folded inwards.

steps.instruction: Squash the center flap.
steps.visual_description: The origami model from step 4, with the center flap being squashed flat. It forms a triangular shape with layered flaps.

steps.instruction: Reverse fold the corners to shape the wings.
steps.visual_description: The origami model from step 6, with two corners being reverse folded outwards to form wing shapes. Arrows indicate the direction of the folds.

steps.instruction: Form the body with a pleat.
steps.visual_description: The origami model from step 7, with a pleat fold being made along the center to form the body. The model is elongated and has distinct wing sections.

steps.instruction: Turn over.
steps.visual_description: The origami model from step 8, now turned over to reveal the other side. A curved arrow indicates the turning action.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold the back wings and round the front wings, Making a pinch in the center to form a head.
steps.visual_description: The origami model from step 9, showing the back wings being mountain folded and the front wings rounded. A pinch is made in the center to form the head. The model resembles a bird with wings and a head.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami bird with distinct wings and a head.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing step 4 of origami bird folding, with dashed lines for folds and arrows indicating movement.
Diagram showing step 6, illustrating a squash fold on the center flap.
Diagram showing step 7, demonstrating reverse folds on corners to shape wings.
Diagram showing step 8, illustrating a pleat fold to form the body.
Diagram showing step 9, indicating to turn the model over.
Diagram showing step 10, detailing mountain folds for back wings, rounding of front wings, and a pinch for the head.
A drawing of a finished origami bird, showing its shape and details.

projects.name: Dollar Bill Octahedron

steps.instruction: Valley fold the corners to the center crease.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle with two diagonal dashed lines from the corners to the center horizontal crease. Arrows indicate folding the corners inward towards the center crease.

steps.instruction: Precrease. Open up flaps. Rotate model 180 and repeat steps 1 and 2.
steps.visual_description: A triangular shape formed by folding the corners. Arrows show opening up flaps and a circular arrow indicates rotating the model 180 degrees.

steps.instruction: Collapse sides by bringing the corners to the center while squashing the excess paper underneath.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle with dashed lines indicating folds. Arrows show the sides being brought inwards and squashed.

steps.instruction: Flap the sides towards the back. do not crease sharply.
steps.visual_description: Two triangular shapes connected at the top and bottom. Arrows indicate folding the sides towards the back. A dashed line shows where the fold occurs.

steps.instruction: Pleat the center portion. The center mountain fold should not be creased sharply.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular section with dashed vertical lines indicating pleats. Arrows show the pleating action.

steps.instruction: Reverse fold four times.
steps.visual_description: A side view of the model showing a triangular shape with arrows indicating reverse folds on four edges.

steps.instruction: Unfold the front and back (the folds from step 3).
steps.visual_description: A diamond-like shape with arrows indicating unfolding the front and back sections, revealing the folds made in step 3.

tips: Use a crisp dollar bill, green side up for a black model.
projects.finished_product_description: An octahedron constructed from a dollar bill.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing step 1: A rectangle with diagonal dashed lines from corners to center crease, with arrows indicating valley folds.
Diagram showing step 2: A triangular shape with flaps, arrows indicating opening flaps and a rotation.
Diagram showing step 3: A rectangle with dashed lines and arrows indicating collapsing sides.
Diagram showing step 4: Two connected triangles with arrows indicating folding sides towards the back.
Diagram showing step 5: A rectangular section with dashed vertical lines and arrows indicating pleating.
Diagram showing step 6: A side view of a triangular shape with arrows indicating reverse folds.
Diagram showing step 7: A diamond-like shape with arrows indicating unfolding.

projects.name: Dollar Bill Octahedron

steps.instruction: Fold the four flaps in towards the center.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular paper model with four flaps on the right side being folded inwards towards the center, indicated by arrows.

steps.instruction: Flip back two flaps so that model is symmetrical.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular paper model with two flaps being flipped back from the top, indicated by a curved arrow, to achieve symmetry.

steps.instruction: Collapse sides using the folds from step 3. The top left corner should be tucked into the pocket formed by the other side. Visa-versa for the bottom.
steps.visual_description: A square paper model showing internal fold lines and arrows indicating the collapsing of sides inwards. There are 'X' marks and small circles at specific points, and a prominent central vertical fold line.

steps.instruction: Make model 3-D by applying force from the top and bottom.
steps.visual_description: A 2D representation of an octahedron (two pyramids joined at their bases) with arrows indicating force being applied from the top and bottom to form a 3D shape.

steps.instruction: Completed "Dollar Bill Octahedron."
steps.visual_description: A detailed drawing of a completed 3D octahedron, with markings resembling a dollar bill, including text like 'HE U', 'THJ Note For All Deb', and numbers '941112'.

projects.finished_product_description: A 3D octahedron model made from a dollar bill.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram for step 8: A rectangular paper model with four flaps on the right side being folded inwards towards the center, indicated by arrows.
Diagram for step 9: A rectangular paper model with two flaps being flipped back from the top, indicated by a curved arrow, to achieve symmetry.

Diagram for step 10: A square paper model showing internal fold lines and arrows indicating the collapsing of sides inwards. There are 'X' marks and small circles at specific points, and a prominent central vertical fold line.
Diagram for step 11: A 2D representation of an octahedron (two pyramids joined at their bases) with arrows indicating force being applied from the top and bottom to form a 3D shape.
Diagram for step 12: A detailed drawing of a completed 3D octahedron, with markings resembling a dollar bill, including text like 'HE U', 'THJ Note For All Deb', and numbers '941112'.

projects.name: Crossing the Delaware

steps.instruction: Start with dollar bill, green side up. Precrease in half.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle with a dashed vertical line in the center. An arrow indicates folding the right side over to the left.

steps.instruction: Valley fold and unfold each upper corner to lower edge. Turn over.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle with dashed lines from the top corners to the center of the bottom edge. Arrows indicate folding the top corners down to the bottom edge.

steps.instruction: Valley fold bottom edge to George's chin.

steps.instruction: Valley fold down on existing crease.

steps.instruction: Valley fold up flush with the bottom edge.

projects.name: Paper Boat

steps.instruction: Pull out the hidden edge and squash.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a folded paper shape with an arrow indicating to pull out an edge and flatten it.

steps.instruction: Fold to the left. The extended portion will end up pointing to the left (see step 9).

steps.instruction: Repeat steps 5-7 on the right side.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a folded paper shape, with dotted lines indicating where to repeat folds on the right side.

steps.instruction: Tuck left flap under the top flap on existing crease. Left loose flap comes forward (see step 11).

steps.instruction: Valley fold down the two layers.

steps.instruction: Reverse fold the top. Fold the bottom flaps into the pocket.

projects.name: Dollar Bill Star

materials.dimensions: rectangular (derived from A4 paper after removing a square)

steps.instruction: Fold bottom left to top right.
steps.visual_description: A horizontal rectangular piece of paper with a diagonal dashed line from the bottom-left corner to the top-right corner, and an arrow indicating the fold direction.

steps.instruction: Fold in half again.
steps.visual_description: A folded paper shape, resulting from the previous fold, showing a new diagonal dashed line and an arrow indicating a subsequent fold.

steps.instruction: Fold down.
steps.visual_description: The folded paper from step 2, with a top flap folded down along a horizontal dashed line, indicated by a curved arrow.

steps.instruction: Fold up along the edge underneath.
steps.visual_description: The folded paper from step 3, showing a flap being folded upwards along an existing edge, indicated by a dashed line and an arrow.

steps.instruction: Crease where shown. Unfold entire model.
steps.visual_description: The folded paper from step 4, with a small dashed line indicating a new crease, and an arrow showing the creasing action.

steps.instruction: Using the creases shown, form a crimp.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular piece of paper, now unfolded, showing multiple diagonal and horizontal dashed lines representing creases. Curved arrows indicate the action of forming a crimp using these creases.

steps.instruction: Fold the triangular flap to the left.
steps.visual_description: A partially folded module, showing a triangular flap on the right side, indicated by a dashed line and an arrow, being folded to the left.

steps.instruction: Completed module.
steps.visual_description: The completed single module, a compact, pointed, and somewhat triangular folded paper shape.

steps.instruction: Place unit 2 on flap folded in step 7. Fold both flaps together and lock as shown. Repeat with the other 2 modules.
steps.visual_description: A diagram illustrating the assembly of two modules. One module is placed on top of a flap of another, with dashed lines and arrows showing how the flaps are folded together and interlocked.

tips: Four modules form a 7" star.
Start green side up for a green star.
A square can be removed from A4 paper; the remainder can be used for this model.
projects.finished_product_description: A 7-inch four-pointed star, assembled from four interlocked paper modules.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 1: A horizontal rectangular piece of paper with a diagonal dashed line from the bottom-left corner to the top-right corner, and an arrow indicating the fold direction.
Diagram 2: A folded paper shape, resulting from the previous fold, showing a new diagonal dashed line and an arrow indicating a subsequent fold.
Diagram 3: The folded paper from step 2, with a top flap folded down along a horizontal dashed line, indicated by a curved arrow.
Diagram 4: The folded paper from step 3, showing a flap being folded upwards along an existing edge, indicated by a dashed line and an arrow.
Diagram 5: The folded paper from step 4, with a small dashed line indicating a new crease, and an arrow showing the creasing action.

Diagram 6: A rectangular piece of paper, now unfolded, showing multiple diagonal and horizontal dashed lines representing creases. Curved arrows indicate the action of forming a crimp using these creases.
Diagram 7: A partially folded module, showing a triangular flap on the right side, indicated by a dashed line and an arrow, being folded to the left.
Diagram 8: The completed single module, a compact, pointed, and somewhat triangular folded paper shape.

Diagram 9 (interlocking): A diagram illustrating the assembly of two modules. One module is placed on top of a flap of another, with dashed lines and arrows showing how the flaps are folded together and interlocked.
Final Product Diagram: A shaded, four-pointed star, composed of four interlocked modules. The star has a central square area and four radiating points, with visible fold lines.

projects.name: Bill Dutch Girl

materials.color: green (for figure), white border (for hat brim and skirt edging)

steps.instruction: Start green side up for a green figure. Precrease and collapse model into rough skirt, arms, and head/hat.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle with dashed lines indicating precreases. The top section has diagonal dashed lines forming a triangle, and a vertical dashed line extending down. The bottom section has dashed lines forming a diamond shape.

steps.instruction: Collapse finished. Squash front and back flaps/arms toward back of model.
steps.visual_description: Diagram 2a shows the model in progress of collapsing. Diagram 2b shows the model after the front and back flaps/arms have been squashed toward the back.

steps.instruction: Petal fold front and back arms forward.
steps.visual_description: The model with the front and back arms being petal folded forward.

steps.instruction: Open out inside arms while pulling head/hat to right.
steps.visual_description: The model with the inside arms being opened out and the head/hat being pulled to the right.

steps.instruction: Valley fold arms down over skirt.
steps.visual_description: The model with the arms being valley folded down over the skirt.

tips: This model effectively uses the white border of a dollar bill to become a fancy hat brim and skirt edging.

steps.instruction: Reverse fold head/hat toward front.

steps.instruction: White side up. Hold paper in a diamond shape and valley crease in thirds.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with dashed lines indicating thirds horizontally and vertically. Arrows show folding inwards.

steps.instruction: With the top and bottom sections, valley crease in thirds again.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with multiple dashed lines indicating thirds. Arrows show folding inwards on the top and bottom sections.

steps.instruction: Make two vertical valley creases. Your landmarks are where the first horizontal creases on the top and bottom end.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with vertical dashed lines. The diagram shows the paper being folded vertically.

steps.instruction: With the top third of the diamond shape, make four mountain folds as shown in the diagram. Two of them will cross the box in the center diagonally, and the other two will be parallel to the crosses in the box. Repeat this procedure with the bottom third.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with a grid of dashed and solid lines. Arrows indicate mountain folds being made on the top section, creating diagonal and parallel creases within a central box. A similar process is implied for the bottom section.

steps.instruction: Add two valley folds; one will go at the bottom of the box in the center, and the other will extend from the center of the box to the point at the top. Repeat this procedure on the bottom. By reinforcing the creases as shown, collapse the model. Refer to step 6 for final result.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with new valley folds indicated by dashed lines. Arrows show folding inwards from the bottom and top center. The diagram suggests collapsing the paper along these folds.

steps.instruction: On top flap only, mountain fold as shown. Then make two valley folds from the top as shown in the diagram. The first valley fold will form Santa's beard.
steps.visual_description: A partially folded paper shape. Arrows indicate a mountain fold on the top flap, followed by two valley folds from the top, shaping what appears to be Santa's beard.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing the first step of folding a diamond shape into thirds horizontally and vertically, with arrows indicating inward folds.
Diagram showing the second step of folding the top and bottom sections of the diamond shape into thirds, with arrows indicating inward folds.
Diagram showing the third step of making two vertical valley creases on the diamond shape.

Diagram showing the fourth step of making four mountain folds on the top third of the diamond shape, creating diagonal and parallel creases within a central box. A similar process is implied for the bottom third.
Diagram showing the fifth step of adding two valley folds, one from the bottom center and one from the top center, and collapsing the model.
Diagram showing the sixth step of making a mountain fold on the top flap and two valley folds from the top to form Santa's beard.

projects.name: Santa Claus Origami

steps.instruction: Skinny the two ends on the sides. Do it in the front and on the back. This will form Santa's arms.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows a partially folded origami figure with two pointed flaps on each side, labeled as 'Santa's arms'.

steps.instruction: Using the back layer, make two valley creases. The one on the right should match the one on the left for thickness. Next, mountain fold on the point where the two valley creases intersect. After that, valley fold on the two existing creases.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows the back of the origami figure. Arrows indicate making two valley folds, then a mountain fold at the intersection point, and finally valley folds along existing creases.

steps.instruction: Bring the back layer up over the front layer. The two ends will cover the beard partially. To get rid of the point at the top, mountain fold it in half. The head is now complete. Next, valley fold over the side ends and bring them forward. This will finish the arms.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows the back layer being folded over the front. An arrow indicates a mountain fold at the top point. Another diagram shows the side ends being folded forward to complete the arms.

steps.instruction: Santa is complete.
steps.visual_description: A finished origami figure of Santa Claus, shown from the front. It has a triangular hat, a white beard area, and a red body with folded arms.

projects.finished_product_description: A completed origami figure of Santa Claus.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing step 7 of Santa origami: folding the sides to form arms.
Diagram showing step 8 of Santa origami: making valley and mountain folds on the back layer.
Diagram showing step 9 of Santa origami: folding the back layer over the front and completing the arms.
Diagram showing the finished origami Santa Claus figure.

Diagram 4 illustrates 'judgement folds' where flaps are folded down and the bottom is folded up.
Diagram 5 shows a further step in shaping the model.
Diagram 6 shows the completed origami model.

projects.name: Cardinal

materials.color: red for cardinal, brown for friar, black for nun

steps.instruction: Crease vertically. Pinch in 1/2 and 1/4 to locate 1/8 crease.
steps.visual_description: A square with dashed lines indicating vertical and horizontal creases. A small arrow indicates a pinching motion. A small diamond shape is shown at the top right corner.

steps.instruction: Valley fold and unfold. Mountain fold and unfold. Simultaneously fold the valley and mountain creases in. The model will now be flat. Fold the two sides on the existing crease. Squash the remaining part on existing creases.
steps.technique: valley fold, mountain fold, squash fold
steps.visual_description: A square with radiating dashed and solid lines from the center. Arrows indicate folding actions. The resulting shape is a flat diamond with folded edges.

steps.instruction: Valley fold (one flap will cover the other).
steps.visual_description: A shape resembling a stylized person with two flaps in the front. An arrow indicates folding one flap over the other.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold. Repeat on right side.
steps.visual_description: The figure from step 3, with additional folds on the sides indicated by dashed lines and arrows. The figure starts to take on a more three-dimensional form.

steps.instruction: Fold up feet.
steps.visual_description: The figure from step 4, with the bottom sections folded upwards to form feet.
The completed cardinal figure, standing upright.

tips: 6" paper makes a model 5-1/2" tall.
Use red paper for a cardinal, brown for a friar, and black for a nun.
projects.finished_product_description: A paper origami cardinal.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing the initial steps of folding a square piece of paper, with dashed lines indicating creases and fold directions.
Diagram showing a square with radiating fold lines, illustrating valley and mountain folds.
Diagram showing a partially folded figure with an arrow indicating a valley fold.
Diagram showing the figure from the previous step with additional mountain folds indicated.
Diagram showing the figure with the bottom sections folded up to form feet.
Diagram showing the final completed origami cardinal.

projects.name: Sioux Indian

materials.notes: Use very thin paper. Foil works well. Face is white and the headdress is gold.

steps.instruction: Start with a colored preliminary base.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with dashed lines indicating folds. A vertical dashed line from top to bottom, and two dashed lines from the top point to the center of the horizontal midline. Arrows indicate folding the top point down to the center and then folding the sides to the center.

steps.instruction: Fold the top point down to the center.
steps.visual_description: The diamond shape from step 1, with the top point folded down to the center. A vertical solid line shows the center crease, and arrows indicate folding the sides to the center.

steps.instruction: Fold the sides to the center.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 2, with the sides folded to the center, creating a kite-like shape. A vertical solid line shows the center crease.

steps.instruction: Fold the top flaps down.
steps.visual_description: The kite shape from step 3. Dashed lines indicate folding the top two flaps down along diagonal lines. Arrows show the direction of the folds.

steps.instruction: Fold the sides inward.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 4. The sides are folded inward along dashed lines. Arrows indicate the direction of the folds.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom flaps outward.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 5. The bottom two flaps are folded outward along diagonal lines. Arrows indicate the direction of the folds.

steps.instruction: Fold the top section to the right.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 6. The top section is folded over to the right, creating a fan-like effect with many pleats. An arrow indicates the direction of the fold.

steps.instruction: The first crease to the left and the right of the center crease should be reversed to mountain folds.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 7, showing the left side. The creases to the left and right of the center are being reversed into mountain folds. The resulting shape has a layered, fan-like appearance on the left side.

steps.instruction: Create a fan effect on both sides.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 8, now showing both sides. The left side has been folded into a fan effect. The right side is being folded to match, with a 180-degree rotation indicated by arrows.

steps.instruction: Valley fold top flap only to the bottom.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 9. The top flap is folded down to the bottom along a dashed horizontal line. An arrow indicates the direction of the fold.

steps.instruction: Valley crease as shown before unfolding.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 10. A valley crease is shown as indicated by the dashed line, before unfolding. Arrows indicate unfolding.

tips: Editor's note: 10" paper makes a 3" by 5" model. This foil works well. Face is white and the headdress is gold.
projects.finished_product_description: A folded paper model of a Sioux Indian figure.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing 11 steps for folding a Sioux Indian paper craft.
Step 1: Diamond shape with preliminary folds indicated.
Step 2: Top point folded down, sides folded to center.
Step 3: Sides folded to center, creating a kite shape.
Step 4: Top flaps folded down along diagonal lines.
Step 5: Sides folded inward.
Step 6: Bottom flaps folded outward.
Step 7: Top section folded to the right, creating a fan.
Step 8: Left side showing reversal of creases to mountain folds.
Step 9: Both sides folded into a fan effect, with rotation indicated.
Step 10: Top flap valley folded to the bottom.
Step 11: Valley crease shown before unfolding.

projects.name: Origami Face

steps.instruction: Fold the top point down to the center line, then fold the two side edges to the center line.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with dashed lines indicating folds. Arrows show the top point folding down and the side edges folding inwards.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom point up to meet the horizontal crease.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 12, now with the bottom point folded upwards. An arrow indicates the fold.

steps.instruction: Fold the two bottom corners inwards to create the nose.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 13, with the bottom corners folded inwards to form a nose shape. A circular arrow indicates the folding action.

steps.instruction: Fold the top flaps down.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 14, with the top triangular flaps folded downwards.

steps.instruction: Fold the sides of the nose inwards.
steps.visual_description: A close-up of the nose area. Arrows indicate the sides of the nose being folded inwards. A horizontal arrow points to the left, indicating the direction of this step.

steps.instruction: Fold the entire model in half, bringing the right side over to the left.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 16, shown being folded in half from right to left. A large curved arrow indicates the folding motion.

steps.instruction: Pleat the top section to form the hair.
steps.visual_description: The folded model, with the top section being pleated into a fan shape. A small circular symbol indicates a pleating action.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom point upwards.
steps.visual_description: The pleated model, with a dashed line indicating a fold. An arrow shows the bottom point folding upwards.

steps.instruction: Fold the sides of the bottom section inwards.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 19. Arrows indicate the sides of the bottom section being folded inwards. Dashed lines show the fold lines.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom flaps outwards.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 20. Arrows indicate the bottom flaps being folded outwards. A small circular symbol indicates a folding action.

tips: A little past here (on both sides).
The distance from the face to the crimp fold is the same as the distance from the tip of the nose to the first crease.
projects.finished_product_description: An origami face with pleated hair and a distinct nose and mouth.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing steps 12-15 of an origami face construction, illustrating folds for the head and nose.
Diagram showing steps 16-18 of an origami face construction, detailing nose shaping and hair pleating.
Diagram showing steps 19-21 of an origami face construction, focusing on shaping the lower part of the face and chin.

projects.name: Alfred Hitchcock

steps.instruction: Start with a colored preliminary base. Petal fold.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper folded into a preliminary base. A dashed line indicates a fold, and an arrow shows a flap being lifted and folded.
The preliminary base is shown with two flaps folded upwards, forming a kite-like shape. The center is creased.
Two flaps are shown, one on top of the other, with dashed lines indicating folds. The word 'Squash' is written next to the diagram.

steps.instruction: Valley fold top layer.
steps.visual_description: The top layer of the previous step is shown being folded down with a dashed line and an arrow indicating the fold direction.

steps.instruction: Squash fold.
steps.visual_description: The paper is shown in a new configuration after a squash fold. Dashed lines indicate folds, and an arrow shows the direction of the fold.

tips: 6" paper makes a 4" tall model.

steps.instruction: Petal fold.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a folded paper shape with arrows indicating a petal fold.

steps.instruction: Fold top two layers to left.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a folded paper shape with arrows indicating the top two layers are folded to the left.

steps.instruction: Petal fold.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a folded paper shape with arrows indicating a petal fold.

steps.instruction: Fold entire model in half.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a folded paper shape with an arrow indicating the entire model is folded in half.

steps.instruction: Rotate 180 degrees.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a folded paper shape with a circular arrow indicating a 180-degree rotation.

steps.instruction: Crimp fold to form feet.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the bottom of a folded paper shape with dashed lines and arrows indicating a crimp fold to form feet.

steps.instruction: Valley fold top layer to form the arm. Repeat behind. See step 13 to locate this fold; the chin must be clearly delineated.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a folded paper shape with a dashed line and an arrow indicating a valley fold to form an arm. The text refers to step 13 for locating the fold and delineating the chin.

projects.name: Penguin

steps.instruction: Inside reverse fold both arms; the tip of the arm goes a bit past the belly. Inside reverse fold the head.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows a figure with arms being folded inwards and upwards. A curved arrow indicates the direction of the fold for one arm. Dashed lines indicate where the folds will occur. Another dashed line indicates a fold for the head.

steps.instruction: Squash fold to form hands. Repeat on other side.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows the figure from step 13, with the tips of the arms being flattened to form hands. Small dashed lines indicate the creases for the squash fold.

steps.instruction: Open up the head and look inside; see step 16.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows the figure from step 14, with an arrow indicating the head section is being opened. The head section is shown from the side.

steps.instruction: Fold up nose and close head.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows a circular view of the head section of the figure. It depicts two triangular flaps that are folded upwards to form a nose, and then the head is closed.

steps.instruction: Reverse fold back of head; mountain fold front of head; repeat on other side. Mountain fold tip of belly; repeat on other side.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows the figure from step 15, now with the head formed. Dashed lines indicate folds on the back and front of the head. Further dashed lines indicate folds on the tip of the belly.
Diagram shows the completed figure, which resembles a penguin.

projects.finished_product_description: A paper craft figure of a penguin.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing step 13 of origami: inside reverse fold of arms and head.
Diagram showing step 14 of origami: squash fold to form hands.
Diagram showing step 15 of origami: opening the head section.
Diagram showing step 16 of origami: folding the nose and closing the head.
Diagram showing step 17 of origami: reverse and mountain folds for head and belly.
Diagram showing step 18 of origami: the completed penguin figure.

projects.name: After the Bath

materials.color: white on one side, colored on the other

steps.instruction: Start white side up for a white figure with colored hair wrapped in a colored towel. Valley crease one corner to the opposite corner. Turn model over.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper, white side up, with a dashed line indicating a valley crease from the top-left corner to the bottom-right corner. A curved arrow shows the direction of the fold.

steps.instruction: Colored side up, valley crease the remaining two corners together.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper, colored side up, with a vertical dashed line down the center. A curved arrow indicates folding the right side over to the left along this line.

steps.instruction: Bring each side in to lay along the center valley crease and pinch it where it meets the mountain crease.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with a vertical and horizontal center line. Four curved arrows indicate folding the four corners inwards towards the center, along lines that meet the center creases. Small 'x' marks are at the intersection of the creases and where the folds meet.

steps.instruction: Lay each side along the pinches just made and valley crease to the center mountain line.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with a vertical and horizontal center line. Four dashed lines extend from the corners towards the center, forming smaller triangles at each corner. Four curved arrows indicate folding these smaller triangles inwards. The notation '4' is present near the corners.

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: Follow folding instructions to create the figure.

projects.finished_product_description: A white figure with colored hair wrapped in a colored towel.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 1 shows a square sheet of paper with a diagonal dashed line from top-left to bottom-right, and a curved arrow indicating a fold.
Diagram 2 shows a square sheet of paper with a vertical dashed line down the center, and a curved arrow indicating a fold from right to left.

Diagram 3 shows a square sheet of paper with a vertical and horizontal center line. Four curved arrows indicate folding the four corners inwards towards the center, along lines that meet the center creases. Small 'x' marks are at the intersection of the creases and where the folds meet.

Diagram 4 shows a square sheet of paper with a vertical and horizontal center line. Four dashed lines extend from the corners towards the center, forming smaller triangles at each corner. Four curved arrows indicate folding these smaller triangles inwards. The notation '4' is present near the corners.

projects.name: Rabbit

steps.instruction: Valley crease top and bottom corners to the center mountain line, stopping the creases where they cross the nearest valley lines. Make two valley creases parallel to the center line to join these crossing points.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with a horizontal center line and two vertical dashed lines. The top and bottom corners are folded inwards towards the center line, with creases stopping at diagonal valley lines. Two new valley creases are shown parallel to the center line, connecting the points where the corner folds meet the diagonal valley lines.

steps.instruction: Collapse the model along existing creases, bringing the left corner over to lay on top of the right corner. New mountain creases will form top and bottom as you press the model flat.
steps.visual_description: The diamond shape from step 5 is shown collapsing. The left side is folded over to the right side, with arrows indicating the direction of the fold. The model is being pressed flat, and new creases are forming at the top and bottom.

steps.instruction: Valley fold top right flap to line up with top and bottom wings (as far as possible), tucking in top and bottom edges.
steps.visual_description: A side view of the collapsed model. The top right flap is being folded upwards and inwards, aligning with the edges of the 'wings' of the model. Arrows indicate the fold direction and tucking action.

steps.instruction: Rabbit fold top flap and lay point upwards.
steps.visual_description: A side view of the model, showing the top flap being folded upwards to form the rabbit's ear. An arrow indicates the upward fold.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold model in half, letting rabbit ear stand straight up.
steps.visual_description: A side view of the model being folded in half along its vertical axis. The rabbit ear is shown standing upright.

projects.finished_product_description: A folded paper rabbit.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing step 5 of folding a diamond shape inwards.
Diagram showing the model from step 5 collapsing inwards.
Diagram showing a flap being folded upwards and inwards.
Diagram showing a flap being folded upwards to form an ear.
Diagram showing the model being folded in half vertically.

projects.name: Origami Towel Animal

steps.instruction: Squash rabbit ear down to lay on top of model.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing a model with a flap being folded down and flattened.

steps.instruction: Valley fold squash flap up, opening out sides to lay flat. This will be the head of the model.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing a flap being folded upwards and then flattened outwards to form a head shape.

steps.instruction: Turn model over.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing the model being flipped over.

steps.instruction: Bottom two flaps will be legs. Pull top leg to left a little, making a mountain fold in the side flap, which will become the towel wrap.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing the bottom flaps being pulled down to form legs, and a side flap being folded to create a wrap.

steps.instruction: Widen the towel by bringing down the edge from behind. Reverse the side edges of the head to create colored hair; work the left side from the second crease and the right side from the first crease to achieve an asymmetric look. Crimp legs as shown.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing the towel being widened, the head's side edges being reversed to form hair, and the legs being crimped.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami animal resembling a towel, possibly a rabbit or similar creature, with legs and a head.

diagram_descriptions: Page number 24.
Diagram showing step 10: A model with a flap being folded down and flattened.
Diagram showing step 11: A flap being folded upwards and then flattened outwards to form a head shape.
Diagram showing step 12: The model being flipped over.
Diagram showing step 13: Bottom flaps being pulled down to form legs, and a side flap being folded to create a wrap.
Diagram showing step 14: The towel being widened, the head's side edges being reversed to form hair, and the legs being crimped.

projects.name: Origami Towel Figure

steps.instruction: Round the back of each knee with a mountain fold that squashes in the back. Lock feet in place with crimps. Skinny the towel (and create a hand that appears later) with a valley fold and then a mountain fold. Valley fold the hair in the right side for a better shape.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows an origami figure with detailed folds at the knees and feet. The towel is being folded to create a hand shape. The hair is also being folded.

steps.instruction: Valley fold towel over body.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows an origami figure with the towel folded over its body.

steps.instruction: Finish hair with valley fold that squashes to one side. Finish the towel with a mountain and two valley folds as indicated: a white hand will appear at the edge of the wrap.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows two origami figures. The figure on the left shows the hair being folded. The figure on the right shows the towel folded to reveal a hand at the edge of the wrap.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami figure resembling a person, possibly holding a towel or wearing a wrap.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing the process of folding an origami figure, illustrating steps 15, 16, and 17.
Diagram 15 shows detailed folds at the knees and feet, and the initial folding of the towel and hair.
Diagram 16 shows the towel folded over the body.
Diagram 17 shows the final shaping of the hair and the towel, revealing a hand.

projects.name: The Gossips

materials.color: white with colored hair and dress

steps.instruction: Start colored side up for a white figure with colored hair and dress. Valley crease the top left corner down to the opposite corner.
steps.visual_description: A square with a dashed line from the top-left to the bottom-right corner. An arrow indicates folding the top-left corner down to the bottom-right corner, creating a triangle with a smaller triangle on top.

steps.instruction: Mountain crease to the middle diagonal to define the bottom left quarter. Valley crease to the middle diagonal to define the right and upper quarter.
steps.visual_description: A square with a diagonal line from top-left to bottom-right. Dashed horizontal and vertical lines divide the square into quarters. Arrows indicate mountain folds along the diagonal in the bottom-left quarter and valley folds along the diagonal in the top-right quarter.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the model in half along the existing diagonal crease.
steps.visual_description: A square with a diagonal crease from top-left to bottom-right. A vertical line is drawn from the midpoint of the top edge to the diagonal. A horizontal line is drawn from the midpoint of the left edge to the diagonal. An arrow indicates folding the model in half along the diagonal crease.

steps.instruction: Valley fold right corner from the bottom mountain crease to the top fold near the top point. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: A triangular shape formed by previous folds. A dashed line indicates a mountain crease. An arrow shows folding the right corner to meet the top fold near the top point.

tips: A 6" square makes a figure approximately 4-1/2" tall.
projects.finished_product_description: A figure described as 'The Gossips'.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 1: Shows a square with a dashed diagonal line and arrows indicating a valley fold of the top-left corner to the bottom-right corner.

Diagram 2: Shows a square divided into quarters by dashed lines. A solid diagonal line is present. Arrows indicate mountain folds in the bottom-left quarter and valley folds in the top-right quarter along the diagonal.

Diagram 3: Shows a square with a diagonal crease. Vertical and horizontal lines are drawn from the midpoints of the edges to the diagonal. An arrow indicates folding the model in half along the diagonal crease.
Diagram 4: Shows a triangular shape with a dashed mountain crease line. An arrow indicates a valley fold of the right corner to the top fold near the top point.

projects.name: Paper Doll

steps.instruction: Reverse fold along existing mountain crease.
steps.visual_description: A triangular shape with a dashed line indicating a mountain crease and a solid line indicating a valley crease. An arrow shows the direction of the fold.

steps.instruction: The model is now colored with an exposed white triangle. This triangle will be the woman's bust. The top point will become her head. The bottom part of the model will be her dress and arms. Crimp head forward, letting top flap swivel out so model will lay flat.
steps.visual_description: A more complex folded shape, showing the result of step 5. A white triangle is visible at the top. Dotted lines and arrows indicate further folding and manipulation of flaps to form the head, bust, dress, and arms. The overall shape is becoming more figure-like.

steps.instruction: Outside reverse the back point of the dress to lay along the center diagonal edge. This reverse fold will be perpendicular to the diagonal edge and will divide the bottom straight edge in half.
steps.visual_description: A triangular shape representing the lower part of the figure. A dashed line indicates the center diagonal edge. An arrow shows an outside reverse fold being made at the back point of the dress, aligning it with the diagonal edge. Brackets indicate the bottom straight edge being divided in half.

steps.instruction: Bend the figure forward in a crimp while at the same time sinking the back and valley folding the top and back flaps toward the dress to form white arms. The point where all these folds meet will be the woman's elbow (*).
steps.visual_description: A detailed view of the upper part of the figure. Arrows and dotted lines indicate bending the figure forward and sinking/folding flaps to create arms. The point where multiple folds converge is highlighted, indicating the elbow.

projects.finished_product_description: A paper doll figure resembling a woman.

projects.name: Cherub

steps.instruction: Start with a bird base, ensuring the white side is outside.
steps.visual_description: A bird base with the top point facing upwards. The front layers are slightly fanned out, showing multiple layers of paper.

steps.instruction: Fold the top layer of the right front flap inwards along a diagonal crease, aligning it with the vertical center line. Crease firmly.
steps.visual_description: The bird base from step 1, with an arrow indicating the right flap being folded inwards towards the center.

steps.instruction: Repeat the fold from step 2 on the left front flap, aligning it with the vertical center line.
steps.visual_description: The bird base with both the right and left front flaps folded inwards, forming a kite-like shape at the top. An arrow indicates the left flap being folded.

steps.instruction: Unfold the two previous folds (from steps 2 and 3) back to their original positions.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 3, with the two side flaps unfolded, revealing the crease lines.

steps.instruction: Perform a petal fold on the top section. Open the layers and flatten the top point downwards along the existing creases.
steps.visual_description: The top point of the model is being opened and flattened. Dotted lines show the internal creases, and an arrow indicates the flattening action.

steps.instruction: Complete the petal fold, flattening the top section into a diamond shape.
steps.visual_description: The top section is now fully flattened, forming a distinct diamond shape at the top of the model.

steps.instruction: Squash fold the top point downwards. Open the layers and flatten the point, creating a new crease.
steps.visual_description: The top point of the diamond is being folded down and flattened. A dotted line indicates the new crease, and an arrow shows the direction of the fold.

steps.instruction: Turn the model over and repeat the squash fold on the top point of the back layer.
steps.visual_description: The model is shown from the back, with the top point being squash-folded downwards, similar to step 7.

steps.instruction: Fold the side flaps of the top diamond inwards along the existing creases.
steps.visual_description: The side flaps of the top diamond are folded inwards. Arrows indicate the direction of the folds.

steps.instruction: Turn the model over and repeat the side folds on the back layer.
steps.visual_description: The model is shown from the back, with the side flaps being folded inwards, similar to step 9.

steps.instruction: Open the top layer and perform an inside reverse fold on the point, folding it upwards to create a small 'head' or 'wing' feature.
steps.visual_description: The top layer is opened, and the point is reverse-folded upwards. Dotted lines show the internal folds, and an arrow indicates the outward direction of the fold.

steps.instruction: Perform a sink fold on the top point. Push the point inwards and flatten it, creating an indentation.
steps.visual_description: The top point is pushed inwards and flattened. An arrow indicates the sinking action.

steps.instruction: Perform outside reverse folds on the two side points, folding them outwards to form the wings.
steps.visual_description: The two side points are reverse-folded outwards. Arrows indicate the direction of the folds.

steps.instruction: Perform inside reverse folds on the tips of the newly formed wings, folding them inwards to shape them.
steps.visual_description: The tips of the wings are reverse-folded inwards. An arrow indicates the fold.

tips: Use white and gold square paper.
Start with a bird base, ensuring the white side is outside.

projects.name: Three Men in a Boat

steps.instruction: Fold the paper diagonally in half, then unfold. Fold diagonally in half the other way, then unfold.
steps.visual_description: A square with two dashed diagonal lines forming an 'X'.

steps.instruction: Fold the paper in half horizontally, then unfold. Fold in half vertically, then unfold.
steps.visual_description: A square with two dashed diagonal lines forming an 'X' and two dashed horizontal and vertical lines forming a '+'. The horizontal and vertical lines are shorter than the diagonals.

steps.instruction: Bring the four corners to the center point.
steps.visual_description: A square with dashed lines indicating folds from the corners to the center. The center point is marked with a '+'. Arrows show the corners being folded inwards.

steps.instruction: Fold the top and bottom edges to the center line.
steps.visual_description: A square with dashed lines indicating folds from the top and bottom edges to the center horizontal line. Arrows show the edges being folded inwards. The left and right edges are also folded to the center vertical line.

steps.instruction: Fold the top and bottom edges to the center line.
steps.visual_description: A shaded square with dashed lines indicating folds from the top and bottom edges to the center horizontal line. Arrows show the edges being folded inwards. The left and right edges are also folded to the center vertical line.

steps.instruction: Fold the four corners to the center.
steps.visual_description: A shaded square with dashed lines indicating folds from the four corners to the center. Arrows show the corners being folded inwards.

steps.instruction: Fold the top and bottom edges to the center line.
steps.visual_description: A shaded square with dashed lines indicating folds from the top and bottom edges to the center horizontal line. Arrows show the edges being folded inwards. The left and right edges are also folded to the center vertical line.

steps.instruction: Label points A, B, C, D on the corners.
steps.visual_description: A shaded square with corners labeled A, B, C, D. The outer edges are folded inwards.

steps.instruction: Unfold the last folds.
steps.visual_description: A corner of a square, showing dashed lines from previous folds. Points A, B, C, D are indicated. An eye symbol is shown.

steps.instruction: Fold the top layer of the right edge to the center line.
steps.visual_description: A corner of a square, showing dashed lines. The top layer of the right edge is folded to the center line. An arrow indicates the fold. An eye symbol is shown.

steps.instruction: Fold the top layer of the left edge to the center line.
steps.visual_description: A corner of a square, showing dashed lines. The top layer of the left edge is folded to the center line. An arrow indicates the fold. An eye symbol is shown.

steps.instruction: Fold the top flap down.
steps.visual_description: A corner of a square, showing folded layers. The top flap is folded down. An arrow indicates the fold. An eye symbol is shown.

projects.name: Baby Bottle

steps.instruction: Color side up. Valley fold 1/3 of the way up from the bottom, then valley fold along the center.
dimensions_mentioned: 1/3 of the way up from the bottom
steps.visual_description: A square is shown with a shaded lower triangle. Arrows indicate folding up 1/3 from the bottom and then folding along the center line. A bracket indicates the 1/3 fold.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the right end over to center and reverse fold the left end to center.
steps.visual_description: A triangular shape is shown. Arrows indicate folding the right side to the center and the left side to the center with a reverse fold.

steps.instruction: Valley fold over in thirds.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular shape is shown with dashed lines indicating thirds. Arrows indicate folding the sides inward.

steps.instruction: Larger view of the top. Mountain, then valley fold in a pleat.
steps.visual_description: A close-up of the top of the paper shows a mountain fold followed by a valley fold to create a pleat.

projects.finished_product_description: A baby bottle shape made from folded paper.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing the initial square and the first fold.
Diagram showing the result of step 1, turned over.
Diagram showing the result of step 2.
Diagram showing the result of step 3.
Diagram showing the result of step 3, with a larger view of the top.
Diagram showing the result of step 4, with a larger view of the top.

projects.name: Baby Bottle

steps.instruction: Valley fold over the side corners underneath the colored triangles.
steps.visual_description: A flat, folded paper shape resembling an envelope flap, with two triangular flaps at the bottom corners being folded inwards and downwards.

steps.instruction: Valley fold a line intersecting the top of the two colored triangles, then mountain fold above to form a pleat.
steps.visual_description: The same paper shape as step 5, now with a horizontal dashed line across the top of the two colored triangles. An arrow indicates folding along this line, and another arrow shows folding the section above this line upwards to create a pleat.

steps.instruction: On the top white triangle, valley fold the two ends over to form the nipple of the baby bottle. While this is happening, two long thin triangles will form on each side. After that, valley fold the top of each triangle to taste.
steps.visual_description: The top section of the paper shape is being folded to create the nipple of a baby bottle. Two long, thin triangles are shown forming on the sides of the nipple. Arrows indicate folding the tips of these side triangles.

steps.instruction: Valley fold over the two corner ends to form the top part of the bottle. Turn over.
steps.visual_description: The top corners of the paper shape are being folded inwards to form the neck of the bottle. An arrow indicates turning the entire piece over.

projects.finished_product_description: A completed model of a baby bottle with measurement markings on the side.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing step 5 of folding a paper shape.
Diagram showing step 6 of folding a paper shape to create a pleat.
Diagram showing step 7 of forming the nipple of a baby bottle by folding the top white triangle.
Diagram showing step 8 of folding the top corners to form the bottle neck.
Diagram of a completed baby bottle model with measurement markings.

projects.name: Roto-tainer

steps.instruction: Precrease in half both ways to locate center.
steps.visual_description: A square with two intersecting lines forming a cross in the center, indicating creases.

steps.instruction: Precrease by bringing the edges against the center and unfolding.
steps.visual_description: A square with diagonal dashed lines and solid lines forming an 'X' and a '+' in the center. Arrows indicate folding edges to the center.

steps.instruction: Add mountain folds by bringing the corner to meet the creases just made.
steps.visual_description: A square with multiple intersecting lines. Arrows show corners being folded to meet the center creases.

steps.instruction: Add valley folds.
steps.visual_description: A square with a complex pattern of solid and dashed lines, showing the result of previous folds and indicating new valley folds.

steps.instruction: Add more valley folds.
steps.visual_description: A square with a more intricate pattern of lines, indicating further valley folds to create a star-like shape in the center.

steps.instruction: Raise sides.
steps.visual_description: A square with arrows indicating the raising of sides, suggesting the formation of a three-dimensional shape.

steps.instruction: Lift inside flaps.
steps.visual_description: A 3D perspective view of the partially folded paper, showing inside flaps being lifted upwards with arrows.

steps.instruction: Precrease at each corner.
steps.visual_description: A 3D perspective view of the paper structure, with arrows indicating precreasing at each of the four corners.

tips: 10" paper makes a 6" model.
projects.finished_product_description: A container-like origami model.

Diagram showing step 4: A square with a complex pattern of folds.
Diagram showing step 5: A square with a more complex pattern of folds, forming a star shape.
Diagram showing step 6: A square with arrows indicating raising the sides.
Diagram showing step 7: A 3D view of the model with inside flaps being lifted.
Diagram showing step 8: A 3D view of the model with arrows indicating precreasing at the corners.

steps.instruction: Unfold back peak. Fold front peak forward tucking in the sides.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing the unfolding of a peak and then folding another peak forward while tucking in the sides.

steps.instruction: Pull lower flap in the direction of the arrow. The model will accommodate.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing a lower flap being pulled in the direction of an arrow, with the model adjusting.

steps.instruction: Fold steps 2 + 3 on the other triangle.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing the completion of steps 2 and 3 on the opposing triangle of the paper craft.

steps.instruction: Valley fold. Rotate 90 degrees.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with a central vertical fold line and two horizontal fold lines. An arrow indicates a valley fold along the central vertical line, and another arrow indicates a 90-degree rotation.

steps.instruction: Rabbit ear both flaps.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with two flaps extending from the top. Arrows indicate that both flaps are to be folded outwards, creating 'rabbit ears'.

steps.instruction: Inside reverse fold. Rabbit ear tips to taste.
steps.visual_description: A shape resembling a rabbit's head. An arrow indicates an inside reverse fold on the tips of the 'rabbit ears'.
