projects.name: Table and Four Chairs

steps.instruction: Use the first sheet and start with a "Closed Pinwheel Base" as follows:
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing a square with dashed horizontal and vertical lines indicating creases. Arrows show folding the top and bottom edges to the center line, then unfolding. Another diagram shows folding the left and right edges to the center line, then unfolding.

steps.instruction: Start with white side up. Cupboard valley fold top and bottom edges to center. Unfold.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing a square with dashed horizontal and vertical lines. Arrows indicate valley folding the top and bottom edges to the center horizontal crease, then unfolding.

steps.instruction: Cupboard valley fold side edges to center. Unfold.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing a square with dashed horizontal and vertical lines. Arrows indicate valley folding the left and right edges to the center vertical crease, then unfolding.

steps.instruction: Valley fold to center.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing a square with creases. An arrow indicates folding the left edge to the center vertical crease.

steps.instruction: Valley fold to center.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing a square with creases. A shaded area is on the left side. An arrow indicates valley folding the right edge to the center vertical crease.

tips: Table is about 1/4 the size of the paper.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram illustrating the first step of creating a 'Closed Pinwheel Base' by folding edges to the center and unfolding.
Diagram illustrating the second step of creating a 'Closed Pinwheel Base' by folding side edges to the center and unfolding.
Diagram showing a valley fold to the center.
Diagram showing a valley fold to the center with a shaded section.

projects.name: Table and Four Chairs

steps.instruction: Valley fold to center.
steps.visual_description: A square divided into four smaller squares by horizontal and vertical lines. The left half of the square is shaded, and the top-left and bottom-left quadrants are folded inwards towards the center line. An arrow indicates the fold direction.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the top right corner to center, and open up the top left corner.
steps.visual_description: Similar to the previous step, but now the top-right corner is folded to the center. The top-left corner is shown being opened up, with an arrow indicating the movement.

steps.instruction: Tuck the top left corner into itself.
steps.visual_description: The top-left corner, which was opened in the previous step, is now being tucked into a pocket created by the folds. An arrow shows the direction of tucking.

steps.instruction: The closed pinwheel base is now complete.
steps.visual_description: A square shape formed by four smaller squares. The corners of the smaller squares meet at the center, creating a pinwheel-like appearance. The edges are neatly folded.

steps.instruction: After that, valley fold the loose ends over.
steps.visual_description: The square from the previous step is shown. Arrows indicate that the four loose ends (the outer edges of the smaller squares) are to be folded inwards towards the center.

steps.instruction: Squash the four folded ends. Turn over.
steps.visual_description: The shape from the previous step is shown. Arrows indicate that the four folded ends are to be 'squashed' flat, likely by opening them up and pressing them down. The instruction also says to turn the model over.

projects.finished_product_description: A table and four chairs made from folded paper.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing the steps to fold a paper table and four chairs.
Diagram illustrating the process of folding a pinwheel base.
Diagram showing the final step of squashing the folded ends.

projects.name: Origami Table

steps.instruction: Blitz. Turn over.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with diagonal and horizontal/vertical creases. Arrows indicate folding the corners inwards towards the center, creating a pinwheel-like effect on one side.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold the four corners over where they meet the top folded ends of the table's design. Turn over.
steps.visual_description: A square rotated 45 degrees. The four corners are folded inwards to meet at the center. Arrows indicate the direction of the fold. A circular diagram with an arrow suggests turning the paper over.

steps.instruction: Open up the four folded ends of the top layer.
steps.visual_description: A square shape with four flaps pointing outwards from the center. Arrows indicate opening these flaps upwards.

steps.instruction: Valley fold over the four existing valley creases shown between the four corners.
steps.visual_description: A square shape with the four corners folded inwards, creating a more compact shape. The folds follow existing creases.

steps.instruction: Skinny the table's legs by valley folding the two ends to the center on each corner.
steps.visual_description: A shape resembling a table with four legs. Each leg is being narrowed by folding its sides towards the center. Small arrows indicate the folds.

steps.instruction: Using the existing valley creases of the bottom layers, valley fold both layers of all four legs to the center.
steps.visual_description: The four legs of the table are being further folded inwards towards the center. The folds involve multiple layers and follow existing creases.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the four legs out where the folded edges intersect the right angles made by the table's design.
steps.visual_description: An octagonal shape with four points extending outwards. The four legs are being folded outwards, creating the final shape of the table legs.

steps.instruction: Bring all four legs forward, then turn over.
steps.visual_description: The four legs are brought forward to stand upright. An arrow indicates turning the entire model over.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami table with four legs.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 3 shows a square with diagonal and perpendicular creases, with arrows indicating inward folds.
Diagram 4 shows a rotated square with corners folded to the center, and a circular diagram indicating to turn over.
Diagram 5 shows an octagonal shape with four flaps pointing outwards, with arrows indicating to open them.
Diagram 6 shows the shape from step 5 with the flaps folded inwards along existing creases.
Diagram 7 shows the shape from step 6 with the sides of the four legs being folded inwards to narrow them.
Diagram 8 shows the shape from step 7 with the legs being folded further inwards, involving multiple layers.
Diagram 9 shows the shape from step 8 with the legs being folded outwards to form the final leg shape.
Diagram 10 shows the origami table with legs brought forward, and an arrow indicating to turn over.

projects.name: The Table

steps.instruction: The table is complete.
steps.visual_description: A completed origami model of a table, viewed from above, showing a square top with a cross pattern and four distinct legs. The model has a textured, dotted pattern.

projects.finished_product_description: A completed origami table model.

steps.instruction: Use: The second sheet of paper and start with a closed pinwheel base. Follow steps 1 and 2 from the table, and then turn the model 90 until it forms a diamond shape.
steps.visual_description: A circular arrow indicating a 90-degree rotation. A diamond-shaped origami base with a central square and four triangular flaps, showing internal crease lines and arrows indicating folds towards the center.

steps.instruction: Make two valley folds so that the widest ends of the corner touch the center, as shown by point. Repeat this procedure on the opposite side only.
steps.visual_description: A diamond-shaped origami model with a central square. The bottom two corners are folded inwards towards the center, indicated by dashed lines and arrows. The model has a dotted texture.

steps.instruction: With the two remaining corners, make two mountain creases a bit more than halfway between the center and the raw vertical edges. Turn over.
steps.visual_description: A diamond-shaped origami model with a central square. The top two corners are shown with curved arrows indicating a mountain crease action, folding them slightly more than halfway towards the center. Two curved arrows below the model indicate a 'turn over' action. The model has a dotted texture.

steps.instruction: Valley fold left corner to first existing crease.
steps.visual_description: A diamond-shaped origami model with several vertical crease lines. A curved arrow indicates a valley fold of the left corner towards the first vertical crease line from the left. The model has a dotted texture.

diagram_descriptions: Page number '50' in the top left corner.
A circular arrow indicating a rotation or turning action, positioned near the top left.
A diagram of a completed origami table, shown from a slightly elevated perspective, with a square top and four distinct legs. The model has a textured, dotted pattern.

A diagram showing an origami model in a diamond shape. The model has a central square with internal creases and four triangular flaps extending outwards. Arrows indicate folding actions towards the center. This diagram is associated with the initial setup for chairs.

A diagram showing an origami model in a diamond shape. It has a central square with internal creases. Two bottom corners are folded inwards towards the center, indicated by dashed lines and arrows. This diagram is associated with step 3.

A diagram showing an origami model in a diamond shape. It has a central square. The top two corners are shown with curved arrows indicating a mountain crease action, folding them slightly more than halfway towards the center. Two curved arrows below the model indicate a 'turn over' action. This diagram is associated with step 4.

A diagram showing an origami model in a diamond shape. It has several vertical crease lines. A curved arrow indicates a valley fold of the left corner towards the first vertical crease line from the left. This diagram is associated with step 5.

projects.name: Table and Four Chairs

steps.instruction: Valley fold the left side on existing crease. It may or may not touch the second crease.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with a central vertical crease and diagonal creases radiating from the bottom left corner. A curved arrow indicates folding the left side inwards.

steps.instruction: Valley fold right corner to first existing crease.
steps.visual_description: A triangular shape with a vertical crease. A folded section is visible on the left. A curved arrow indicates folding the right corner to the central crease.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the right side on existing crease. turn over.
steps.visual_description: A triangular shape with a central vertical crease. A folded section is visible on the right. A curved arrow indicates folding the right side inwards, and the instruction 'turn over' is present.

steps.instruction: Make a valley and then a mountain fold as shown in the diagram. after that, go to the bottom part of the chair's design, and mountain fold 1/3 up from the widest point on the bottom to the widest point on the top. This will make the chair sit.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a partially folded chair shape. It illustrates a valley fold followed by a mountain fold. Another diagram shows the bottom section of the chair, with markings indicating a mountain fold 1/3 up from the widest point on the bottom to the widest point on the top.

steps.instruction: Completed chair
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a completed chair shape. It is a tall, narrow structure with a pointed top and a base that flares out. There are decorative lines on the front.

projects.finished_product_description: A miniature table with four chairs arranged around it, all made from folded paper.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing steps 6, 7, and 8 of folding a piece of paper into a triangular shape.
Diagram showing the process of folding a chair shape, including measurements and fold types.
Diagram of a completed chair.
Diagram showing multiple completed chairs and the text 'three more'.
Diagram of a table with four chairs arranged around it, labeled 'Table and Four Chairs'.

projects.name: Rota-Cup

steps.instruction: Colored side up. Precrease in half.
steps.visual_description: A square sheet of paper with a horizontal dashed line and a vertical dashed line intersecting at the center. Arrows indicate folding the paper in half horizontally and vertically.

steps.instruction: Precrease mountain folds that lie along the thirds marks.
steps.visual_description: A square sheet of paper with horizontal and vertical dashed lines dividing it into a 3x3 grid. The central horizontal and vertical lines are marked with '=' symbols, indicating mountain folds.

steps.instruction: Add valley folds.
steps.visual_description: A square sheet of paper showing the 3x3 grid. Additionally, diagonal dashed lines (valley folds) are present in each of the four corner squares, connecting the outer corners to the inner corners of the central 2x2 grid.

steps.instruction: Add more valley folds.
steps.visual_description: A square sheet of paper showing all previous folds. More diagonal dashed lines (valley folds) are added, forming a star-like pattern in the center, connecting the midpoints of the inner square edges to the corners of the central 2x2 grid.

steps.instruction: Add more valley folds to create an octagon.
steps.visual_description: A square sheet of paper showing all previous folds. Additional diagonal dashed lines (valley folds) are added, forming an octagon in the center.

steps.instruction: Add mountain folds.
steps.visual_description: A square sheet of paper showing all previous folds. Dashed-dot-dashed lines (mountain folds) are added, forming a smaller square in the center, rotated 45 degrees relative to the main paper.

steps.instruction: Collapse along indicated creases, The center will raise up.
steps.visual_description: A square with numerous fold lines. Curved arrows indicate the collapse action, pushing the outer edges inwards and causing the central area to rise.

steps.instruction: Lock with mountain folds.
steps.visual_description: A 3D illustration of the partially collapsed cup, showing the sides being folded and locked with mountain folds. The top edges are curled slightly.

steps.instruction: Turn upside down.
steps.visual_description: A 3D illustration of the cup, now turned upside down, showing its base and the structured sides. A curved arrow indicates the turning motion.

steps.instruction: Completed Rota-cup.
steps.visual_description: A 3D illustration of the finished Rota-cup, standing upright, showcasing its octagonal opening and distinct folded sides. The finished product has a height of 3 1/2 inches.

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: The project involves a series of precreases and folds to transform a square sheet of paper into a cup. The initial paper size is 10 inches, yielding a finished product of 3 1/2 inches.

projects.finished_product_description: A structured, octagonal paper cup, referred to as a Rota-cup, with a finished height of 3 1/2 inches.

projects.name: Triangular Corner Dish

materials.color: white side up, patterned paper looks nice

steps.instruction: Valley fold as shown
steps.visual_description: A square with dashed lines indicating diagonal and horizontal/vertical center folds, all meeting at the center.

steps.instruction: Fold the corners into the center (Blintz fold) and unfold.
steps.visual_description: A square with dashed lines indicating diagonal and horizontal/vertical center folds, all meeting at the center. Arrows show the four corners being folded to the center point.

steps.instruction: Fold corner point Z to point Y
steps.visual_description: A square with multiple fold lines. Point Y is marked on one of the diagonal fold lines near the top left. Point Z is the bottom right corner. An arrow indicates folding Z to Y.

steps.instruction: Like this. Now unfold and repeat on the other three corners.
steps.visual_description: A corner of a square is shown folded. The fold creates a triangular flap. An arrow indicates the direction of the fold.

steps.instruction: Crease all four side centers as shown - see figure 6 for a detailed view.
steps.visual_description: A square with many intersecting fold lines. A magnified circle highlights the top edge, showing dashed lines indicating creases at the midpoints of the top edge and the two adjacent diagonal lines. Arrows indicate folding these points inwards.

steps.instruction: Enlarged view of detail folds. Note the crease directions (valley and mountain). In figure 7 point A is folded behind to touch point B. Point C should point out towards you.
steps.visual_description: An enlarged view of a corner of the paper. Points A, B, and C are labeled. Dashed lines indicate valley folds and solid lines indicate mountain folds. An arrow shows point A being folded behind to meet point B. Point C is shown pointing outwards.

projects.finished_product_description: A triangular corner dish made from folded paper.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing the initial folds on a square piece of paper.
Diagram showing the first step of folding corners to the center.
Diagram illustrating folding a corner point to another point.
Diagram showing a single corner folded.
Diagram showing the square with creases on the side centers, with a magnified view of the detail.
Enlarged view of the detail folds, showing points A, B, and C and the direction of folds.

projects.name: Dish

steps.instruction: Point A is now behind point B. Fold Point K down onto point J. Then fold D to C. Push the whole flap down into the bottom of the dish. Fold the flap on the left down and into the bottom of the dish.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a folded paper shape with points labeled A, B, C, D, J, and K. Arrows indicate folding directions.

steps.instruction: This is the result. Now repeat on the other three sides.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the result of step 7, a partially formed dish shape. It is a square with folded corners and internal creases.

steps.instruction: This is a view looking from underneath the dish at the corner folded in step 8.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the underside of a corner of the dish, with labels 'side', 'side', and 'bottom'. An arrow points to an 'indented corner'.

projects.finished_product_description: A finished tray made by folding paper.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram illustrating step 7 of folding a paper dish, showing points A, B, C, D, J, K and folding arrows.
Diagram illustrating step 8, showing the result of the previous fold, a square with folded corners.
Diagram illustrating step 9, a close-up view from underneath a corner of the dish, showing 'side', 'side', and 'bottom' sections, with an 'indented corner' highlighted.
Diagram showing the 'Finished tray'.

projects.name: Octagonal Vase

steps.instruction: Color side up. Precrease the lines.
steps.visual_description: A square with diagonal and horizontal/vertical center lines precreased.

steps.instruction: Precrease the lines and repeat at the other corners.
steps.visual_description: A square with diagonal and horizontal/vertical center lines precreased, with additional diagonal lines from the center to the midpoints of the sides.

steps.instruction: Precrease the lines from vortex A to B, C. Repeat at the other vertices of the octagon.
steps.visual_description: A square with many precreased lines, forming an octagon in the center. Points A, B, and C are labeled.

steps.instruction: Precrease the lines as shown and repeat them 8 times.
steps.visual_description: A square with a complex network of precreased lines, indicating the formation of the octagonal base and sides.

steps.instruction: Fold the model to 3D. Reinforce the valley creases around the octagon.
steps.visual_description: An octagonal shape with arrows indicating the sides are being folded upwards to form a vase shape. Valley creases are reinforced.

steps.instruction: Overturn 4 corners down and turn the model upside down. Model will become colored on the outside.
steps.visual_description: A partially formed octagonal vase with four corners being folded downwards. Arrows indicate the direction of the fold and turning the model over.

steps.instruction: Like this.
steps.visual_description: A 3D representation of the octagonal vase, showing the sides folded inwards and downwards.

steps.instruction: Enlarge view of one corner, Fold 1 then 2 and repeat the foldings at other corners.
steps.visual_description: A magnified view of one corner of the vase, showing two specific folds (labeled 1 and 2) to be made. Arrows indicate the folding direction.

steps.instruction: Shape the model to complete.
steps.visual_description: The final, completed octagonal vase, standing upright.

tips: Editor's note: Use foil. 10" square makes a 3 1/2" high and 2 1/2" in diameter.
projects.finished_product_description: An octagonal vase made from foil.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing precreasing steps for an octagonal vase.
Diagram showing the 3D folding process of the vase.
Enlarged view of a corner showing specific folding instructions.

projects.name: Goblet

steps.instruction: Valley fold into thirds. Then unfold right hand side only.
steps.visual_description: A square with three vertical dashed lines dividing it into thirds. Arrows indicate folding the right third inwards, then unfolding it.

steps.instruction: Valley fold right raw edge to meet left raw edge.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle folded in half vertically, with the right edge aligned to the center fold line. An arrow indicates the fold.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the left hand edge into thirds. Be careful not to extend valley fold lines to right hand flap. Make the valley fold through both thicknesses of the left hand side.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular shape shown from the side. The left edge is folded into thirds. Arrows indicate the folds, and a note specifies folding through both thicknesses.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the left hand edge further into ninths (through both thicknesses), Keeping both thicknesses of the right hand side, completely smooth and uncreased. unfold again to step 3.
steps.visual_description: A ruler-like scale on the left shows divisions into ninths. A rectangular shape is shown with multiple vertical dashed lines indicating folds. The instruction mentions folding through both thicknesses and unfolding.

steps.instruction: Form nine mountain creases as shown. They run between the existing valley folds formed in step 4 through both thicknesses.
steps.visual_description: A circular diagram showing a pattern of radiating lines, some dashed and some solid, indicating mountain and valley folds. The instruction specifies nine mountain creases.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the right hand flap close to the edge, About 1/6 of the width of the flap. Fold through both thicknesses and unfold.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular shape shown from the side. The right flap is folded inwards, with an arrow indicating the fold. The fold is described as being about 1/6 of the flap's width.

tips: Foil works best. White side up.
projects.finished_product_description: A 3 1/2 inch goblet.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing a square divided into thirds by dashed lines, with arrows indicating folding.
Diagram showing a rectangle folded in half vertically, with an arrow indicating the fold.
Diagram showing a side view of a folded edge, with folds indicated by dashed lines and arrows.
Diagram showing a ruler with divisions into ninths, and a folded rectangle with multiple dashed lines.
Circular diagram illustrating radiating lines representing mountain and valley folds.
Diagram showing a side view of a folded flap being folded inwards.

projects.name: Goblet

steps.instruction: Fold the right hand flap to crease made in step 6. (both thicknesses) and unfold. Move model to position shown in step 8.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular prism with zigzag lines on one face and a dashed line on an adjacent face, with an arrow indicating a fold.

steps.instruction: Insert side C between thicknesses of side D until sections E and F overlap completely. (Model will become a cylinder).
steps.visual_description: Hands holding a partially formed cylinder, with labels C, D, E, and F indicating sections to be joined.

steps.instruction: Along existing crease lines, Mountain fold upper edge to the inside. Then roll edge over once more; This will make the upper edge more sturdy and help lock the model together. Grasp the goblet with one hand while using the other to forcibly twist fold the lower edge from left to right (clockwise). This may take several tries to complete. It helps to reinforce the creases first.
steps.visual_description: A cylinder with a folded top edge, and an arrow indicating a clockwise twist of the bottom edge.

steps.instruction: Use thumbnail to flatten the outer 1/8 inch of the goblet's base to the tabletop on each of the eight sections.
steps.visual_description: A finished goblet shape with a twisted base, showing the bottom edge being flattened.

projects.finished_product_description: A paper goblet with a twisted base.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing a rectangular prism being folded.
Diagram showing hands forming a cylinder by inserting one section into another.
Diagram of a cylinder with a folded top edge and an arrow indicating a clockwise twist at the bottom.
Diagram of a finished goblet shape with the base being flattened.

projects.name: Checkerboard
tips: Start White side up.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 1 shows a square with dashed lines connecting opposite corners and midpoints of opposite sides, with curved arrows indicating folds towards the center.
Diagram 2 shows a square with dashed lines connecting opposite corners and midpoints of opposite sides, with arrows indicating folds towards the center.
Diagram 3 shows a square with dashed lines indicating folds at the corners, with 'x' marks and curved arrows.
Diagram 4 shows an octagon formed by folding the corners of a square inwards, with dashed lines and curved arrows indicating further folds.
Diagram 5 shows a square rotated 45 degrees, with internal lines and arrows indicating folds.
Diagram 6 shows a square rotated 45 degrees, with internal lines and arrows indicating folds.
Diagram 7 shows a square rotated 45 degrees, with internal lines and arrows indicating folds.
Diagram 8 shows two connected diamond shapes, with internal lines and arrows indicating folds.
Diagram 9 shows two rows of connected diamond shapes, with numbered steps (1-4 and 1, 8) and arrows indicating connections and folds.

steps.instruction: Observe the intricate tiled pattern composed of squares and triangles.
steps.visual_description: A large square grid, 10 units by 10 units, labeled (10). Each unit square within the grid contains a smaller square rotated 45 degrees, with its corners touching the midpoints of the larger unit square's sides. The remaining four triangular spaces within each unit square are also clearly defined by lines. The overall pattern creates a repeating design of squares and diamonds.

steps.instruction: Examine the checkerboard pattern, possibly a variation or application of the previous pattern.
steps.visual_description: A smaller square grid, 8 units by 8 units, labeled (11), displaying a checkerboard pattern. Alternate squares are shaded with stippling (dots), while the unshaded squares are left white. A curved arrow with a small circle at its tail points from the area of diagram (10) towards diagram (11), suggesting a sequence, transformation, or relationship between the two patterns.

details.description: Each unit square contains a smaller square rotated 45 degrees, with its corners touching the midpoints of the larger square's sides. Four triangles fill the remaining space in each unit.
Alternate squares are shaded with stippling, creating a checkerboard effect.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram (10) illustrates a large square grid, 10 units by 10 units, featuring a repeating geometric pattern. Each individual square within the grid contains a smaller square rotated 45 degrees, with its vertices touching the midpoints of the larger square's sides. The four resulting triangular sections within each square are also outlined.
Diagram (11) displays a smaller square grid, 8 units by 8 units, filled with a checkerboard pattern. Alternate squares are shaded with a stippled texture, while the others are left white.
A curved arrow, originating near diagram (10) and pointing towards diagram (11), indicates a progression, transformation, or relationship between the two patterns.

projects.name: Checkers

steps.instruction: Fold the paper diagonally.
steps.visual_description: A square with a dashed line from the top-left corner to the bottom-right corner, and a curved arrow indicating a fold along this line. A solid line indicates the diagonal crease.

steps.instruction: Fold the paper in half.
steps.visual_description: A square with a diagonal line from top-left to bottom-right. A dashed line indicates a fold from the bottom edge upwards to the center. A curved arrow shows the direction of the fold.

steps.instruction: Fold the paper in half again.
steps.visual_description: A square with a diagonal line. A dashed line indicates a fold from the right edge inwards to the center. A curved arrow shows the direction of the fold.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom edge up to the center line.
steps.visual_description: A square with a vertical dashed line in the center. A diagonal line crosses the square. A curved arrow indicates folding the bottom edge up to the center dashed line.

steps.instruction: Fold the right edge to the center line.
steps.visual_description: A square with a vertical dashed line in the center. A diagonal line crosses the square. Curved arrows indicate folding the right edge to the center dashed line.

steps.instruction: Fold the top and bottom edges to the horizontal center line.
steps.visual_description: A square with a vertical dashed line in the center and two horizontal dashed lines. A diagonal line crosses the square. Curved arrows indicate folding the top and bottom edges to the horizontal center line.

steps.instruction: Fold the left side inwards.
steps.visual_description: A square with a grid of lines formed by previous folds. A curved arrow indicates folding the left side inwards.

steps.instruction: Fold the top and bottom sections inwards.
steps.visual_description: A square with a grid of lines. A horizontal dashed line is present. Curved arrows indicate folding the top and bottom sections inwards along the dashed line.

steps.instruction: Fold the top section down.
steps.visual_description: A square with horizontal lines. A dashed line is present near the top. A curved arrow indicates folding the top section down.

tips: 10" paper makes a checker with a 3" diameter.
projects.finished_product_description: A checker piece.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing 9 steps for folding a checker piece from a square piece of paper.

steps.instruction: Fold the top edge of the paper down along the first horizontal crease line.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular paper with multiple horizontal lines. The top section is folded down along a dashed line, indicated by a curved arrow pointing downwards from the top edge to the dashed line.

steps.instruction: Fold the top section down to the center and the bottom section up to the center, aligning with the dashed lines.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular paper with multiple horizontal lines. A curved arrow indicates folding the top portion down to a central dashed line, and another curved arrow indicates folding the bottom portion up to the same central dashed line.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom edge of the paper up along the first horizontal crease line from the bottom.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular paper with multiple horizontal lines. The bottom section is folded up along a dashed line, indicated by a curved arrow pointing upwards from the bottom edge to the dashed line.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom edge of the paper up along the first horizontal crease line from the bottom.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular paper with multiple horizontal lines. The bottom section is folded up along a dashed line, indicated by a curved arrow pointing upwards from the bottom edge to the dashed line.

steps.instruction: Fold the top-left corner diagonally downwards, aligning the top edge with the indicated diagonal line.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular paper with multiple horizontal lines. A diagonal fold line extends from the top-left corner. A curved arrow indicates folding the top-left corner down along this diagonal line. The text '(8/13)' is present near the top-right.

steps.instruction: Create a grid of creases by folding the paper horizontally and vertically. Then, fold the top and bottom edges towards the center.
steps.visual_description: A square paper with a grid of dashed horizontal and vertical lines. Curved arrows indicate folding the top edge down towards the center and the bottom edge up towards the center.

steps.instruction: Fold the top edge of the paper down along the first horizontal crease line.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular paper with multiple horizontal lines. The top section is folded down along a dashed line, indicated by a curved arrow pointing downwards from the top edge to the dashed line.

steps.instruction: Fold the top edge down and the bottom edge up along the dashed lines. Rotate the paper clockwise.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular paper with multiple horizontal lines. The top section is folded down along a dashed line, and the bottom section is folded up along a dashed line, both indicated by curved arrows. A clockwise rotation symbol is present.

steps.instruction: Fold the top edge down to the upper dashed line and the bottom edge up to the lower dashed line.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular paper with multiple horizontal lines. Two dashed lines are shown, one near the top and one near the bottom. Curved arrows indicate folding the top edge down to the upper dashed line and the bottom edge up to the lower dashed line.

steps.instruction: Perform a series of zig-zag or accordion folds along the diagonal dashed lines on both the top and bottom sections of the strip. Rotate the paper clockwise.
steps.visual_description: A long rectangular strip of paper, divided horizontally into two equal sections. Both sections show a pattern of diagonal dashed lines and small arrows, indicating a sequence of zig-zag folds. A clockwise rotation symbol is present at the bottom.

projects.name: Octagonal Prism

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: Assemble octagonal prism by joining side panels and attaching top and bottom octagons. The diagrams show how to fold and connect the panels.

projects.finished_product_description: An octagonal prism constructed from paper, with dashed lines indicating folds and arrows showing assembly direction.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 20 shows a rectangle divided into four equal horizontal sections by three parallel lines. Arrows indicate folding.
Diagram 21 shows two stacked rectangular sections, each divided into smaller rectangles by dashed vertical and horizontal lines. Loops and arrows indicate folding and assembly.
Diagram 22 shows a partially assembled octagonal prism with dashed lines indicating folds and arrows indicating the direction of assembly.

Diagram 23 shows a fully assembled octagonal prism with dashed lines indicating folds and arrows indicating the direction of assembly. A second diagram shows the top view of the octagonal prism, with a swirling pattern formed by the folded edges.

projects.name: Concertina

steps.instruction: White side up. Book fold.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle with a dashed vertical line down the center and a curved arrow indicating a fold.

steps.instruction: Valley fold both raw edges together, about 1/2 inch.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle folded in half, with a dashed line indicating where to fold the raw edges together.

steps.instruction: Valley fold again.
steps.visual_description: The folded paper from step 2, now folded again along the center line.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold.
steps.visual_description: The paper from step 3, shown with a dashed line indicating a mountain fold.

steps.instruction: Pleat through all layers. Leave about 1 1/2 inches on each end. The folds are about 1/2 inch apart. It doesn't matter how many folds there are.
steps.visual_description: A long, thin rectangle with multiple parallel dashed lines indicating pleats. There are blank spaces of about 1 1/2 inches at each end.

steps.instruction: Separate the edges to convert the model into a 3D tube.
steps.visual_description: A pleated strip of paper bent into a cylindrical shape, showing the accordion-like structure.

projects.finished_product_description: A 3D concertina or accordion-like tube made from folded paper.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing the first four steps of folding a rectangular piece of paper: a book fold, two valley folds, and a mountain fold.
Diagram showing a pleated strip of paper with unpleated ends.
Diagram showing the pleated paper formed into a 3D tube.
Diagram 7 shows a rectangular object with multiple parallel vertical lines drawn on its top surface, indicating folds. It is labeled '7. Like so.'

Diagram 8 is an enlarged view showing a cross-section of folded paper. It illustrates pushing in valley folds from the front and back, and mountain folds forming on the top and bottom. It is labeled '8. Enlarged view. Push in the front and back on the valley folds from step 5. Mountain folds form on the top and bottom.'
Diagram 9 shows a zig-zag folded strip of paper collapsing flat on the right end. It is labeled '9. Like so. Collapse the right end flat. Repeat on the left end.'

Diagram 10 shows a concertina-like folded object, partially collapsed, with arrows indicating it can be expanded and contracted. It is labeled '10. Completed concertina. It should work like a real instrument.'

projects.name: Bird

steps.instruction: Reverse fold.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper folded diagonally, with dashed lines indicating creases. Arrows show the direction of the reverse fold.

steps.instruction: Precrease.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with a central vertical crease and two diagonal creases. Arrows indicate folding inwards.
A shape resembling a crown or a bird's head, with two pointed flaps at the top. Dashed lines indicate folds. Labels A and B are on the inner flaps.
The shape from step 3, with one of the top flaps being folded upwards and outwards, indicated by an arrow.

steps.instruction: Note A,B,C and D.
steps.visual_description: A symmetrical shape with two pointed flaps at the top and a larger diamond shape at the bottom. Arrows indicate folding the side flaps inwards.
The shape from step 5, with the side flaps folded inwards. Labels A, B, C, and D are indicated. A curved arrow shows a fold on the bottom diamond section.

steps.instruction: Tuck C and D behind A and B.
steps.visual_description: A side view of the origami model. Arrows indicate tucking flaps labeled C and D behind flaps labeled A and B. Other arrows show folds on the lower section.
A side profile of the origami bird, showing the head, body, and tail. The beak is formed by a small fold. The tail is fanned out. The wings are layered.

tips: Use 6" paper to make a 3 1/2" model.
Begin with white side up.
Make a preliminary base.

projects.name: Sparrow

steps.instruction: Start with a colored waterbomb base. Sink about 1/5 of the way down. Bookfold top left flap to right.
steps.visual_description: A triangular shape with dashed lines indicating folds. The top point has a small checkmark. Two layers are visible at the bottom.

steps.instruction: Outside reverse fold. Mountain fold both outside lower flaps.
steps.visual_description: A more complex folded shape, showing the result of the previous step and indicating new folds with arrows and dashed lines. The shape is becoming bird-like.

steps.instruction: Inside reverse fold tail. Crimp beak.
steps.visual_description: A diagram of a folded paper bird. The tail is shown with an inside reverse fold, and the beak area is indicated for crimping.

steps.instruction: Inside reverse fold both sides of the tail.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the paper bird from step 3, with the tail area further refined by inside reverse folds on both sides.

steps.instruction: Fold the wings slightly outward.
steps.visual_description: A diagram of the completed paper sparrow, with its wings folded slightly outward.

projects.finished_product_description: A paper sparrow model.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing the initial step of folding a waterbomb base.
Diagram illustrating an outside reverse fold and mountain folds.
Diagram showing the paper bird with an inside reverse fold for the tail and a crimped beak.
Diagram showing the paper bird with inside reverse folds on both sides of the tail.
Diagram of the finished paper sparrow with wings folded outward.

projects.name: Flapping Magpie

steps.instruction: Precrease paper from corner to corner. Ice cream cone fold the top two edges to lay along the center crease.
steps.visual_description: Square paper with dashed lines from corners to center, and curved dashed lines from top corners to center. Arrows indicate folding top edges to center crease.

steps.instruction: Ice cream cone fold the opposite bottom edges to lay along the center crease.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 1, with arrows indicating folding the bottom edges to the center crease.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold the model in half along its long edge.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 2, with a curved arrow indicating a mountain fold along the long central edge.

steps.instruction: Unfold front and back flaps to expose white paper.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 3, with arrows indicating unfolding the front and back flaps.

steps.instruction: Reverse fold these same flaps to the inside of the model.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 4, with arrows indicating reverse folding the flaps inwards.

steps.instruction: Crimp the colored portion of the model as shown.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 5, with dashed lines and arrows indicating a crimp fold on the colored portion.

steps.instruction: Pull square flaps upwards, letting paper unfold from inside the model.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 6, with arrows indicating pulling square flaps upwards and unfolding paper from inside.

steps.instruction: Crimp beak.
steps.visual_description: Close-up of the model's head area, showing a crimp fold to form the beak.
The model from step 8, showing the completed head and body shape.
The completed model of a flapping magpie, shown from the side. A double-headed arrow indicates a possible action or movement.

projects.finished_product_description: A paper model of a flapping magpie.

Diagram showing the paper folded into an ice cream cone shape.
Diagram showing the model folded in half along the long edge.
Diagram showing the flaps unfolded.
Diagram showing the flaps reverse folded inwards.
Diagram showing a crimp fold on the colored portion of the model.
Diagram showing square flaps pulled upwards and paper unfolding from inside.

projects.name: Bat

materials.dimensions: approx. 1/3 of the size of the paper

steps.instruction: Start white side up. Valley fold the top corner down to the bottom corner, forming a triangle.
steps.visual_description: A square sheet of paper is shown with the top corner folded down to the bottom corner, creating a triangle. A dashed line indicates the fold.

steps.instruction: Valley fold 2/5 of the way down to the bottom, leaving a small triangle at the bottom of the model.
steps.visual_description: The triangle from step 1 is shown. A fold is indicated by a dashed line, folding the top portion down. A curved arrow shows the direction of the fold. A bracket with tick marks indicates a measurement on the right side.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the folded bottom edge back up to meet the top edge.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 2 is shown. The bottom edge is folded upwards to meet the top edge. A curved arrow indicates the fold.

steps.instruction: Pleat on both sides. First, make two valley folds to taste, which should be equidistant from the center. After that, make two mountain folds to taste which should be equidistant from the valley folds; the mountain and valley folds will not be parallel. This forms the bat's body. Turn over.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 3 is shown from the front. Dashed lines indicate pleats on both sides. Arrows show the direction of the pleats. Below this, a diagram shows two opposing arrow shapes, indicating the direction of the pleats.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the top down of the bat's body, as far as it will go. After that, squash the corners to form the eyes. Valley fold the bat's arms down to taste.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 4 is shown. A curved arrow indicates folding the top portion down. Another curved arrow shows the arms being folded down. Small triangles are shown being squashed to form eyes.

steps.instruction: Completed model, enlarged view.
steps.visual_description: An enlarged view of the completed bat model is shown. It has wings, a body, and two pointed ears.

projects.finished_product_description: A paper bat model.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing the initial square paper and the first fold.
Diagram showing the second valley fold.
Diagram showing the third valley fold.
Diagram showing the pleating on both sides.
Diagram showing the final folds and shaping of the bat's body and arms.
Enlarged view of the completed bat model.

projects.name: Birds in a Fountain

steps.instruction: Fold right top flap to top. Squash the flap formed. Repeat on other three flaps.
steps.visual_description: A triangular shape with a central vertical line. The top right flap is folded to the top point. The flap is then squashed flat, creating a diamond shape within the triangle. This is repeated on the other three flaps, resulting in a shape with four squashed flaps at the top.

steps.instruction: Squash flap on upper right side.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a house-like shape with two square openings at the bottom. The upper right flap of the top triangle is being squashed inwards, creating a diagonal fold line.

steps.instruction: Petal fold.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the previous shape with the right flap folded inwards and upwards, creating a petal-like fold. The square opening on the left remains. The right side shows a more complex folded structure with diagonal lines indicating further folds.

steps.instruction: Fold the flap on the right side to the left side.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the shape from step 3. The flap on the right side is being folded across to the left side. The square opening on the left is still visible. The right side shows a layered folded structure.

steps.instruction: Repeat steps 2-4 on the right side.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the shape after steps 2-4 have been applied to the right side. The shape now has symmetrical folded elements on both the left and right sides, with the square openings still present.

steps.instruction: Simultaneously fold the top two flaps on the left to the right and the right flap underneath.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the shape from step 5. The two top flaps on the left are being folded to the right. The flap on the right side is being folded underneath. This creates a more compact, layered structure at the top.

steps.instruction: Repeat steps 1 - 6 on the other three points.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the completed model. It resembles a bird with wings spread, or a fountain-like structure. The base is square, and the top has four points that have been folded and shaped.

tips: 10 inch paper makes a 4 inch model
projects.finished_product_description: A paper model resembling a bird in a fountain or a stylized bird with spread wings.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing the initial waterbomb base with fold lines and arrows indicating folding directions.
Diagram showing the first step of folding the top right flap to the top and squashing it.
Diagram showing the result of step 1, with four squashed flaps.
Diagram showing step 2: squashing the flap on the upper right side.
Diagram showing step 3: performing a petal fold on the right side.
Diagram showing step 4: folding the right flap to the left side.
Diagram showing step 5: repeating steps 2-4 on the right side.
Diagram showing step 6: folding the top two flaps on the left to the right and the right flap underneath.
Diagram showing step 7: the completed model, resembling a bird or fountain.

projects.name: Box

steps.instruction: Rotate model 180 degrees.
steps.visual_description: A pentagonal shape with folded flaps at the bottom, rotated 180 degrees. A circle with '180' and a curved arrow indicates the rotation.

steps.instruction: Fold the top triangular flap down as far as possible. Repeat behind. Do a minor miracle and repeat on the other two points.
steps.visual_description: The top point of the model is folded down. Arrows indicate the direction of the fold. Dashed lines show where the fold should be made. The instruction mentions repeating this on the back and two other points, suggesting a symmetrical process.

steps.instruction: Inside reverse fold all four points. This is a judgement fold.
steps.visual_description: Four points at the top of the model are being folded inwards using an inside reverse fold. Arrows indicate the direction of the fold. The term 'judgement fold' implies the fold's exact position is determined by visual judgment.

steps.instruction: Inside reverse fold all four points. This is a judgement fold.
steps.visual_description: Similar to step 10, four points are being folded inwards with an inside reverse fold. The diagram shows the result of this fold, with two points resembling horns or ears.

steps.instruction: Preparation creases for step 13.
steps.visual_description: Dashed lines are drawn on the lower part of the model, indicating where creases should be made in preparation for the next step. These creases form a rectangular area.

steps.instruction: Push in bottom and pinch sides to form a box.
steps.visual_description: The bottom of the model is being pushed inwards, and the sides are being pinched. An arrow indicates the inward motion. The final diagram shows the model transformed into a box shape with the top flaps open.

projects.finished_product_description: A small box with decorative top flaps that resemble horns or ears.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing a pentagonal shape with folded flaps.
Diagram illustrating a 180-degree rotation with a circular annotation.
Diagram showing the top triangular flap being folded down, with arrows and dashed lines indicating the fold.
Diagram showing four points being folded inwards using an inside reverse fold.
Diagram showing the result of the inside reverse folds, with two points resembling horns.
Diagram illustrating preparation creases made with dashed lines on the lower part of the model.
Diagram showing the bottom being pushed in and sides pinched to form a box shape.

projects.name: Bird of Paradise

materials.color: white side up for predominantly colored model

steps.instruction: Begin with an equilateral triangle. Fold in half, then unfold. Bring the two lower corners to the center line. Turn paper over.
steps.visual_description: An equilateral triangle with a dashed vertical center line and curved fold lines. Arrows indicate folding the bottom corners to the center line. A small semi-circle with arrows indicates turning the paper over.

steps.instruction: First make two little valley folds on each side. Next fold the sides to the center as shown.
steps.visual_description: A triangle with dashed lines indicating two small valley folds on each side. Arrows show the sides being folded to the center line.

steps.instruction: Make a series of reverse folds at the top, then fold the model in half.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with dashed lines at the top indicating reverse folds. Arrows show the model being folded in half vertically.

steps.instruction: Valley fold down. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: A side view of the model showing a section being folded down. Arrows indicate the fold and repeating the action on the back.

steps.instruction: Fold down again. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: A side view of the model showing another fold down. Arrows indicate the fold and repeating the action on the back.

steps.instruction: Outside reverse fold as illustrated.
steps.visual_description: A side view of the model showing an outside reverse fold. Curved arrows indicate the motion of the fold.

steps.instruction: Rabbit's ear. Repeat behind. Swivel model to position shown in diagram 8.
steps.visual_description: A side view of the model showing a 'rabbit's ear' fold being made. Arrows indicate the fold and repeating on the back. A curved arrow shows the model being swiveled.

tips: 6" paper makes a 4" long model.
projects.finished_product_description: A Bird of Paradise origami model.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing the initial fold of an equilateral triangle.
Diagram showing valley folds on the sides of a triangle.
Diagram showing reverse folds at the top of a diamond shape.
Diagram showing a valley fold down on one side of the model.
Diagram showing another fold down on one side of the model.
Diagram showing an outside reverse fold on the model.
Diagram showing a rabbit's ear fold on the model.

projects.name: Origami Bird

steps.instruction: Reverse fold the left point, which will form the head. Outside reverse fold the tail. Mountain fold the corners of each wing.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing a folded paper shape with arrows indicating reverse folds for the head and tail, and mountain folds for the wings.

steps.instruction: This is a close up of the head. Reverse fold.
steps.visual_description: Close-up diagram within a circle showing the head of the origami bird with a dashed line indicating a reverse fold.

steps.instruction: Outside reverse fold the head again. Sink each of the sides at base of the neck.
steps.visual_description: Close-up diagram within a circle showing the head of the origami bird with arrows indicating an outside reverse fold and sinking the sides at the base of the neck.

steps.instruction: Crimp fold to complete the head and beak.
steps.visual_description: Close-up diagram within a circle showing the head and beak of the origami bird with arrows indicating a crimp fold.

projects.finished_product_description: A finished origami bird labeled 'Sitting Pretty.'

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing a circular arrow indicating a turning motion.
Diagram showing a folded paper shape with arrows indicating folds.
Close-up diagram within a circle showing the head of the origami bird with a dashed line indicating a reverse fold.
Close-up diagram within a circle showing the head of the origami bird with arrows indicating an outside reverse fold and sinking the sides at the base of the neck.
Close-up diagram within a circle showing the head and beak of the origami bird with arrows indicating a crimp fold.
Illustration of a finished origami bird in a sitting pose, labeled 'Sitting Pretty.'

projects.name: Hummingbird

steps.instruction: Start with a bird base, colored side out. Open completely.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with the top point slightly separated, indicating the start of a bird base.

steps.instruction: Use existing creases.
steps.visual_description: The diamond shape from step 1 is shown with dashed lines indicating internal creases. Arrows show the paper being opened and folded along these creases.

steps.instruction: Use existing creases.
steps.visual_description: The paper is further folded, forming a star-like shape with two points at the top and two flaps at the bottom. Arrows indicate the direction of folds.

steps.instruction: Use existing creases.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape is shown, with dashed lines indicating folds. Arrows show a fold being made on one side and then the other.

steps.instruction: Squash. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: A flap is shown being opened and flattened. An arrow indicates this action. The instruction 'Repeat behind' suggests the same action on the reverse side.

steps.instruction: Inside reverse. Crimp the tail. Lift up wings; repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: A section of the paper is folded inwards. Another section is shown being crimped. Arrows indicate lifting up the wings. The instruction 'repeat behind' implies symmetry.

steps.instruction: Rotate the indicated section counterclockwise replacing the fold inside the model (dotted line) with the valley fold.
steps.visual_description: A part of the model is rotated. A dotted line indicates where a fold should be made, and an arrow shows the direction of rotation. The fold is then tucked inside.

steps.instruction: Inside reverse base of head: outside reverse point of head.
steps.technique: inside reverse fold, outside reverse fold
steps.visual_description: The base of the head area is shown being folded inwards. The point of the head is shown being folded outwards.

steps.instruction: Inside reverse neck. Reverse fold beak.
steps.visual_description: The neck area is folded inwards. The beak is shown being folded using a reverse fold.

steps.instruction: Thin beak with mountain folds. Mountain fold breast inside; repeat behind. Spread the wings.
steps.visual_description: The beak is shown being thinned with mountain folds. The breast area is folded inwards with a mountain fold. Arrows indicate spreading the wings.

steps.instruction: Hummingbird completed.
steps.visual_description: A detailed drawing of a completed origami hummingbird in flight, showing its wings spread and beak extended.

tips: Editor's note: A 10" piece of paper will create a hummingbird 6-1/2" from beak to tail.
projects.finished_product_description: A hummingbird made from paper, with wings spread as if in flight.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing the steps to fold an origami hummingbird, starting from a bird base and progressing through various folds to form the final shape.
A detailed drawing of the finished origami hummingbird in flight.

projects.name: Cock

steps.instruction: Start with a colored fish base.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with a pointed top and bottom, folded in half vertically. The top point is folded down to create a smaller triangle on top of the main diamond. Arrows indicate the fold.
A triangle with the top point folded down. A dashed line indicates a fold. Arrows show the direction of the fold.

steps.instruction: Rabbit ear. Repeat on other side.
steps.visual_description: A triangle with a fold line near the top point. Small flaps are folded outwards. Arrows indicate the folds.

steps.instruction: a. Fold down rabbit ear. Repeat on other side. b. Inside reverse fold head and tail as shown. (See step 5 to locate folds.)
steps.visual_description: A shape resembling a bird's head and tail. The top points are folded down. Arrows indicate the folds. A circle highlights the area where the folds will be made.

steps.instruction: Inside reverse folds.
steps.visual_description: The bottom point of the shape from step 4 is folded upwards and inwards. Arrows indicate the fold.

steps.instruction: a. Inside reverse fold head. b. Outside reverse fold the tail. c. Inside reverse fold the feet.
steps.technique: inside reverse fold, outside reverse fold
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a bird shape. The head is folded inwards. The tail is folded outwards. The feet are folded inwards.

steps.instruction: a. Valley fold down the body. Repeat on the other side. b. Reverse fold the head. c. Crimp the tail.
steps.visual_description: A bird shape with the body folded downwards. The head is folded back. The tail is crimped.
A diagram of a finished origami cock, viewed from the side.

tips: 6" paper makes a 5" model.
projects.finished_product_description: An origami cock.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing the first step of folding a fish base.
Diagram illustrating a valley fold on a triangle.
Diagram showing a rabbit ear fold on a triangle.
Diagram showing the initial folds for the head and tail of the cock.
Diagram illustrating inside reverse folds at the bottom of the shape.
Diagram showing inside reverse fold for the head, outside reverse fold for the tail, and inside reverse fold for the feet.
Diagram showing valley fold for the body, reverse fold for the head, and crimp for the tail.
Diagram of the completed origami cock.

projects.name: Swimming Duck

steps.instruction: Begin with a colored bird base.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with a vertical fold line down the center. The bottom point is folded up to meet the center line, and then folded down. Arrows indicate folding the bottom edges to the center line.
The shape from step 1 is shown from a different angle. The top point is folded down, and the sides are folded inwards. An arrow indicates a rotation.
The shape from step 2 is shown. The top point is folded down, and the sides are folded inwards. An arrow indicates a rotation.
A flattened diamond shape with two flaps on the left side. Arrows indicate folding the top flap upwards and the bottom flap upwards, creating a zig-zag fold.
The shape from step 4 is shown. The left side has been folded to form a neck and head. The right side is folded to form the tail. Arrows indicate folding the neck and tail.
The origami duck is shown from the side. The head is formed by folding down the tip of the neck. The tail is formed by folding up the rear flap. Arrows indicate the folds for the head and tail.
The completed origami swimming duck, shown from the side.

tips: 10" paper makes a duck 6" from beak to tail.
projects.finished_product_description: An origami swimming duck.

diagram_descriptions: Diagrams illustrating the steps to fold an origami swimming duck.
Diagram 1: Starting with a bird base, folding edges to center.
Diagram 2: Folding top point down, sides inward, and rotating.
Diagram 3: Similar to diagram 2, showing further folding and rotation.
Diagram 4: Flattened shape with flaps on the left, indicating zig-zag folds.
Diagram 5: Forming the neck, head, and tail with arrows indicating folds.
Diagram 6: Showing the final folds for the head and tail.
Diagram 7: The completed origami swimming duck.

projects.name: Duck in a Lake

materials.color: white on one side, color on the other (for a colored lake with a white duck)

steps.instruction: Fold the square paper diagonally from top-left to bottom-right, then unfold.
steps.visual_description: Square sheet of paper, white side up. A dashed diagonal line runs from the top-left to the bottom-right corner. A curved arrow indicates folding along this line and then unfolding.

steps.instruction: Fold the square paper diagonally from top-right to bottom-left, then unfold. Bring two opposite corners to the center point.
steps.visual_description: Square sheet of paper, white side up. Two dashed diagonal lines intersect at the center. Curved arrows indicate folding along both diagonals and then unfolding.

steps.instruction: Bring the top point down to the center, then flatten the model into a triangle (waterbomb base).
steps.visual_description: A triangle shape with a dashed line running from the top vertex to the midpoint of the base. A curved arrow indicates folding the top vertex down along this line, then flattening the model.

steps.instruction: Fold the top layer of the right corner upwards along the center line.
steps.visual_description: A smaller triangle shape with a dashed line extending from the top vertex to the right edge of the flap. A curved arrow indicates folding the top layer of the right flap upwards along this line.

steps.instruction: Repeat the fold from step 4 on the left side, folding the top layer of the left corner upwards.
steps.visual_description: The same shape as step 4, but with dashed lines and arrows indicating folds on both the left and right sides.

steps.instruction: Open the right flap and squash fold it to create a rabbit ear.
steps.visual_description: A partially opened flap on the right side of the model, with an arrow showing the squash fold. The step is labeled 'Rabbit ear'.

steps.instruction: Repeat the rabbit ear fold on the left flap.
steps.visual_description: The model with both side flaps formed into rabbit ears. A curved arrow indicates repeating the rabbit ear fold on the left flap.

steps.instruction: Fold the top point down.
steps.visual_description: A long triangular shape with a dashed horizontal line near the top vertex. A curved arrow indicates folding the top point downwards along this line.

steps.instruction: Open the model and perform an inside reverse fold on the top point to shape the duck's neck.
steps.visual_description: The model being opened, with an arrow indicating an inside reverse fold being performed on the top point.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom corner up.
steps.visual_description: The model with the bottom corner folded up along a dashed line.

steps.instruction: Perform a small reverse fold at the tip of the duck's head to shape the beak.
steps.visual_description: An enlarged view of the duck's head area, showing a small dashed line at the tip of the beak. A curved arrow indicates a small reverse fold. The step is labeled 'Enlarged for clarity'.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom edge up to create the lake base.
steps.visual_description: The duck model is shown with a wavy outline representing the lake. A dashed line is along the bottom edge of the duck's body. A curved arrow indicates folding the bottom edge upwards to form the lake base.

steps.instruction: Perform a reverse fold on the tail and adjust the neck and head position.
steps.visual_description: The duck model on the lake base. Arrows indicate a reverse fold being performed on the tail and an adjustment to the neck/head position.

steps.instruction: The model is now complete.
steps.visual_description: The completed origami duck model, with a distinct head, neck, body, tail, and a base representing the lake.

tips: Practise the model first with a 10" paper.
projects.finished_product_description: An origami duck floating on a lake. A 6" square of paper makes a 3" lake with a 1/2" duck.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 1: Square sheet of paper with a diagonal dashed line and a curved arrow indicating a fold and unfold.
Diagram 2: Square sheet of paper with two diagonal dashed lines and curved arrows indicating folds towards the center.
Diagram 3: A triangle shape with a dashed line and a curved arrow showing the top point being folded down and flattened.
Diagram 4: A smaller triangle shape with a dashed line and a curved arrow indicating an upward fold on the top layer of the right side.
Diagram 5: The same shape as 4, but with dashed lines and arrows indicating upward folds on both the left and right top layers.
Diagram 6: A partially opened flap on the right side of the model, with an arrow showing a squash fold to form a 'rabbit ear'. Labeled 'Rabbit ear'.
Diagram 7: The model with both side flaps formed into rabbit ears. A curved arrow indicates repeating the rabbit ear fold on the left flap.
Diagram 8: A long triangular shape with the top point folded down along a dashed line.
Diagram 9: The model being opened, with an arrow indicating an inside reverse fold being performed on the top point.
Diagram 10: The model with the bottom corner folded up along a dashed line.

Diagram 11: An enlarged view of the duck's head area, showing a small dashed line at the tip of the beak. A curved arrow indicates a small reverse fold to shape the beak. Labeled 'Enlarged for clarity'.

Diagram 12: The duck model with a wavy outline representing the lake. A dashed line is along the bottom edge of the duck's body. A curved arrow indicates folding the bottom edge upwards to form the lake base.

Diagram 14: The completed origami duck model, with a distinct head, neck, body, tail, and a base representing the lake.

projects.name: Eagle

steps.instruction: White side up.

projects.name: Swan #3

steps.instruction: Start with a square piece of paper, folded into a diamond shape. Crease lines are shown.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with dashed lines indicating creases. Arrows show folding directions.

steps.instruction: Fold the top corners down to the center line.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with the top two corners folded down to the center vertical crease. Arrows indicate folding.

steps.instruction: Squash the two flaps.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with two flaps being squashed inwards. A thick vertical line indicates the squash.

steps.instruction: Fold the side flaps inwards.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with two flaps folded inwards towards the center. Arrows indicate folding.

steps.instruction: Results of step 4. Turn over.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with the sides folded in. A curved arrow indicates to turn the model over.

steps.instruction: Fold the top point down.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with the top point folded down along a dashed line. Arrows indicate folding.

steps.instruction: Results of step 6. Turn over and rotate model 90 degrees.
steps.visual_description: A long, pointed shape with two horizontal dashes on the front. A curved arrow indicates to turn over, and another circular arrow indicates to rotate 90 degrees.

tips: 10" paper makes a model 4-1/4" long and 4" high. Use monochrome white paper.

projects.name: Swan

steps.instruction: Fold the paper in half horizontally, then fold the top layer down to the center crease.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with a dashed line down the center. An arrow indicates folding the top layer down.

steps.instruction: Fold the slanted folded edge to the vertical mountain crease and flatten. Repeat on the other side. Swivel fold the left point. Refer to step 11 for the results of this move.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 9 is shown with arrows indicating folding the slanted edges to the center crease. A swivel fold is indicated on the left point.

steps.instruction: The result of the previous step is shown.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the paper folded into a shape resembling a bird's body with a neck and tail.

steps.instruction: Reposition the neck up and the tail out.
steps.visual_description: The neck and tail of the swan shape are shown being pulled upwards and outwards.

steps.instruction: Make the wing 3D by folding the left folded edge of wing to the vertical folded edge underneath the wing. Wings will be concave on the outside. Repeat on the other wing. Variation: Gently reverse the wings so that they become convex. Make the head 3D by slightly opening the folded flaps from the bottom of the head.
steps.visual_description: Diagrams showing the wings being folded to create a 3D effect. Arrows indicate the folding direction. A variation shows reversing the wings. The head is shown being made 3D by opening flaps.
A small diagram showing the final adjustments to the head and neck.

steps.instruction: Completed model.
steps.visual_description: A drawing of a completed origami swan.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami swan.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing step 9 of the origami swan, illustrating a fold.
Diagram showing step 10 of the origami swan, illustrating folds and a swivel fold.
Diagram showing the result of step 10, a partially formed swan shape.
Diagram showing step 12, repositioning the neck and tail.
Diagrams showing step 13, folding the wings to create a 3D effect and a variation.
Diagram showing step 14, final adjustments to the head.
Diagram showing step 15, the completed origami swan.

projects.name: Dove #2

steps.instruction: 1/4 white side up.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle with a vertical dashed line down the center. A diagonal line is drawn from the top-left corner to a point on the right edge, with a curved arrow indicating a fold.

A rectangle with a vertical dashed line down the center. A horizontal dashed line is drawn across the top third of the rectangle. A diagonal line is drawn from the top-left corner to the center of the horizontal dashed line. A curved arrow indicates a fold downwards.

steps.instruction: Diagram enlarged. Fold a fish base, keeping all layers together.
steps.visual_description: A square divided by a vertical and horizontal dashed line. Diagonal dashed lines connect the corners of the top half to the center point. Diagonal dashed lines connect the corners of the bottom half to the center point. The resulting shape is a diamond with a square on top.

steps.instruction: Pull out excess paper and fold to the right.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with a square on top. A vertical line is present in the center. A folded flap is shown on the right side, with a curved arrow indicating it is being pulled out and folded to the right.

steps.instruction: Squash fold.
steps.visual_description: A shape resembling a house with a pointed roof. The right side has a flap folded outwards. A dashed line indicates a fold line. A curved arrow shows the squash fold action.
A shape resembling a house with a pointed roof. The right side has been squash folded, creating a rectangular flap. A dashed line is visible on the left side, and a curved arrow indicates a fold.

A shape resembling a house with a pointed roof. The right side has been folded inwards. A vertical dashed line is in the center. A horizontal dashed line is present across the bottom. A curved arrow indicates a fold.

A shape resembling a house with a pointed roof. The right side has been folded inwards. A small flap is visible at the bottom. A dashed line is present on the left side, and a curved arrow indicates a fold.

A shape resembling a house with a pointed roof. The right side has been folded inwards. A small flap is visible at the bottom. A dashed line is present on the left side, and a curved arrow indicates a fold.

steps.instruction: Repeat steps 6-9 on left side.
steps.visual_description: A shape resembling a house with a pointed roof. The right side has been folded inwards. A small flap is visible at the bottom. A dashed line is present on the left side, and a curved arrow indicates a fold.

tips: 6" paper makes a 2 1/2" high 4" long model.
Model stands nicely.

projects.name: Origami Bird

steps.instruction: Use existing crease.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a folded paper shape with a dashed line indicating a crease. An arrow shows a fold being made along this crease.

steps.instruction: Reverse fold.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the paper shape from step 11, with an arrow indicating a reverse fold being performed on a section of the paper.
A diagram showing the origami bird shape. Arrows indicate folds being made on the wings and body.

steps.instruction: Reverse fold tail.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the origami bird shape. An arrow indicates a reverse fold being made on the tail section.
A diagram showing a folded paper shape, possibly a preliminary step for the head or tail, with dashed lines indicating folds.

steps.instruction: Tail can be pleated again if desired.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the completed origami bird, with its head, body, wings, and tail clearly defined. An arrow points to the tail, suggesting further manipulation.

Diagram showing step 12 of origami bird folding: reverse fold.
