projects.name: Pecking Bird

steps.instruction: Begin with white side up.
steps.visual_description: A square with dashed lines indicating diagonal folds and curved arrows showing direction of fold.

steps.instruction: Allow slight "fudge factor" up the center.
steps.visual_description: A 3D representation of the paper folded into a kite-like shape, with arrows indicating a slight adjustment in the center.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold model so flaps are on the outside.
steps.visual_description: The kite-like shape from step 2, now with mountain folds applied, showing flaps on the exterior. A curved arrow indicates a folding action.

steps.instruction: Squash flaps on both sides.
steps.visual_description: A long, thin triangular shape with two flaps on each side. Arrows indicate the action of squashing these flaps.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold both sides of flap. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 4, with mountain folds applied to the flaps. An arrow indicates repeating the action on the back.

steps.instruction: Fold left side of flap over to right. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 5, with the left side of a flap folded over to the right. An arrow indicates repeating on the back. A circular arrow indicates a rotation.

steps.instruction: Precrease front and back as shown. Outside reverse right side of model.
steps.visual_description: A long, thin shape resembling a bird's body and tail. A dashed line indicates a precrease. Arrows show an outside reverse fold on the right side.

tips: Use thin paper.
projects.finished_product_description: A 4" bird with a 7-1/2" tail.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing the first step of folding a square paper with dashed lines and arrows.
Diagram showing the second step of folding, with a slight adjustment in the center.
Diagram showing the third step, a mountain fold with flaps on the outside.
Diagram showing the fourth step, squashing flaps on both sides.
Diagram showing the fifth step, mountain folding flaps and repeating behind.
Diagram showing the sixth step, folding a flap over and repeating behind, with a rotation symbol.
Diagram showing the seventh step, precreasing and performing an outside reverse fold.

projects.name: Origami Bird

steps.instruction: Outside reverse the right side of model.
steps.visual_description: A long, thin shape with a pointed end, undergoing an outside reverse fold on the right side, creating a triangular flap and a pointed section.

steps.instruction:
a. Outside reverse birds head down.
b. Bisect and swivel fold flap behind legs. Repeat behind. See results in step 10.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 8 is shown with the head folded down using an outside reverse fold. A flap is then bisected and swiveled behind the legs.

steps.instruction:
a. Pleat to form head and neck.
b. Outside reverse tail down.
steps.visual_description: The model's head and neck are formed by pleating. The tail is then folded down using an outside reverse fold.

steps.instruction: Inside reverse tail. Note the final angle of tail in step 12.
steps.visual_description: The tail of the origami bird is folded using an inside reverse fold. A small arrow indicates the direction of the fold.

steps.instruction: Stand bird on edge of table. Hold tail where shown and slightly move tail up and to the left pivoting bird on it's legs to make the bird appear to be pecking.
steps.visual_description: The origami bird is shown standing on the edge of a table. The tail is held in a specific position, and the bird is balanced on its legs, appearing to peck.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami bird that can be made to appear to be pecking by balancing it on its legs and adjusting its tail.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing step 8 of origami bird construction: outside reverse fold on the right side.
Diagram showing step 9 of origami bird construction: outside reverse fold for the head and bisect/swivel fold for the legs.
Diagram showing step 10 of origami bird construction: pleating for head/neck and outside reverse fold for the tail.
Diagram showing step 11 of origami bird construction: inside reverse fold for the tail.
Diagram showing step 12 of origami bird construction: the finished bird standing on a table edge and appearing to peck.

projects.name: Flying Duck

steps.instruction: Bird base. Fold one flap up.
steps.visual_description: A diamond-shaped bird base with a dashed line indicating a fold and an arrow showing one flap being folded upwards.

steps.instruction: Continue folding from the previous step.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with two arrows pointing inwards from the sides, suggesting a collapse or narrowing fold.

steps.instruction: Continue folding.
steps.visual_description: A more elongated diamond shape with a dashed line and an arrow pointing downwards, indicating a fold. Dotted lines suggest internal layers.

steps.instruction: Narrow the tail.
steps.visual_description: An elongated shape with dashed lines and arrows pointing inwards at the bottom, narrowing the tail section.

steps.instruction: Minor miracle.
steps.visual_description: A shape with a head and tail emerging, an arrow indicates a fold or shaping action on the body.

steps.instruction: Continue from the previous step.
steps.visual_description: The duck shape is now upright, showing the head and tail formed.

steps.instruction: Fold down the first wing, starting at the lower end of the crease. The head will stand up, coming out of the page. Continue, folding the extra layers that form the leading edge of the wing.
steps.visual_description: The duck shape is rotated, showing one wing being folded down. A curved arrow indicates the folding motion.

steps.instruction: As you fold the second wing back, the head will come forward to lie flat.
steps.visual_description: The duck shape is shown from a different angle, with the head now flat and the second wing being folded.

steps.instruction: Narrow one side of the neck.
steps.visual_description: The duck shape is shown in profile. A dashed line and an arrow indicate a fold on the neck area, and a small flap is shown opening.

steps.instruction: Narrow the other side of the neck, turning over.
steps.visual_description: The duck shape is shown from the other side, with a curved arrow indicating the model is turned over, and a fold on the neck.

steps.instruction: Reverse fold.
steps.visual_description: The duck shape with an arrow indicating a reverse fold on the head/neck area.

tips: Note that a small flap pulls open, improving the angle of the breast.
projects.finished_product_description: An origami flying duck, approximately 4 inches long.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 1: Bird base with one flap folded up.
Diagram 2: Bird base with inward folds indicated by arrows.
Diagram 3: Elongated shape with a downward fold indicated.
Diagram 4: Shape with the tail section being narrowed by inward folds.
Diagram 5: Partially formed duck shape with a body fold indicated.
Diagram 6: Upright duck shape with head and tail formed.
Diagram 7: Duck shape with one wing being folded down.
Diagram 8: Duck shape with the second wing being folded back and the head lying flat.
Diagram 9: Profile view of the duck, showing a fold to narrow one side of the neck and a small flap opening.
Diagram 10: Duck shape turned over, showing a fold to narrow the other side of the neck.
Diagram 11: Duck shape with a reverse fold indicated on the head/neck area.

projects.name: Origami Crane

steps.instruction: Reverse fold to form the head. Crease down a wing, repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows a partially folded origami bird. Arrows indicate a reverse fold for the head and creasing down a wing, with a note to repeat on the other side.

steps.instruction: Pleat the beak. Open wings.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows a diamond shape with arrows indicating pleating for the beak, and another diagram showing the wings being opened.

steps.instruction: Squash crimp the tail horizontal.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows a tail section of the origami bird with arrows indicating a horizontal squash crimp.

steps.instruction: And away they fly.
steps.visual_description: Two finished origami birds in flight, depicted with wings spread.

projects.finished_product_description: Two origami birds in flight.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing steps 12, 13, and 14 of an origami crane.
Diagram showing a diamond shape for pleating the beak.
Diagram showing the finished origami crane in flight.

projects.name: Flying Eagle

steps.instruction: Start with the colored windmill base.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a square divided into four smaller squares, with dashed lines indicating folds and arrows showing the direction of folds, forming a windmill base.

steps.instruction: a. Wing fold all 4 corners. b. Hinge fold all layers in all 4 corners.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a square with four corners being folded inwards, followed by a hinge fold on all layers of the corners.

steps.instruction: a. Valley fold corner tips inward. b. Mountain fold 4 corners behind. Note: The triangle hinge folded end up pointing to the center where b is completed.
steps.visual_description: Diagrams showing the corner tips being folded inward (valley fold), then the corners being folded backward (mountain fold), with a note about the triangle hinge pointing to the center.
A diagram showing the result of step 3, with four points extending outwards.

steps.instruction: Turn over.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the model being turned over.

steps.instruction: Stretch and flatten. Turn over.
steps.visual_description: Diagrams showing the model being stretched and flattened, then turned over.

steps.instruction: Open out and squash fold.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing the model being opened out and then squash folded, resulting in a star-like shape with feathered edges.

tips: 10" paper makes model with 8" wing span and 4" body.
projects.finished_product_description: A paper eagle model with outstretched wings.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing the initial steps of folding a square paper into a windmill base.
Diagram illustrating wing folds and hinge folds on the corners of the paper.
Diagrams demonstrating valley and mountain folds on the corner tips.
Diagram showing the model after initial folds.
Diagram indicating to turn the model over.
Diagrams showing stretching, flattening, and turning the model.
Diagram illustrating the final step of opening out and squash folding to create the eagle shape.

projects.name: Origami Bird

steps.instruction: Do color change. (Turn inside out.)
steps.visual_description: A square origami base with four flaps, two of which are partially folded inwards, showing a color change.

steps.instruction: Fold down. (Back point comes up.)
steps.visual_description: The origami base from step 8, with one of the points being folded downwards and an arrow indicating it comes up.

steps.instruction: Turn over.
steps.visual_description: The origami from step 9, now flipped over. It shows a square with four pointed flaps radiating from the center.

steps.instruction: Fold the head. Tuck the corner of the tail inside.
steps.visual_description: The origami from step 10, with one of the points being folded to form the head. Arrows indicate tucking a tail corner inside.

steps.instruction: Fold the beak, then the tail and shape the body.
steps.visual_description: The origami bird's head is being formed by folding the beak. The tail is also being shaped, and the body is being creased.

steps.instruction: Reverse fold the beak. Fold both sides of the head.
steps.visual_description: A close-up view within a circle showing the beak being reverse folded. Arrows indicate the folding direction. The sides of the head are also being folded.

steps.instruction: Shape model.
steps.visual_description: The completed origami bird, shown from the side, with its head, beak, body, and tail clearly defined and shaped.

projects.finished_product_description: A finished origami bird with a distinct head, beak, body, and tail.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing step 8: A square base with four points, with two flaps folded inwards.
Diagram showing step 9: Folding one point down and indicating it comes up.
Diagram showing step 10: The model turned over, revealing a square with four points.
Diagram showing step 11: Folding the head and tucking the tail.
Diagram showing step 12: Folding the beak and shaping the tail and body.
Diagram showing step 13: A close-up of the beak being reverse folded and the head sides folded.
Diagram showing step 14: The final origami bird model.

projects.name: Hen

steps.instruction: Begin with a colored waterbomb base. Squash fold.
steps.visual_description: A triangular waterbomb base is shown. A dashed line indicates a fold from the top point down, and a curved arrow shows a squash fold being performed on the bottom part of the triangle, creating a diamond shape within the base. A small 'x' mark is on the bottom left corner.

steps.instruction: Sink both sides as you bring up the point, then bring it down again.
steps.visual_description: The triangular base from step 1 is shown. The top point is being sunk inwards, indicated by dashed lines and curved arrows showing the paper being brought up and then down. Two small triangular flaps are visible at the bottom.

steps.instruction: Fold the right half of the top layer to the left. Repeat steps 1 and 2 at the back.
steps.visual_description: The triangular shape from step 2 is shown. The right half of the top layer is folded over to the left, indicated by a curved arrow. A small 'x' mark is on the bottom left corner.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold the excess paper under as shown. Swivel the assembly in the middle to the right and mountain fold the excess paper under as well. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: The folded shape from step 3 is shown. A section of paper is mountain-folded underneath, indicated by dashed lines. A curved arrow shows a swivel motion of the assembly to the right. A small 'x' mark is on the bottom left corner.

steps.instruction: Sink the pinnacle as diagrammed. Reverse fold the two points at the bottom. These will be the legs.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 4 is shown. The top point (pinnacle) is sunk inwards, indicated by dashed lines and arrows. The two points at the bottom are reverse-folded to form the legs, also shown with dashed lines and arrows. Small triangles indicate layers.

steps.instruction: Outside reverse fold the left side of the assembly and double crimp fold on the right. Reverse fold the legs again.
steps.technique: outside reverse fold, double crimp fold
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 5 is shown with further complex folds. The left side of the assembly is outside reverse folded. The right side has a double crimp fold. The legs at the bottom are reverse-folded again. Multiple arrows and dashed lines illustrate these intricate folds.

tips: 10" paper makes a model 5" tall.
projects.finished_product_description: An origami hen model.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 1: A triangular waterbomb base with a dashed line indicating a fold and a curved arrow showing a squash fold.
Diagram 2: The triangular base with the top point being sunk inwards, indicated by dashed lines and curved arrows.
Diagram 3: The folded shape from step 2, with the right half of the top layer folded to the left, shown with a curved arrow.
Diagram 4: The folded shape from step 3, with excess paper mountain-folded underneath and a swivel motion indicated by a curved arrow.
Diagram 5: The shape from step 4, showing the pinnacle sunk inwards and the two bottom points reverse-folded to form legs.
Diagram 6: The final stage of folding, illustrating an outside reverse fold on the left, a double crimp fold on the right, and further reverse folds on the legs.

projects.name: Origami Bird

steps.instruction: Narrow the legs. Sink the left assembly as illustrated. This will form the breast, neck and head. Make two little sink folds on each side of the assembly just above the thighs.
steps.visual_description: An origami bird model with its legs being narrowed and a sink fold being made on the left side, indicated by dashed lines and arrows. Two small sink folds are shown above the thighs.

steps.instruction: Outside reverse fold the right side of the middle. This will be the tail end. Sink the breast area. Reverse fold the head and feet.
steps.technique: outside reverse fold, sink fold, reverse fold
steps.visual_description: The origami bird model from step 7, with an outside reverse fold on the right side of the middle, indicated by curved arrows. The breast area is shown being sunk, and the head and feet are being reverse folded.

steps.instruction: Reverse fold the feet and tail end again. Crimp to form head and beak.
steps.visual_description: The origami bird model from step 8, with the feet and tail end being reverse folded again. The head and beak are being crimped, indicated by dashed lines and arrows.

steps.instruction: Reverse fold the beak a little. Pull out the hidden layers at the tail end to complete the model.
steps.visual_description: The origami bird model from step 9, with the beak being reverse folded slightly. Hidden layers at the tail end are being pulled out to complete the model, indicated by arrows.

projects.finished_product_description: A completed origami bird model.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing step 7 of an origami bird, illustrating narrowing the legs and making sink folds.
Diagram showing step 8 of an origami bird, illustrating outside reverse folds, sinking the breast, and reverse folding the head and feet.
Diagram showing step 9 of an origami bird, illustrating reverse folding the feet and tail, and crimping the head and beak.
Diagram showing step 10 of an origami bird, illustrating reverse folding the beak and pulling out tail layers.
A circular emblem containing a finished origami bird model, with a signature below it.

steps.instruction: Colored side up. Crease.

steps.instruction: Like so. Steps 10-15 are close-ups of the foot at the bottom right. The preliminary fold behind is not shown.

steps.instruction: Inside reverse fold.

An enlarged view of a flap, showing a fold being made. A triangular section is folded inwards. Dashed lines indicate creases. Arrows show the direction of the fold.

projects.name: Origami Bird

steps.instruction: Inside reverse fold both flaps. Repeat steps 10-15 on the left.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a folded paper shape with two flaps. Arrows indicate an inside reverse fold on the right flap. A dotted line shows where the fold will occur. The text 'Repeat steps 10-15 on the left' suggests symmetry.

steps.instruction: Turn over.
steps.visual_description: A diagram of a diamond-shaped origami base, viewed from the front. A central vertical crease is visible.

steps.instruction: Inside reverse folds.
steps.visual_description: A diagram of the diamond-shaped origami base from step 16. Arrows indicate inside reverse folds on the two top flaps, creating a pointed shape at the top. Dotted lines show the fold lines.

steps.instruction: Bring the bottom point to the right.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the origami shape from step 17. The bottom point is being folded towards the right side. An arrow indicates the direction of the fold.

steps.instruction: Fold in half.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the origami shape from step 18. The shape is being folded in half vertically, with the right side folded over the left. A dashed line indicates the fold line.

steps.instruction: Outside crimp fold. Repeat behind. There will a layer at the center of the model, which should be folded asymmetrically; it will go to either one side of the model or to the other.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the folded origami shape. An arrow indicates an outside crimp fold on the top layer. The text explains that this fold is asymmetrical and can go to either side.

steps.instruction: Enlarged. Swivel the right flap between the bottom flaps so it lies flat inside the model.
steps.visual_description: An enlarged view of the origami shape. A right flap is being swiveled inwards and flattened between the lower flaps. Arrows indicate the movement.

steps.instruction: Swivel. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the origami shape. An arrow indicates a swivel action on a flap. The text 'Repeat behind' suggests this action is mirrored on the other side.

steps.instruction: Swivel back.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the origami shape. An arrow indicates a swivel action on a flap, likely forming the head of the bird. The word 'head' is labeled near this area.

steps.instruction: Pleat wing, and swivel the bottom flaps to the position shown in the next diagram.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the origami shape. An arrow indicates a pleat on a wing-like structure. Other arrows show the bottom flaps being swiveled into a new position.

steps.instruction: Pleat under wings. Double rabbit ear legs. Outside reverse fold head. Inside reverse fold neck.
steps.technique: pleating, double rabbit ear fold, outside reverse fold, inside reverse fold
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the origami shape. Arrows indicate pleating under the wings. The legs are formed using a double rabbit ear fold. The head is formed with an outside reverse fold, and the neck with an inside reverse fold. Labels 'wings', 'legs', and 'tail' are present.

steps.instruction: Detail of the head. Sink at top. Swivel at right. Three reverse folds.
steps.visual_description: A detailed diagram of the head area of the origami bird. Arrows indicate sinking a fold at the top and swiveling a section to the right. The text mentions three reverse folds are involved in shaping the head.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami bird with distinct head, body, wings, tail, and legs.

diagram_descriptions: Page 93 of an origami instruction booklet.

Diagram for step 23 shows a swivel action to form the head.

projects.name: Origami Bird

steps.instruction: Valley fold.
steps.visual_description: A small diagram showing a shape with a dashed line indicating a valley fold.

steps.instruction: Enlarged. Swivel the inside point downwards to form beak. Swivel the upper point upwards slightly.
steps.visual_description: An enlarged diagram showing a folded paper shape. Arrows indicate swiveling an inside point downwards to form a beak and an upper point upwards.

steps.instruction: Sink at neck. Mountain fold legs. Double rabbit ear to form tail. Fold wings towards front, then curl them back.
steps.technique: sink fold, mountain fold, rabbit ear fold
steps.visual_description: A diagram of an origami bird in progress. Arrows indicate sinking the neck, mountain folding the legs, forming the tail with a double rabbit ear fold, and folding the wings.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold legs and fold at the toes to form feet. Inside reverse fold the tail up. Mountain folds at bottom.
steps.visual_description: A diagram of an origami bird. Arrows show mountain folding the legs and folding the toes to form feet. The tail is shown being folded upwards with an inside reverse fold. Mountain folds are indicated at the bottom.

steps.instruction: Detail of tail; crimp.
steps.visual_description: A close-up diagram of the tail of the origami bird, showing a crimp fold.

steps.instruction: Try to give the body a full rounded appearance. Model finished.
steps.visual_description: A diagram of a finished origami bird standing on its feet, with a rounded body and detailed tail and wings.

projects.finished_product_description: A finished origami bird.

diagram_descriptions: Page number 94.
Diagram for step 27: Valley fold.

Diagram for step 30: Origami bird showing how to fold legs and feet, and detail on tail folding.
Diagram for step 31: Close-up of the tail showing a crimp fold.
Diagram for step 32: A finished origami bird.

projects.name: Fairy

steps.instruction: Start with a preliminary base.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper folded into a preliminary base, showing diagonal and horizontal creases. Arrows indicate folding the top flaps down along the center crease.

steps.instruction: Petal fold the front and back flaps.
steps.visual_description: The preliminary base from step 1, with the top flaps folded down. The image shows the result of a petal fold on the front flaps, creating a diamond shape with two flaps on each side.
A diamond shape with two flaps on each side, similar to the result of step 2, but with dotted lines indicating further folds.

steps.instruction: Fold one flap to the right.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with two flaps on each side. One flap on the right side is folded to the right, indicated by an arrow.

steps.instruction: Fold and unfold.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 4, with the flap folded to the right and then unfolded. A crease is now visible on the flap.

steps.instruction: This fold is similar to a sink, but as you execute the fold, swing the two inner flaps to the right.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with two flaps on each side. The right flap has been folded and unfolded. The instruction indicates a sink fold on the right side, with arrows showing the two inner flaps being swung to the right.

steps.instruction: Spread-squash the flap.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 6, with the right side spread open and then squashed flat. The resulting shape has two pointed 'legs' or 'wings'.

steps.instruction: Fold the flap back up.
steps.visual_description: The squashed flap from step 7, with one of the resulting flaps being folded upwards, indicated by an arrow.

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: Follow steps 1-8 to fold the fairy.

tips: A 6" piece of paper produces a 3" model with a 4-1/2" wingspan.
Can be folded from any type of paper but foil works best.
Works very well in miniature.
Thank you to Yoshihisa Kimura whose own model inspired this work.
projects.finished_product_description: A paper fairy model.

projects.name: Origami Bird

steps.instruction: Fold the flaps upward.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a partially folded origami model with two flaps pointing upwards, indicated by arrows. A curved arrow indicates a turning motion.

steps.instruction: Fold the flaps down. Use the corner of the hidden area, which is indicated by the dotted line, as a guide.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the origami model from step 9, with the flaps being folded downwards. A dotted line indicates a guide for the fold.

steps.instruction: Fold and unfold. Turn the model over.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the origami model being folded and then unfolded. An arrow indicates turning the model over. Another arrow indicates a turning motion.

steps.instruction: This step can be somewhat vague, but it is not difficult once you understand what is being done. Pinch the model together at point A and carefully reverse fold, keeping ridge AB tightly closed. This may be easier if you insert a finger inside the model where indicated by the arrow. See step 17 for an intermediary view of the fold.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the origami model with points A and B highlighted. An arrow indicates pinching the model. Another arrow indicates inserting a finger inside the model.

steps.instruction: Fold the flaps back up.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the origami model with flaps being folded upwards, indicated by arrows.

steps.instruction: Reverse fold.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the origami model with a reverse fold being performed on a section, indicated by arrows.

steps.instruction: Reverse fold the flap again.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the origami model with a flap being reverse folded again, indicated by arrows.

steps.instruction: Open the top of the model and flatten out the wings.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the origami model with the top section being opened and the wings being flattened, indicated by arrows.

steps.instruction: This is a view from the top of the model. Using the existing creases as a guide, tuck the entire dark gray area underneath the wings. To accomplish this, the entire darkened region will need to be crushed into a compressed ridge just under the edge of the wing, as shown in the second illustration. Close the wings again.
steps.visual_description: Two diagrams showing the top view of the origami model. The first shows the dark gray area to be tucked. The second shows the dark gray area tucked underneath the wings, forming a compressed ridge. Arrows indicate the tucking and closing actions.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami bird.

diagram_descriptions: Page number 96.

projects.name: Origami Model

steps.instruction: Valley fold the flaps in front and behind.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a folded paper shape with two flaps being folded inwards.

steps.instruction: Fold the flaps back down.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the flaps from the previous step being folded back down.

steps.instruction: Like this. The second view is from the front of the model. Grasp the edges of the paper where shown and gently open the paper. The model will become 3D.
steps.visual_description: Two diagrams. The left shows a folded paper shape. The right shows the same shape opened up into a 3D form, with arrows indicating outward pulling motion from the sides.

steps.instruction: This is a 3D view of the opened model. Put the mountain fold creases into place by pushing the indicated points upward from underneath.
steps.visual_description: A 3D diagram of the origami model, showing points A, B, and C. Arrows indicate pushing points upward from underneath to create mountain folds.

steps.instruction: Push the two side flaps back into place, flat against their adjacent layers.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the origami model with two side flaps being pushed inwards and flattened against the main body.

steps.instruction: Do the same with the other side. As you do so, points A and B will swing naturally toward each other.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the origami model with points A and B on one side being brought together, with curved arrows indicating their movement.

steps.instruction: Complete the construction by closing the model as indicated.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the origami model in a partially closed state, with arrows indicating further closing action.

steps.instruction: Fold and unfold. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a section of the origami model being folded and then unfolded. An arrow indicates repeating the action on the back side.

steps.instruction: Sink, repeat behind. This fold is easier if you unfold the triangular flap substantially.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a triangular flap being pushed inwards and sunk into the model. An arrow indicates repeating on the back. Another arrow shows unfolding the flap for easier sinking.

projects.finished_product_description: A 3D origami model.

diagram_descriptions: Diagrams illustrating steps 18-20 of an origami process, showing folding and opening a paper model.

projects.name: Origami Bird

steps.instruction: Crease through all thicknesses.
steps.visual_description: A folded paper shape with multiple layers, showing a crease line being made through all of them.

steps.instruction: Like this, and unfold.
steps.visual_description: A folded paper shape with a crease, and an arrow indicating it should be unfolded.

steps.instruction: Crimp, bringing the outside layers to either side, and the central layer through the middle. The extra ridge attached to the central layers can fall to either side.
steps.visual_description: A folded paper shape where the outer layers are folded to the sides and the inner layer is brought through the middle. Arrows indicate the movement of the paper layers.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold, if the paper is stiff enough to hold the crease, otherwise sink. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: A folded paper shape with a mountain fold being made. Arrows indicate the direction of the fold. A note suggests an alternative 'sink' fold if the paper is not stiff.

steps.instruction: Reverse fold the two flaps.
steps.visual_description: A folded paper shape with two flaps, and arrows indicating that these flaps should be reverse folded.

steps.instruction: Rabbit ear each of the arms.
steps.visual_description: A folded paper shape with two 'arms' or flaps, and arrows indicating that a rabbit ear fold should be performed on each.

steps.instruction: Flatten out the wings again.
steps.visual_description: A folded paper shape, likely a bird, with arrows indicating that the wings should be flattened out.

steps.instruction: Grasp the paper firmly where indicated and gently pull the front of the wings partially apart.
steps.visual_description: A folded paper shape, showing the wings. Arrows indicate where to grasp and pull to separate the front edges of the wings.

steps.instruction: Flatten out the paper that is sticking up in the areas indicated by the open arrows. Curl the front edge and rear of the wings upward.
steps.visual_description: A folded paper shape, likely a bird, with arrows indicating areas to flatten and other arrows showing the front and rear edges of the wings being curled upward.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami bird with detailed wings.

steps.instruction: Flatten the point and curl it downward.

steps.instruction: This model has two options for the head. This stylized version is the first. If you like it, skip ahead to step 39. Otherwise, pull down the extra paper from both sides of the head.

steps.instruction: Sculpt the head into final form.

projects.name: Heart with Stand

steps.instruction: Start with a colored water bomb base. Do a kind of petal fold. Sink in a bit of the tip. Turn model upside down.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a folded paper shape with dashed lines indicating folds and arrows showing movement. A curved arrow indicates rotation. The shape resembles a flattened diamond with flaps.

steps.instruction: Fold lower triangles to center. Then valley fold the same flaps inside. Mountain fold the two upper innermost corners. Do a kind of petal fold.
steps.technique: valley fold, mountain fold, petal fold
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a triangular shape with dashed lines. Arrows indicate folding the bottom corners towards the center. Another diagram shows a more complex folded shape with labels A and F, and a line segment B. A curved arrow indicates a folding motion.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold the top tips to shape heart. Fold down the back flap to form the stand.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing two heart shapes. The left heart has small V-shaped folds at the top. The right heart shows the completed shape of the heart with a folded flap at the bottom.
A diagram showing the completed heart shape with a stand.

tips: 6" paper makes a model 2-3/4" high.

steps.visual_description: The top corners of the folded paper are folded down to meet the center crease, forming a triangle shape at the top.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom corners up to meet the top point.
steps.visual_description: The bottom corners of the paper are folded upwards to meet the apex of the triangle formed in step 2.

steps.instruction: Fold the top flap down.
steps.visual_description: The top triangular flap is folded downwards.

steps.instruction: Fold the model in half along the center crease.
steps.visual_description: The entire model is folded in half along the original vertical center crease.

steps.instruction: Fold the front leg down.
steps.visual_description: One of the bottom sections is folded downwards to form a leg.

steps.instruction: Fold the back leg down.
steps.visual_description: The other bottom section is folded downwards to form the other leg.

steps.instruction: Fold the head and neck.
steps.visual_description: The top section is folded to create the head and neck of the horse.

steps.instruction: Completed model.
steps.visual_description: A finished origami horse, standing on two legs, with a distinct head and tail.

tips: 6" paper makes a horse 3-1/2" tall.
projects.finished_product_description: A minimalist origami horse.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing a square piece of paper folded in half vertically, with dashed lines indicating the fold.
Diagram showing the top corners of the folded paper folded down to meet the center crease, forming a triangle shape at the top.
Diagram showing the bottom corners of the paper folded upwards to meet the apex of the triangle formed in step 2.
Diagram showing the top triangular flap folded downwards.
Diagram showing the entire model folded in half along the original vertical center crease.
Diagram showing one of the bottom sections folded downwards to form a leg.
Diagram showing the other bottom section folded downwards to form the other leg.
Diagram showing the top section folded to create the head and neck of the horse.
Diagram of a finished origami horse, standing on two legs, with a distinct head and tail.

projects.name: COW

materials.dimensions: half the size of the paper used for the body (as per editor's note)

steps.instruction: White side up. Make waterbomb base.
steps.visual_description: A square sheet of paper shown with its white side facing up. It has two diagonal dashed lines and two perpendicular dashed lines, all intersecting at the center, indicating the creases required to form a waterbomb base.

steps.instruction: Using the top layer, valley crease both ends to the center line. Divide in thirds up to the center line on both sides, then fold over two times (both sides). This should form the cow's horns.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the top triangular layer of the waterbomb base. Multiple dashed lines indicate valley creases extending from the outer edges towards the central vertical line. Arrows show the folding action inwards. The diagram illustrates multiple folds on each side, resulting in two pointed horn shapes. A curved arrow indicates turning the model over.

steps.instruction: Using the bottom layer, crimp on both sides. The valley folds should lie along the folded ends of the top layer. After that, tuck inside and mountain fold the two top corners to taste. This will form the cow's ears.
steps.technique: crimping, valley folding, tucking, mountain folding
steps.visual_description: A diagram of the partially folded origami model, focusing on the bottom layer. Dashed lines and arrows illustrate valley folds for crimping on both sides, and the subsequent tucking inside and mountain folding of the two top corners, forming ear-like structures.

steps.instruction: Valley fold from the bottom to taste. Turn over.
steps.visual_description: A diagram of the nearly completed origami cow head. An upward arrow indicates a valley fold from the bottom point of the model. A curved arrow indicates turning the model over to view the other side.

projects.finished_product_description: A folded paper cow head.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 1: A square with horizontal, vertical, and diagonal dashed lines intersecting at the center, indicating creases for a waterbomb base.
Diagram 2: A triangular shape, representing the top layer of the waterbomb base, with dashed lines and arrows showing folds to create horns.
Diagram 3: A partially folded origami model, illustrating crimping of the bottom layer and folding of corners to form ears.
Diagram 4: A nearly completed origami cow head, showing a final valley fold from the bottom and an instruction to turn the model over.

projects.name: Origami Cow

steps.instruction: White side up. Start with waterbomb base.
steps.visual_description: A square with fold lines indicating a waterbomb base: a vertical center fold, a horizontal center fold, and two diagonal folds meeting at the center.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold up to center point, then sink.
steps.visual_description: A triangular shape with a horizontal fold line near the bottom. An arrow indicates folding the bottom point upwards to the center, and a 'sink' action is implied.

steps.instruction: Using the top layer, valley fold both ends to lie along the center line.
steps.visual_description: A triangular shape with the bottom point folded up. Arrows indicate folding the two side edges of the top layer inwards to meet the center line.

steps.instruction: On the top layer only, mountain fold the side and bottom ends as shown in the diagram, then reverse fold.
steps.visual_description: A shape resembling a kite with two flaps at the bottom. Arrows indicate mountain folds on the side edges and the bottom point, followed by a reverse fold.

steps.instruction: The cow's head is complete.
steps.visual_description: An origami cow's head with two horns, a body, and two side flaps that could be ears or legs. The head is trapezoidal with two triangular horns on top.

steps.instruction: Larger view.
steps.visual_description: A larger view of the origami cow's head, now with two black oval eyes and a grey snout with two lighter grey oval nostrils.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami cow's head with facial features.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing the steps to create an origami cow's head, starting with a waterbomb base and progressing through several folds.
A completed origami cow's head, shown from two different angles/stages of completion.

projects.name: Origami Cow

steps.instruction: Valley fold the two ends of the bottom layer so that the raw edges lie along the top layer in two diagonals. After that, tuck the folds of the bottom layer under the top layer.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a flat piece of paper with two diagonal valley folds indicated by dashed lines and arrows. The ends are then tucked under the top layer.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold the bottom center corners to taste, then reverse fold them.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a folded paper shape with two small triangular sections at the bottom center being mountain folded inwards and then reverse folded.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold model in half.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the paper model being folded in half vertically with a mountain fold.

steps.instruction: The cow's body is now complete. It should be able to stand.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the completed body of the origami cow, standing upright. It has a triangular head and two large folded sections for the body and legs.

steps.instruction: Fit the tab underneath the cow's head into the slot on top of the cow's body. The slot on top of the body is formed by pulling all the layers slightly apart.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the head of the origami cow with a tab being inserted into a slot on the body. The head has eyes and a snout drawn on it. The body is shown separately, with the slot indicated.

steps.instruction: Completed model.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the fully assembled origami cow, with the head attached to the body. The cow has a simple, geometric design.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami cow model.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing step 5 of origami cow construction: valley fold ends and tuck.
Diagram showing step 6 of origami cow construction: mountain fold and reverse fold bottom corners.
Diagram showing step 7 of origami cow construction: mountain fold model in half.
Diagram showing step 8 of origami cow construction: the completed cow body, standing.
Diagram showing step 9 of origami cow construction: attaching the cow's head to the body.
Diagram showing step 10 of origami cow construction: the completed origami cow model.

projects.name: Bull Terrier

steps.instruction: Fold the paper in half vertically, then unfold. Fold the top edges to the center crease.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with a vertical center crease. Dashed lines indicate folding the top edges to the center. Curved arrows show the direction of the folds.

steps.instruction: Fold the top point down to the horizontal center line.
steps.visual_description: The diamond shape from step 1, with the top point folded down to the horizontal center line. A curved arrow indicates the fold direction.

steps.instruction: Fold the two top edges to the center crease.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 2, with the two upper slanted edges folded to meet at the center crease.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom point up to the top point. Fold the sides inwards along the indicated lines.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 3. The bottom point is folded up to meet the top. Dashed lines and arrows indicate folding the sides inwards.

steps.instruction: Fold the top layer of the right side outwards.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 4. The top layer of the right side is folded outwards, creating a flap. An arrow indicates the fold direction.

steps.instruction: Fold the tip of the flap down.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 5. The tip of the flap folded in step 5 is folded downwards.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom edge upwards.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 6. The bottom edge is folded upwards.

steps.instruction: Fold the left side flap outwards.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 7. The left side flap is folded outwards. An arrow indicates the fold direction.

steps.instruction: Shape the head and tail.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 8. The model is being refined to resemble a bull terrier, with folds creating the head and tail. Dashed lines and arrows indicate final shaping folds.

tips: 6" paper makes a 3" dog.
projects.finished_product_description: An origami bull terrier.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing step 1 of folding a diamond shape with creases and fold indicators.
Diagram showing step 2 of folding the top point down.
Diagram showing step 3 of folding the upper edges to the center.
Diagram showing step 4 of folding the bottom point up and sides inwards.
Diagram showing step 5 of folding a flap outwards.
Diagram showing step 6 of folding the tip of the flap down.
Diagram showing step 7 of folding the bottom edge upwards.
Diagram showing step 8 of folding a side flap outwards.
Diagram showing step 9 of shaping the origami model to resemble a bull terrier.

projects.name: Origami Dog

steps.instruction: Fold the top flap down and to the right, aligning the edge with the center crease. Repeat on the other side.
steps.visual_description: A partially folded origami dog shape. Arrows indicate folding the top triangular flap down and to the right, aligning its edge with a dashed center line. Another arrow shows a similar fold on the opposite side.

steps.instruction: Fold the two side flaps inwards, aligning their edges with the center crease.
steps.visual_description: The origami dog shape from step 10. Arrows show the two side flaps being folded inwards to meet at the center dashed line.

steps.instruction: Fold the front tip back about 1/4 of its length.
steps.visual_description: The origami dog shape from step 11. An arrow indicates folding the pointed front tip backwards by approximately one-quarter of its length.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom flaps upwards, creasing them to form the legs.
steps.visual_description: The origami dog shape. Arrows show the two bottom flaps being folded upwards, creating the front and back legs.

steps.instruction: Fold the front legs forward.
steps.visual_description: The origami dog shape from step 13. Arrows indicate folding the front legs forward.

steps.instruction: Fold the top layer of the head down to form the snout.
steps.visual_description: The origami dog shape. An arrow shows the top layer of the head being folded downwards to create the snout.

steps.instruction: Fold the ears down.
steps.visual_description: The origami dog shape. Arrows indicate folding the two ear-like flaps downwards.

steps.instruction: Fold the top of the head down to shape the forehead.
steps.visual_description: The origami dog shape. Arrows show the top section of the head being folded downwards to create a forehead shape.

steps.instruction: Fold the tail upwards.
steps.visual_description: The origami dog shape. An arrow indicates folding the tail upwards.

steps.instruction: Draw the eyes and nose.
steps.visual_description: The completed origami dog. Dashed lines indicate where to draw the eyes and nose. The dog has a distinct snout and ears.

projects.finished_product_description: A finished origami dog.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 10: Shows an origami dog in progress with arrows indicating folds for the head and body.
Diagram 11: Continues the origami dog fold, showing inward folds for the body.
Diagram 12: Shows the origami dog with the front tip folded back.
Diagram 13: Illustrates folding the bottom flaps up to form the legs of the origami dog.
Diagram 14: Shows the origami dog with the front legs folded forward.
Diagram 15: Depicts folding the top layer of the head down to create the snout of the origami dog.
Diagram 16: Shows the origami dog with the ears folded down.
Diagram 17: Illustrates folding the top of the head down to shape the forehead of the origami dog.
Diagram 18: Shows the origami dog with the tail folded upwards.
Diagram 19: The final origami dog, with dashed lines indicating where to draw the eyes and nose.

projects.name: Frogger

steps.instruction: Colored side down, book fold in half both ways, then fold upper and lower edges to the center. Turn over.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular piece of paper with horizontal and vertical dashed lines indicating creases. Arrows show the top and bottom edges being folded towards the horizontal center line.

steps.instruction: Add diagonal creases in each half.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular piece of paper, vertically divided into two halves by a dashed line. Each half shows two diagonal dashed lines forming an 'X' pattern, with arrows indicating the creasing action.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the short sides to the center.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular piece of paper, vertically divided. Arrows indicate the short vertical edges being valley folded inwards towards the central vertical line.

steps.instruction: Reverse fold the corners. The top colored flap flips out.
steps.visual_description: A square-like shape with diagonal creases. Dotted lines and arrows show the corners being reverse folded outwards, creating new flaps.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the top lower flaps in half upwards. Turn over.
steps.visual_description: A square-like shape. The top section has two flaps, and arrows indicate these flaps being valley folded upwards along a horizontal dashed line.

steps.instruction: Swing the inside flap to the right.
steps.visual_description: A square-like shape with a triangular top section. An arrow shows an internal flap being swung horizontally to the right.

steps.instruction: Pleat on the left and valley fold one layer on the right to the left.
steps.visual_description: A square-like shape. The left side shows a pleat being formed. The right side shows a layer being valley folded towards the left.

steps.instruction: Swing the inside flap to the left.
steps.visual_description: A square-like shape. An arrow shows an internal flap being swung horizontally to the left.

steps.instruction: Repeat steps 7 and 8 on the right.
steps.visual_description: No new diagram, refers to repeating previous steps on the opposite side.

steps.instruction: Finished! Frogger will make a pop-up greeting card. Inspired by Mick Guy's "Kermit."
steps.visual_description: A finished, textured, diamond-shaped origami model, possibly a frog, with a grid pattern on its belly.

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: Start with colored side down. Initial folds create a grid of creases.

tips: 6" paper makes a 3" model.
projects.finished_product_description: A pop-up greeting card model, inspired by Mick Guy's "Kermit".

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 1: A rectangle with horizontal and vertical dashed lines, showing arrows for folding top and bottom edges to the center.
Diagram 2: A rectangle divided vertically, with diagonal dashed lines forming an 'X' in each half, showing creasing arrows.
Diagram 3: A rectangle divided vertically, with arrows indicating the short vertical sides being valley folded to the center.
Diagram 4: A square shape with diagonal creases, showing dotted lines and arrows for reverse folding the corners outwards.
Diagram 5: A square shape with two top flaps, showing arrows for valley folding these flaps upwards along a horizontal dashed line.
Diagram 6: A square shape with a triangular top, showing an arrow for swinging an internal flap to the right.
Diagram 7: A square shape, illustrating a pleat being formed on the left and a layer being valley folded to the left on the right.
Diagram 8: A square shape, showing an arrow for swinging an internal flap to the left.
Diagram 10: A finished, textured, diamond-shaped origami model, possibly a frog, with a grid pattern on its belly.

projects.name: Opossum

steps.instruction: Fold and unfold along the diagonal.
steps.visual_description: A square sheet of paper oriented as a diamond. A dashed line runs diagonally from the top to the bottom corner. Curved arrows indicate folding and unfolding along this diagonal.

steps.instruction: Valley fold in half, but only pinch near the edge.
steps.visual_description: A square sheet of paper oriented as a diamond. A solid vertical line runs from the top to the bottom corner. A short dashed line near the top-right edge indicates a pinch point, with a curved arrow showing a valley fold towards the center line.

steps.instruction: Fold the right corner to the pinch made in step 2.
steps.visual_description: A square sheet of paper oriented as a diamond. A dashed vertical line is in the center. A curved arrow indicates folding the right corner inwards to meet a small mark (the pinch) on the vertical line.

steps.instruction: Unfold
steps.visual_description: A square sheet of paper oriented as a diamond, with the right corner folded inwards, creating a triangular flap. The folded part is shaded. An arrow indicates unfolding this flap.

steps.instruction: Fold and unfold to the crease made in step 3.
steps.visual_description: A square sheet of paper oriented as a diamond. A vertical dashed line is in the center. Two curved arrows indicate folding and unfolding both the left and right corners inwards towards the vertical line, creating new creases.

steps.instruction: Fold and unfold through the intersections of the precreases and the raw edges.
steps.visual_description: A square sheet of paper oriented as a diamond, showing multiple dashed crease lines. Curved arrows indicate folding and unfolding from the top and bottom corners, aligning with existing creases and raw edges.

steps.instruction: Form an off-center preliminary base using the existing creases.
steps.visual_description: A square sheet of paper oriented as a diamond, with numerous dashed crease lines. Arrows indicate collapsing the paper along these creases to form a new, more complex base shape.

steps.instruction: Minor miracle.
steps.visual_description: A partially folded origami base, resembling a square with multiple layers. The top layer is shaded. A curved arrow indicates rotating the model.

steps.instruction: Squash fold along the existing crease. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: The origami base from step 8, with one flap squashed open. A dashed line indicates the crease for the squash fold. An arrow shows the direction of the fold. The squashed area is shaded. A small arrow indicates repeating the action on the back side.

steps.instruction: Squash-fold the top layer in half. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 9, with the squashed flap further folded. A dashed line indicates the new fold. Arrows show the squash fold. The top layer is shaded. A small arrow indicates repeating the action on the back side.

steps.instruction: Squash-fold. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 10, with another squash fold applied. A dashed line indicates the crease. Arrows show the squash fold. The top layer is shaded. A small arrow indicates repeating the action on the back side.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold the top layer in half. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 11, with the top layer mountain-folded. A dashed line indicates the fold. Arrows show the mountain fold. The top layer is shaded. A small arrow indicates repeating the action on the back side.

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: Start with a square sheet of paper and follow the folding instructions to create the Opossum model.

tips: 10" paper makes a 4" model.
projects.finished_product_description: An origami model of an Opossum.

diagram_descriptions: Page number 116 at the top left.
Title 'Opossum by Aaron Einbond (NY)' with 'Intermediate' difficulty below it.
Editor's note: '10" paper makes a 4" model.'
Copyright '1993' at the top right.
A circular logo with two children folding paper and text 'ORIGAMI BY CHILDREN'.

projects.name: Origami Bird

steps.instruction: Precrease along the fold made in step 12. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows a paper model with arrows indicating a precrease along a previously folded line. The fold is repeated on the back.

steps.instruction: Fold to the precrease. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows the paper model being folded along the precrease line. The fold is repeated on the back.

steps.instruction: Fold underneath the top layer along the existing crease. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows the top layer of the paper model being folded underneath along an existing crease. The fold is repeated on the back.

steps.instruction: Bring the tail up by forming two crimps simultaneously.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows the tail of the paper model being folded upwards, creating two simultaneous crimps. Arrows indicate the upward motion.

steps.instruction: Completed double-crimp. Rotate the model.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows the paper model after the double-crimp fold, with a 30-degree angle indicated. The model is then rotated.

steps.instruction: Fold the point so that line AB lies along itself. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows a point on the paper model being folded such that line AB aligns with itself. The fold is repeated on the back. Points A and B are labeled.

steps.instruction: Reverse fold as far as possible. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows a reverse fold being made on the paper model, folding it as far as possible. The fold is repeated on the back.

steps.instruction: Mountain-fold inside. There are no reference points for this fold. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows a mountain fold being made inwards on the paper model. The instruction notes there are no specific reference points for this fold. The fold is repeated on the back.

steps.instruction: Fold the inner flap into the pocket next to it.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows an inner flap of the paper model being folded into an adjacent pocket.

steps.instruction: Reverse fold.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows a reverse fold being performed on the paper model.

steps.instruction: Reverse fold on an angle bisector.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows a reverse fold being made on the paper model along an angle bisector.

steps.instruction: Swivel fold so that edge AB is parallel to edge CD. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows a swivel fold where edge AB is made parallel to edge CD. Points A, B, C, and D are labeled. The fold is repeated on the back.

steps.instruction: Fold and unfold the white flap in half.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows a white flap on the paper model being folded in half and then unfolded.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami bird.

projects.name: Opossum

steps.instruction: Fold the precrease to the raw edge and unfold.
steps.visual_description: A paper animal figure with a head and body, showing a fold line on the head and an arrow indicating unfolding.

steps.instruction: Crimp along the new precrease and the raw edge.
steps.visual_description: The same paper animal figure, with arrows indicating a crimping action on the head.

steps.instruction: Swivel fold. There is no landmark for this step.
steps.visual_description: The paper animal figure, with arrows showing a fold on the top of the head.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the ears. Reverse fold the tip of the nose.
steps.visual_description: The paper animal figure, with arrows indicating folding the ears down and reversing the tip of the nose.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold to form feet. There are no landmarks for these folds. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: The paper animal figure, with arrows showing mountain folds on the bottom to create feet. The instruction indicates repeating this on the back.

steps.instruction: Completed feet.
steps.visual_description: The paper animal figure showing the completed feet from the previous step.

steps.instruction: Shape the tail with reverse folds. The layers must be distributed unevenly.
steps.visual_description: The paper animal figure with a long, thin tail. Arrows indicate reverse folds along the tail to shape it, with a note about uneven distribution of layers.

steps.instruction: Round out the body, legs, and tail.
steps.visual_description: The paper animal figure, with arrows indicating rounding the body, legs, and tail. A separate diagram shows the tail being rounded with multiple folds.

steps.instruction: Completed Opossum.
steps.visual_description: A fully formed origami opossum with a curled tail.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami opossum.

Diagram showing step 27: the origami animal head with crimping arrows.
Diagram showing step 28: the origami animal head with a swivel fold arrow.
Diagram showing step 29: the origami animal head with arrows for folding ears and reversing the nose tip.
Diagram showing step 30: the origami animal body with arrows for mountain folding feet, with a note to repeat behind.
Diagram showing step 31: the origami animal with completed feet.
Diagram showing step 32: the origami animal with a long tail, showing arrows for reverse folding the tail to shape it unevenly.
Diagram showing step 33: the origami animal with arrows indicating rounding the body, legs, and tail. A smaller diagram shows the tail being rounded.
Diagram showing step 34: a completed origami opossum with a curled tail.

projects.name: Bear

steps.instruction: Make two diagonals. Rabbit ear. Turn over.
steps.visual_description: A square with dashed lines indicating two diagonals. Arrows show folding inwards to create a point. The second part shows the result of the folds, and an instruction to turn the paper over.

steps.instruction: Rabbit ear both sides.
steps.visual_description: A triangular shape with dashed lines indicating folds. Arrows show the paper being folded to create 'ears'.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold.
steps.visual_description: A long, thin diamond shape with a central vertical line indicating a mountain fold.

steps.instruction: Pull out for head and reverse fold for feet.
steps.visual_description: A shape resembling a simplified bear body. An arrow indicates pulling out a section for the head. Another arrow indicates a reverse fold for the feet.

steps.instruction: For the nose, reverse fold the tip. Crimp fold where indicated.
steps.visual_description: The tip of the bear's head is shown. Arrows indicate a reverse fold for the nose and a crimp fold at a specific point.

tips: 10" paper makes a model 8 3/4" high.
For best results use a monochromatic paper.

projects.name: Baryonyx

steps.instruction: Start with a colored bird base. Sink.
steps.visual_description: A bird base, which is a pentagonal shape with a vertical crease, marked with a 'Y' at the top, indicating the starting point for a sink fold.

steps.instruction: Fold up. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: The pentagonal bird base with its top point folded upwards along a horizontal crease, indicated by an arrow.

steps.instruction: Rabbit ear. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 2, showing the formation of a rabbit ear at the top point with diagonal creases and folding arrows.

steps.instruction: Reverse folds. Note step 5 to locate folds
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 3, with the top section having been reverse-folded inwards, resulting in a flatter, more angular top.

steps.instruction: Swivel folds. Repeat on the other side.
steps.visual_description: The model in a more elongated, horizontal orientation, showing the front and back points being swiveled outwards and downwards. Dashed lines indicate creases, and arrows show the swivel motion.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold upper and lower triangles. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 5, illustrating mountain folds on the upper and lower triangles of the body, with arrows showing the inward fold direction.

steps.instruction: Reverse fold head. Squash fold. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 6, detailing a reverse fold and subsequent squash fold on the leftmost point (head), with arrows indicating the folding sequence.

Diagram 7: The model from diagram 6, detailing a reverse fold and subsequent squash fold on the leftmost point (head), with arrows indicating the folding sequence.

projects.name: Apatosaurus

steps.instruction: Start with white side up.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with two perpendicular dashed lines intersecting at the center. Two curved arrows indicate folding the top and bottom edges to the center line.

steps.instruction: Continue folding to create creases.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with four dashed diagonal lines forming an 'X' and two perpendicular dashed lines forming a '+' through the center. Four curved arrows indicate bringing the corners to the center, forming a preliminary base.

steps.instruction: Diagram enlarged for clarity. Perform a rabbit ear fold.
steps.visual_description: An enlarged diamond shape, representing a preliminary base. The top flap is shown with internal dashed lines and arrows indicating a rabbit ear fold. A '1/2' symbol with an arrow suggests repeating the fold on the other side.

steps.instruction: Fold out the two flaps from the back.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape. Dotted lines and arrows indicate pulling out two hidden flaps from the back, making them visible on the sides.

steps.instruction: Rabbit ear the two white flaps.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with the previously pulled-out flaps now visible. Internal dashed lines show further rabbit ear folds being performed on these flaps.

steps.instruction: Perform a mountain fold behind.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape. A dashed line across the middle of the lower section with an exclamation mark indicates a mountain fold to be made behind the visible layers.

steps.instruction: Squash both flaps. Repeat behind. Note: the left hind flap is not folded to the peak. The resulting flaps are equal in size.
steps.visual_description: A side view of the model. Arrows and dashed lines show two flaps being squashed downwards and outwards.

steps.instruction: The resulting base after completing the squash folds.
steps.visual_description: A side view of the model, showing the final shape of the base after the squash folds from step 7 are completed.

details.position: center horizontal and vertical, and diagonals

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: The initial folds create a square base for the origami model.

tips: 10" paper makes a model 7" long and 2-1/2" tall.

Diagram 4: A diamond-shaped base with dotted lines and arrows indicating two flaps being pulled out from the back.

steps.instruction: Crimp along existing creases.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with diagonal and vertical creases. Arrows indicate inward folding along the vertical crease and outward folding along the diagonal creases near the left point.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold in half, While reforming the front creases.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 15 is folded in half vertically. Arrows show the front creases being reformed.

steps.instruction: Precrease, Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: A side view of the folded paper. A diagonal crease is shown being made on the top flap, with an arrow indicating the fold direction. The instruction 'Repeat behind' suggests this is done on the other side.

steps.instruction: Precrease along angle bisectors. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: Similar to step 17, but the precrease is along the angle bisector of the top flap. Arrows indicate the fold direction. 'Repeat behind' indicates the same action on the reverse side.

steps.instruction: Fold the corner down.
steps.visual_description: The top corner of the flap is folded downwards. An arrow shows the direction of the fold.

steps.instruction: Fold each corner down so that the new edges are horizontal and the creases terminate by the Precrease from step 18.
steps.visual_description: Two corners are folded down. The resulting edges are horizontal. The fold lines terminate at the precreases made in step 18.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold the edges back. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: The side edges are folded backwards using a mountain fold. 'Repeat behind' indicates this is done on both sides.

steps.instruction: Complete.
steps.visual_description: The completed origami figure, which appears to be an animal with legs and a head.

steps.instruction: Valley the bottom edges up to the top.
steps.visual_description: The bottom edges of the figure are folded upwards towards the top. An arrow indicates the direction of the fold.

steps.instruction: Squash fold the edges back down to the bottom.
steps.visual_description: The edges that were folded up in step 23 are now squash folded downwards. Arrows indicate the folding action.

steps.instruction: Closed sink. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: A closed sink fold is performed on the front of the figure. 'Repeat behind' indicates the same fold on the reverse side.

steps.instruction: Swing the leg sections down.
steps.visual_description: The sections that will form the legs are swung downwards. A curved arrow indicates the motion.

projects.name: Dilophosaur

steps.instruction: Start with a colored blintz bird base. Sink.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper folded into a kite shape with a vertical center crease and dashed horizontal crease. The top point is folded down.

steps.instruction: Minor miracle.
steps.visual_description: The kite shape from step 1 is shown with arrows indicating a fold along the center crease, bringing the two sides together.

steps.instruction: Reverse folds. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: The folded shape from step 2 is shown with arrows indicating reverse folds on the two side flaps, folding them inwards and upwards. Small 'x' marks indicate where the folds are made.

steps.instruction: Four reverse folds, then valley fold left to right.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 3 is shown. Arrows indicate four reverse folds on the outer edges. A dashed line shows a valley fold from left to right across the center.

steps.instruction: Reverse fold the bottom point up while valley folding right to left.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 4 is shown. An arrow indicates the bottom point is folded upwards. Another arrow shows a valley fold from right to left across the center.

steps.instruction: Valley fold a single layer left to right. The model will not lie flat.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 5 is shown. A dashed line indicates a valley fold on a single layer from left to right. An arrow shows the direction of the fold.

steps.instruction: Spread squash, then flatten the 3-D part by pushing it to the right. Repeat steps 6 and 7 behind.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 6 is shown. Arrows indicate spreading the layers apart and flattening a section by pushing it to the right. A dashed line shows the area to be flattened.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 7 is shown. A dashed line indicates a mountain fold on one of the flaps. Arrows show the fold direction. The instruction indicates to repeat on the back.

steps.instruction: Unfold.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 8 is shown partially unfolded, revealing creases made by the previous folds.

steps.instruction: Reverse fold. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 9 is shown. Arrows indicate a reverse fold on one of the pointed flaps. The instruction indicates to repeat on the back.

steps.instruction: Close up. Squash. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: A close-up view of a section of the model from step 10. Arrows indicate a squash fold. The instruction indicates to repeat on the back.

steps.instruction: Tuck flap into top pocket and mountain fold the lower section behind. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 11 is shown. An arrow indicates tucking a flap into a pocket at the top. Another arrow shows a mountain fold on the lower section. The instruction indicates to repeat on the back.

tips: A 6" square makes a 3" tall model.
projects.finished_product_description: A 3" tall origami Dilophosaur model.

projects.name: Origami Dinosaur

steps.instruction: Crimp.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows a paper model with a pointed head and two legs, with dashed lines indicating a crimp fold.

steps.instruction: Crimp for the head. Valley fold. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows the head area being crimped with a valley fold. Arrows indicate the direction of the fold. The text 'N4' is written near the head.

steps.instruction: Swivel fold the head. Fold flap back up. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows the head being swiveled and a flap folded back up. Arrows indicate the movement. The text 'N4' is written near the head.

steps.instruction: Reverse fold the tip of the nose. Fold flap over and squash another flap in the process. Rabbit ear and valley fold the tip. Repeat behind.
steps.technique: reverse fold, squash fold, rabbit ear fold, valley fold
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows the nose area being reverse folded. A flap is folded over and another is squashed. Arrows indicate the folds. The text 'N4' is written near the head.

steps.instruction: Fold flap over at a right angle and fold down smaller flap on top. Mountain fold sides of arms. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows a flap folded at a right angle and a smaller flap folded on top. The sides of the arms are mountain folded. Arrows indicate the folds.

steps.instruction: Fold tips of hands down. Fold the colored parts on the bottom behind. Pleat flaps. Place your finger under the colored parts on the top and stretch it up as far as it will go.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows the tips of the hands being folded down. Colored parts on the bottom are folded behind. Pleat folds are indicated. An illustration shows a finger under colored parts on top, stretching them up.

steps.instruction: Outside reverse fold the feet. Skinny the tail. Round at the head, and make the mouth look like it is spitting.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows the feet being outside reverse folded. The tail is shown as skinny. The head is rounded, and the mouth is shaped to look like it is spitting.

steps.instruction: Fold triangles in from below the head.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows triangles being folded in from below the head.

projects.name: Stegosaurus

steps.instruction: Begin with a colored preliminary base. Precrease the top layer in half.
steps.visual_description: A square sheet of paper, oriented as a diamond, showing a vertical center crease. A curved arrow indicates folding the top layer down horizontally and unfolding.

steps.instruction: Precrease along the angle bisectors.
steps.visual_description: The preliminary base with the vertical center crease. Two new diagonal dashed lines extend from the top point to the side edges, representing angle bisectors. Curved arrows indicate folding along these lines and unfolding.

steps.instruction: Precrease through the intersection of creases.
steps.visual_description: The preliminary base with existing creases. A new horizontal dashed line is shown, passing through the intersection point of the previous creases. A curved arrow indicates folding along this line and unfolding.

steps.instruction: Precrease again.
steps.visual_description: The preliminary base with multiple radial dashed lines originating from the top point and several horizontal dashed lines. Curved arrows indicate further folding and unfolding of the top layer.

steps.instruction: Sink the top.
steps.visual_description: The preliminary base with the top point pushed inwards, creating a 'sunk' fold. A small black triangle indicates the top point.

steps.instruction: Spread-squash the top corners.
steps.visual_description: The top corners of the sunk base are spread open and flattened (squashed). Two small black triangles indicate the corners. A curved arrow shows the spreading action.

steps.instruction: Valley up. Repeat steps 6-7 behind.
steps.visual_description: The model is now a diamond shape with the top section folded upwards in a valley fold. Dashed lines indicate the fold line.

steps.instruction: Swivel the top layer. Watch point X.
steps.visual_description: The top layer of the model is swiveled to the right. Point X is marked on the model as a reference point. A curved arrow indicates the swivel motion.

steps.instruction: Swivel again.
steps.visual_description: The top layer is swiveled further to the right from the previous step. Point X is still visible. A curved arrow indicates the swivel motion.

steps.instruction: And again. Watch point Y on the bottom layer.
steps.visual_description: The model has a more rectangular appearance. The top layer is swiveled once more. Point Y is marked on the bottom layer as a reference. A curved arrow indicates the swivel motion.

steps.instruction: And again.
steps.visual_description: The top layer is swiveled for an additional time. Point Y is still visible. A curved arrow indicates the swivel motion.

steps.instruction: Spread the flap apart. Model will not lie flat.
steps.visual_description: The top flap of the model is spread open, indicating a three-dimensional form. A curved arrow shows the spreading action. The model is shown not lying flat.
