Step 50 shows swinging all layers over. Step 51 shows swinging layers back while incorporating a swivel, with a note to repeat on the other side. Step 52 shows reversing corners through. Step 53 shows turning the model over. Step 54 shows a valley fold, allowing a protruding corner to spread, with 'Edge B' labeled. Step 55 shows swiveling 'Edge A' so it is parallel with the center of the model, noting that the area swiveled in step 51 will shift back. Step 56 shows a valley fold over. Step 57 shows swiveling 'Edge B' so it is parallel with the center of the model, with a note that step 51 will come undone. Step 58 shows pulling out one layer. Step 59 shows pulling out a corner. Step 60 shows crimping corners.

projects.name: Origami Bird

steps.instruction: Turn over.
steps.visual_description: An origami model is shown, which appears to be the base of a bird. The instruction is accompanied by a small diagram of an eye looking to the right, indicating a turn.

steps.instruction: Spread out top, while swinging down center point.
steps.visual_description: The top part of the origami model is being spread outwards, and the central point is being swung downwards. Arrows indicate the direction of movement.

steps.instruction: Swing up top point.
steps.visual_description: The top point of the origami model is being swung upwards. An arrow indicates the direction of the fold.

steps.instruction: Swing the back flap down.
steps.visual_description: A flap on the back of the origami model is being folded downwards. A dashed line indicates the fold line, and an arrow shows the direction of the fold.

steps.instruction: Swing the two thick flaps upwards.
steps.visual_description: Two thick flaps on the origami model are being folded upwards. Arrows indicate the direction of the folds.

steps.instruction: Squash the two flaps.
steps.visual_description: Two flaps on the origami model are being squashed. Small triangles at the bottom of the flaps indicate the direction of the squash.

steps.instruction: Valley down.
steps.visual_description: The bottom part of the origami model is being folded downwards, creating a valley fold. Arrows indicate the direction of the fold.

steps.instruction: Precrease along angle bisectors.
steps.visual_description: The origami model shows dashed lines along the angle bisectors of the bottom section, indicating precreases.

steps.instruction: Precrease again.
steps.visual_description: The origami model shows additional dashed lines, indicating further precreases on the bottom section.

steps.instruction: Collapse the corners into a half stretched bird base formation.
steps.visual_description: The corners of the bottom section of the origami model are being collapsed inwards to form a half stretched bird base. Arrows show the direction of collapse.

steps.instruction: Rabbit-ear the points upwards.
steps.visual_description: The points of the origami model are being folded upwards using a rabbit-ear technique. Arrows indicate the direction of the folds.

steps.instruction: Rotate model 1/4 turn.
steps.visual_description: The origami model is rotated a quarter turn. A circular diagram with '1/4' and an arrow indicates the rotation.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami bird model in progress.

diagram_descriptions: Page number '151' is displayed at the top right.

Diagram showing step 85: a top-down view of the paper shape, with two top sections being swiveled forward and indicated folds being added.

Diagram showing step 88: a side view of the paper shape, with a top corner being swung down.
Diagram showing step 89: a side view of the paper shape, with a section being swung back up, indicating repetition of steps 86-89 on the bottom.

projects.name: Origami Crane

steps.instruction: Swing over points while inserting reverse folds.
steps.visual_description: A square origami base with four points extending outwards. The top layer of two opposite points are being folded inwards and downwards, with arrows indicating the direction of the fold and the insertion of the points into pockets.

steps.instruction: Stretch the points forward. Do not be too concerned about the inner layers.
steps.visual_description: The origami model from step 91, now with the previously folded points extended forward. The points are elongated, and the inner layers are shown slightly splayed.

steps.instruction: Swing the points back.
steps.visual_description: The origami model from step 92, with the extended points now folded back towards the center.

steps.instruction: Precrease about 1/6th the width of each flap.
steps.visual_description: The origami model from step 93. Dashed lines are shown on the two side flaps, indicating a precrease approximately one-sixth of the flap's width from the outer edge.

steps.instruction: Spread squash using the creases just made.
steps.visual_description: The origami model from step 94. The side flaps are being opened outwards and flattened, utilizing the precreases from the previous step to form new creases.

steps.instruction: Thin the points by reversing them through the squash.
steps.visual_description: The origami model from step 95. The two points that were previously extended and folded back are now being thinned by folding them inwards along their length, with arrows showing the motion.

steps.instruction: Swing the top layers up. Swing the back flap down.
steps.visual_description: The origami model from step 96. The top layers of the model are being folded upwards, and a flap at the back is being folded downwards. Arrows indicate the direction of these folds.

steps.instruction: Fold the back flaps in half while swiveling under.
steps.visual_description: The origami model from step 97. The flaps that were folded down in the previous step are now being folded in half and tucked underneath the model.

steps.instruction: Fold the large flaps up while folding the thinner layers at the right inwards.
steps.visual_description: The origami model from step 98. The large flaps on the sides are being folded upwards. Simultaneously, thinner layers on the right side are being folded inwards. Arrows indicate the direction of these complex folds.

projects.finished_product_description: The intermediate steps of folding an origami crane.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing step 91 of an origami process: folding points inwards and inserting them.
Diagram showing step 92: points stretched forward.
Diagram showing step 93: points folded back.
Diagram showing step 94: precreasing side flaps.
Diagram showing step 95: spreading and squashing side flaps.
Diagram showing step 96: thinning points by reversing them.
Diagram showing step 97: folding top layers up and back flap down.
Diagram showing step 98: folding back flaps in half and under.
Diagram showing step 99: folding large flaps up and thinner layers inwards.

projects.name: Origami Dinosaur

steps.instruction: Collapse as indicated.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular shape with folded edges and arrows indicating inward collapse.

steps.instruction: Petal under.
steps.visual_description: The previous shape is further folded, with a petal-like fold being made underneath.

steps.instruction: Sink the hidden layers triangularly halfway.
steps.visual_description: Hidden layers are being pushed inwards and folded into a triangular shape.

steps.instruction: Sink up as far as possible.
steps.visual_description: The sink fold from the previous step is extended upwards as much as possible.

steps.instruction: Repeat steps 101-103 behind.
steps.visual_description: The same folding sequence (steps 101-103) is applied to the back of the model.

steps.instruction: Reverse fold legs.
steps.visual_description: The parts that will form the legs are folded in reverse.

steps.instruction: Reverse fold.
steps.visual_description: A reverse fold is applied to a section of the model.

steps.instruction: Pull out one layer only.
steps.visual_description: A single layer of paper is pulled out from a folded section.

steps.instruction: Reverse fold the remaining hidden layer. Repeat steps 106-108 behind.
steps.visual_description: The hidden layer is reverse folded, and then steps 106-108 are repeated on the back.

steps.instruction: Spread out top (do not crease).
steps.visual_description: The top section of the model is spread open without creating new creases.

steps.instruction: View from top. Closed reverse fold flap.
steps.visual_description: A top-down view showing a flap that has been closed with a reverse fold.

steps.instruction: Reverse back down.
steps.visual_description: A section is folded back down using a reverse fold.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami dinosaur model.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing step 100: A rectangular shape with dashed lines and arrows indicating an inward collapse.
Diagram showing step 101: The result of step 100 with a petal fold made underneath.
Diagram showing step 102: The model from step 101 with hidden layers being sunk triangularly halfway.
Diagram showing step 103: The model from step 102 with the sink fold extended upwards as far as possible.
Diagram showing step 104: The model from step 103, indicating that steps 101-103 are repeated on the back.
Diagram showing step 105: The model with arrows indicating the reverse folding of the legs.
Diagram showing step 106: The model with an arrow indicating a reverse fold.
Diagram showing step 107: The model with an arrow indicating that one layer is pulled out.
Diagram showing step 108: The model with a label '106-108' and arrows indicating reverse folding of a hidden layer and repetition on the back.
Diagram showing step 109: The model with a triangle symbol and arrows indicating the top is spread out without creasing.
Diagram showing step 110: A top-down view of the model, showing a closed reverse fold flap.
Diagram showing step 111: The model with an arrow indicating a reverse fold back down.

projects.name: Stegosaurus

steps.instruction: Reverse fold. Repeat steps 110-112 on other side.
steps.visual_description: An elongated, complex folded paper shape, pointed at one end, with a reverse fold indicated by an arrow at the wider, open end. The diagram shows the result of steps 110-112.

steps.instruction: Squash the four groups of points. Allow gussets to form at the base of each squash.
steps.visual_description: A star-like folded paper shape with four main points being squashed inwards, indicated by curved arrows. The center shows a complex layered structure.

steps.instruction: Squash the remaining four points.
steps.visual_description: A more compact star-like folded paper shape, with all eight points now squashed, indicated by curved arrows on the remaining four points.

steps.instruction: Close the model back up.
steps.visual_description: The star-like model is shown partially closed, with a central arrow indicating a folding or closing action.

steps.instruction: Stretch out the back pair of plates. Shape the remaining plates with mountain folds. Thin the neck. Shape the body. Outside reverse fold the pairs of spines at the tail. Reverse fold the hind legs.
steps.technique: stretching, mountain fold, thinning, shaping, outside reverse fold
steps.visual_description: The model begins to take the form of a Stegosaurus. The back plates are stretched out, spines are formed along the back and tail, the neck is thinned, and initial reverse folds are made for the hind legs. Multiple arrows indicate various shaping and folding actions.

steps.instruction: Shorten the tail. Form the feet with reverse folds. Form the head with a crimp. Spread apart the spines so that the front ones alternate with the ones behind. They should all tilt outwards.
steps.technique: shortening, reverse fold, crimp, spreading, tilting
steps.visual_description: Further refinement of the Stegosaurus shape. The tail is shortened, feet are formed with reverse folds, the head is shaped with a crimp, and the back spines are spread and tilted outwards. Arrows indicate these detailed shaping actions.

steps.instruction: Completed Stegosaurus. (c)1993 Marc Kirschenbaum.
steps.visual_description: A detailed illustration of the finished origami Stegosaurus, showing its distinctive plates along the back, tail spikes, head, and legs.

projects.finished_product_description: A completed origami Stegosaurus with distinct back plates, tail spikes, head, and legs.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 112: An elongated, complex folded paper shape, pointed at one end, with a reverse fold indicated by an arrow at the wider, open end.
Diagram 113: A star-like folded paper shape with four main points being squashed inwards, indicated by curved arrows, showing gussets forming.
Diagram 114: A more compact star-like folded paper shape with all eight points now squashed, indicated by curved arrows on the remaining four points.
Diagram 115: The star-like model shown partially closed, with a central arrow indicating a folding or closing action.
Diagram 116: The model beginning to take the form of a Stegosaurus, with back plates stretched, neck thinned, body shaped, and initial folds for tail spines and hind legs.
Diagram 117: The Stegosaurus model with further refinements, including a shortened tail, formed feet, a crimped head, and spread, tilted back spines.
Diagram 118: A detailed illustration of the finished origami Stegosaurus.

projects.name: Tyrannosaurus Rex Skeleton

steps.instruction: Begin with the white side up. Fold and unfold along the diagonals. Pinch the right side at the halfway point.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper labeled ABCD. Two diagonal dashed lines indicate creases. A horizontal dashed line indicates a pinch mark on the right edge. Curved arrows show folding along the diagonals.

steps.instruction: Make a crease that connects corner B with the pinch mark and pinch sharply where it crosses the diagonal AC.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper labeled ABCD with existing diagonal creases. A new solid line (crease) connects corner B to the pinch mark on the right edge. An arrow indicates folding from B towards the pinch mark. A small dash indicates a sharp pinch where the new crease crosses diagonal AC.

steps.instruction: Fold the top edge AD down to touch point E and unfold. Fold the bottom edge BC up through point E and unfold.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper labeled ABCD with diagonal creases and a horizontal crease through the center, marked as point E. Dashed lines indicate the fold lines for edge AD and edge BC. Curved arrows show the folding and unfolding actions for both edges.

steps.instruction: Fold the left edge AB over to the right to touch point E and unfold. Fold the right edge DC over to the left through point E and unfold.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper labeled ABCD with diagonal and horizontal creases, including point E. Vertical dashed lines indicate fold lines. Curved arrows show folding edge AB to point E and edge DC to point E, then unfolding. A rotation symbol (1/8 turn clockwise) is present.

steps.instruction: Fold point G down to lie on the horizontal crease BD so that the crease runs through point F and unfold.
steps.visual_description: The paper is rotated 45 degrees, appearing as a diamond shape with points A, B, C, D. Many creases are visible, forming a grid. Point G is on the top edge, and point F is on the left diagonal. A new crease is shown from G through F to the horizontal crease BD. A curved arrow indicates folding point G down.

steps.instruction: Repeat step 5 on the bottom and on the right.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with a complex pattern of creases. Curved arrows indicate repeating the folding action from step 5 on the bottom and right sides of the diamond. An eye symbol indicates a specific viewing direction.

steps.instruction: Fold and unfold through the indicated points.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with a very dense grid of creases. Small double-headed arrows indicate specific fold and unfold actions around the center and edges of the paper.

steps.instruction: Collapse the paper on the creases shown. You do not have to make the mountain folds sharp.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with numerous creases. Large curved arrows indicate the general direction of collapse, suggesting the paper is being brought together along the existing creases. Dotted lines represent mountain folds that are not required to be sharp.

tips: You do not have to make the mountain folds sharp.
projects.finished_product_description: An origami Tyrannosaurus Rex Skeleton.

diagram_descriptions: A sequence of 8 origami folding diagrams, starting with a square piece of paper and progressively adding more creases and folds. Each diagram is labeled with letters (A, B, C, D, E, F, G) to indicate specific points or corners. Arrows indicate folding directions. Dashed lines represent valley folds, and dot-dash lines represent mountain folds or existing creases. The paper is rotated 45 degrees into a diamond shape from step 5 onwards.

projects.name: Origami Rabbit

steps.instruction: Squash-fold flaps A and C using the existing creases.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a folded paper shape with arrows indicating the movement of flaps A and C for a squash fold. Points A, B, C, and D are labeled.

steps.instruction: Fold a rabbit ear through all layers. Note that the "ear" (which consists of two layers) goes inside.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the previous shape with arrows indicating a fold to create a rabbit ear. The ear is shown going inside. Points A, B, C, and D are labeled.

steps.instruction: Pull out a single flap.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the shape from step 10 with an arrow indicating a single flap being pulled out. Points A, B, C, and D are labeled.

steps.instruction: Carefully wrap flap A from front to back, allowing flaps D and B to swing upward.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the shape from step 11 with arrows indicating flap A being wrapped from front to back, and flaps D and B swinging upward. Points A, B, C, and D are labeled.

steps.instruction: Flatten the model and turn it over.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the shape from step 12 being flattened and then turned over. Points A, B, C, and D are labeled.

steps.instruction: Pull some paper out from underneath the little hood.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the flattened model from step 13. An arrow indicates pulling paper from underneath a hood-like structure. Points A, B, C, and D are labeled.

steps.instruction: Pinch corner A in half and fold it up to the right, squashing the hidden edge at the left.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the model from step 14. Corner A is being pinched and folded up to the right. A dashed line indicates the fold. Points A, B, C, and D are labeled.

steps.instruction: Squash-fold the edge and swing flap A over to the left.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the model from step 15. An edge is being squash-folded, and flap A is swung over to the left. Points A, B, C, and D are labeled.

steps.instruction: Repeat steps 15-16 behind.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the back of the model, with a label '15-16' indicating that steps 15 and 16 should be repeated on this side. Points B, C, and D are labeled.

steps.instruction: Crimp flap D to the left, but before you flatten any creases, look at steps 19-22 to see some additional creases that occur inside the model within the circled region.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the model from step 17. Flap D is being crimped to the left. A circle highlights a region inside the model where additional creases will be made. Points A, B, C, and D are labeled.

steps.instruction: Simultaneously dent the middle of hidden edge EF upward while crimping flap F to the left.
steps.visual_description: A close-up diagram of the circled region from step 18. It shows a hidden edge EF being dented upward while flap F is crimped to the left. Arrows indicate the directions of movement. Points E and F are labeled.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami rabbit.

steps.instruction: Now push the middle of the newly-formed triangle downward and bring corner F up to point G.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a semi-circular folded paper with dashed lines indicating folds. A magnified inset shows points F and G and arrows indicating the direction of the fold. The instruction describes pushing the middle of a triangle downward and bringing corner F up to point G.

steps.instruction: Flatten the model while swinging corner D upward.
steps.visual_description: A diagram of an origami model with a magnified inset. Arrows indicate swinging corner D upward and flattening the model. The model has points labeled D.

steps.instruction: Turn the model over.
steps.visual_description: A diagram of an origami model with points labeled A, B, C, and D. An arrow indicates turning the model over.

steps.instruction: Repeat steps 18-22 on flap B.
steps.visual_description: A diagram of an origami model with points labeled A, B, C, and D. An arrow indicates a folding action on flap B. A box labeled '18-22' is shown next to flap B.

steps.instruction: Fold and unfold.
steps.visual_description: A diagram of an origami model with points labeled A, B, C, and D. Arrows indicate folding and unfolding actions on the lower part of the model.

steps.instruction: Fold and unfold.
steps.visual_description: A diagram of an origami model with points labeled A, B, C, and D. Arrows indicate folding and unfolding actions on the lower part of the model, similar to step 24 but from a different angle.

steps.instruction: Fold flap B to the left.
steps.visual_description: A diagram of an origami model with points labeled A, B, C, and D. An arrow indicates folding flap B to the left. A circular arrow indicates a turning or shaping action.

diagram_descriptions: Page 159 of an origami instruction book showing steps 20 through 26.
Diagram for step 20: A semi-circular folded paper with a magnified inset showing points F and G and fold directions.
Diagram for step 21: An origami model with a magnified inset, showing corner D being swung upward and the model being flattened.
Diagram for step 22: An origami model with points A, B, C, D, and an arrow indicating to turn the model over.
Diagram for step 23: An origami model with points A, B, C, D, an arrow indicating action on flap B, and a reference box '18-22'.
Diagram for step 24: An origami model with points A, B, C, D, and arrows indicating folding and unfolding actions.
Diagram for step 25: An origami model with points A, B, C, D, and arrows indicating folding and unfolding actions, similar to step 24.
Diagram for step 26: An origami model with points A, B, C, D, an arrow indicating folding flap B to the left, and a circular arrow.

steps.instruction: Repeat steps 24-26 on this side.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing an origami fold. The current shape is a diamond with two flaps pointing upwards. Arrows indicate folding the top layer of the right flap down and to the left, and the top layer of the left flap down and to the right. A box labeled '24-26' is shown near the bottom left.

steps.instruction: Squash-fold the pocket between corners I and J and bring corner I down to point J. At the same time, pivot point B over to the left so that the raw edges all line up along the top.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing an origami fold. The previous shape is being manipulated. Arrows show a pocket being opened and flattened. Point I is brought down to point J. Point B is pivoted left. The raw edges are aligned at the top.

steps.instruction: Reverse-fold corner B upward.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing an origami fold. Corner B is being folded upwards with a reverse fold. The previous shape is shown with corner B highlighted.

steps.instruction: Reverse-fold two edges.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing an origami fold. Two edges are being reverse-folded inwards. Arrows indicate the direction of the folds.

steps.instruction: Fold the vertical flaps to the right (two layers).
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing an origami fold. Two vertical flaps are being folded to the right. An icon of a circular arrow with a line through it indicates a fold and then unfolding or a temporary fold.

steps.instruction: Reverse-fold two edges.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing an origami fold. Two edges are being reverse-folded inwards. Arrows indicate the direction of the folds.

steps.instruction: Turn the model over.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing an origami model being flipped over. An arrow indicates the rotation.

steps.instruction: Repeat steps 24-33 on flap D.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing an origami model. A box labeled '24-33' is shown near flap D, indicating that the previous sequence of steps should be repeated on this flap.

steps.instruction: Fold one layer to the right in front and one to the left behind.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing an origami fold. One layer is folded to the right in front, and another layer is folded to the left behind. Arrows indicate the direction of the folds.

steps.instruction: Fold and unfold.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing an origami fold. An edge is being folded and then unfolded. Arrows indicate the fold and then the unfolding.

steps.instruction: Reverse-fold both edges at the same time. The two reverse folds are linked-be careful that you don't trap any layers.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing an origami fold. Both edges are being reverse-folded simultaneously. Arrows indicate the direction of the folds. A warning is given about trapping layers.

steps.instruction: Repeat step 37 on the right.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing an origami fold. Step 37 is being repeated on the right side of the model. Arrows indicate the direction of the folds.

projects.name: Tyrannosaurus Rex Skeleton

steps.instruction: Inside-reverse-fold the ribs. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: An origami dinosaur skeleton model, shown in profile, facing left. The model is grey with white outlines. The head is on the far left, with a jagged jawline. The body has several triangular rib structures. Two white arrows with black outlines indicate an 'inside-reverse-fold' action on the first two rib segments from the front, pointing inwards and slightly upwards, suggesting the ribs are being tucked in.

steps.instruction: Outside-reverse-fold the ribs again. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: An origami dinosaur skeleton model, shown in profile, facing left. The model is grey with white outlines. The head is on the far left, with a jagged jawline. The body has several triangular rib structures. Two white arrows with black outlines indicate an 'outside-reverse-fold' action on the first two rib segments from the front, pointing outwards and slightly downwards, suggesting the ribs are being pulled out and defined.

steps.instruction: Rotate the body. Squeeze the lower jaw from both sides. Crimp the spine slightly. Crimp the ankles. Spread the feet. Stretch the tail slightly.
steps.visual_description: An origami dinosaur skeleton model, shown in profile, facing left. The model is grey with white outlines. The head is on the far left, with a jagged jawline. A circular arrow with '1/8' indicates a slight rotation of the body. Multiple white arrows with black outlines show refinement actions: two arrows squeezing the lower jaw, two arrows crimping the spine (upper back), two arrows crimping the ankles of the hind legs, two arrows spreading the feet, and an arrow stretching the tail slightly upwards and to the right.

steps.instruction: Finished Tyrannosaurus Rex Skeleton.
steps.visual_description: The completed origami Tyrannosaurus Rex skeleton model, standing upright on its two hind legs. The model is grey with white outlines, casting a dark shadow beneath it. The head is detailed with a prominent jaw, the rib cage is clearly defined, and the limbs and tail are fully formed, giving the appearance of a standing skeleton.

projects.finished_product_description: A completed origami model of a Tyrannosaurus Rex skeleton.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing an origami dinosaur skeleton model with arrows indicating an inside-reverse-fold on the ribs.
Diagram showing an origami dinosaur skeleton model with arrows indicating an outside-reverse-fold on the ribs.
Diagram showing an origami dinosaur skeleton model with arrows indicating rotation of the body, squeezing the lower jaw, crimping the spine and ankles, spreading the feet, and stretching the tail.
Diagram showing the finished origami Tyrannosaurus Rex skeleton model.

projects.name: Earring/Decoration

steps.instruction: White side up. With diagonals in place, fold and unfold two book folds.
steps.visual_description: A square with dashed lines indicating diagonals and horizontal/vertical center lines. Arrows show folding inward from the sides.

steps.instruction: Valley fold two opposite corners to the center. Mountain fold the other two corners to the center.
steps.visual_description: A square with diagonals and horizontal/vertical center lines. Arrows indicate folding two opposite corners to the center, and the other two corners are folded in the opposite direction (mountain fold).

steps.instruction: Mountain fold back all four corners to the center in a "blintz" fold.
steps.visual_description: A square with four smaller squares in the corners. Arrows show the corners being folded inwards to meet at the center point. The resulting shape is a diamond with four smaller diamonds at its points.

steps.instruction: With the second sheet of paper, repeat steps 1-3. After this, fit one square into the other. The white diamond should fit under the colored diamond so that the finished earring has two different colors.
steps.visual_description: Two diamond shapes, one slightly overlapping the other. Arrows indicate fitting one diamond into the other, with the white diamond positioned underneath the colored one.

steps.instruction: The model is now complete. Just add a hanger at the top and the earring is ready to wear.
steps.visual_description: A finished diamond-shaped earring with a loop at the top for hanging. The earring is composed of two overlapping diamond shapes, each with two colors visible.

projects.finished_product_description: A two-colored diamond-shaped earring.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing step 1 of folding a square with diagonals and center lines.
Diagram showing step 2 of folding a square with diagonals and center lines, indicating valley and mountain folds.
Diagram showing step 3 of folding the corners of a square to the center, creating a blintz fold.
Diagram showing the result of step 3, a diamond shape with folded corners.
Diagram showing step 4, fitting two folded diamond shapes together.
Diagram showing the finished earring with a hanger loop.

projects.name: Seven Bracelets

steps.instruction: Valley fold one third of the paper upward.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular sheet of paper with a dashed line indicating a fold one-third from the bottom, and an arrow pointing upwards. The bottom third is shaded.

steps.instruction: Note that the white region will be exactly the same size as the coloured region. Fold the top third down.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular sheet of paper with the bottom third shaded. A dashed line indicates a fold one-third from the top, and an arrow pointing downwards. The top third is now shaded.

steps.instruction: The edges should line up exactly. Unfold the model completely.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular sheet of paper with two horizontal dashed lines, dividing it into three equal horizontal sections. An arrow indicates the unfolding motion.

steps.instruction: Fold the lower edge one third of the distance between the bottom and the crease made in step one.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular sheet of paper with two horizontal solid lines (creases). A new dashed line is shown one-third of the way up from the bottom edge to the lowest solid line. An arrow points upwards from the bottom edge to this new dashed line. The bottom section is shaded.

steps.instruction: Fold the edge up again. The folded edge should exactly meet the crease made in step one.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular sheet of paper with two horizontal solid lines. The bottom section is folded up to the first solid line, creating a new solid line at the bottom. An arrow points upwards from the new bottom edge to the first solid line. The bottom two sections are now shaded.

steps.instruction: Fold the flap over one more time.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular sheet of paper with two horizontal solid lines. The bottom section is folded up again, creating another new solid line. An arrow points upwards from the new bottom edge. The bottom three sections are now shaded.

steps.instruction: Repeat the folding sequence on the top edge.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular sheet of paper with multiple horizontal solid lines, showing the bottom edge folded up three times and the top edge folded down three times in a similar sequence. Arrows indicate the downward folds from the top.

steps.instruction: To complete the bracelet, bend the two ends backwards and slip one end inside the other.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular strip, appearing thicker due to the multiple folds, with arrows indicating the ends bending backwards to form a circle. The strip has distinct horizontal layers.

steps.instruction: Completed bracelet.
steps.visual_description: A cylindrical shape, representing the finished bracelet, showing three distinct layers or bands.

projects.finished_product_description: A multi-layered paper bracelet formed by repeated horizontal folding and joining the ends.

diagram_descriptions: A series of nine diagrams illustrating the step-by-step process of folding a rectangular piece of paper to create a multi-layered bracelet.
Diagrams 1-3 show the initial steps of valley folding and unfolding the paper into horizontal thirds.
Diagrams 4-6 detail the repeated folding of the lower edge of the paper.
Diagram 7 shows the application of the repeated folding sequence to both the top and bottom edges of the paper.
Diagram 8 illustrates bending the folded paper strip and interlocking its ends to form a circular shape.
Diagram 9 displays the final completed cylindrical bracelet with visible layers.

projects.name: DIAMONDS

steps.instruction: Start with a square of paper, white side up. Fold in half diagonally and unfold.
steps.visual_description: A square sheet of paper, oriented as a diamond, with a dashed line indicating a diagonal fold from top-left to bottom-right. A curved arrow shows the fold being made and then unfolded.

steps.instruction: Note the location of the crease from the previous step. Fold and unfold along the other diagonal.
steps.visual_description: A square sheet of paper, oriented as a diamond, with two dashed lines indicating both diagonals. A curved arrow shows a fold being made and then unfolded along the diagonal from top-right to bottom-left.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom and top corners into the center.
steps.visual_description: A square sheet of paper, oriented as a diamond, with two diagonal and two horizontal dashed lines forming a grid. Two curved arrows indicate folding the top and bottom corners inwards towards the horizontal center line.

steps.instruction: Fold the edges into the center.
steps.visual_description: A hexagonal shape formed from the folded paper, with a central horizontal dashed line and two diagonal dashed lines on each side. The top and bottom triangular sections are shaded. Two curved arrows indicate folding the top and bottom edges inwards towards the center horizontal line.

steps.instruction: Fold the edges in again.
steps.visual_description: A narrower, elongated hexagonal shape. The top and bottom sections are shaded. Two curved arrows indicate folding the top and bottom edges inwards again towards the center horizontal line.

steps.instruction: Unfold the paper completely.
steps.visual_description: The elongated hexagonal shape from step 5. A large curved arrow indicates unfolding the paper completely.

steps.instruction: Fold up the top and bottom halves of the paper like a fan, valley folding, then mountain folding, one line at a time.
steps.technique: fan folding, valley folding, mountain folding
steps.visual_description: A square sheet of paper, oriented as a diamond, with numerous parallel horizontal dashed lines. Multiple small curved arrows indicate alternating valley and mountain folds being made from the center outwards on both the top and bottom halves of the paper.

steps.instruction: To complete the bracelet, bend the two ends backwards and slip the right end inside the left, all the way to the indicated point.
steps.visual_description: A long, folded strip of paper with a repeating diamond pattern. A large curved arrow indicates bending the strip into a circular shape. A straight arrow points to the interlocking ends, showing the right end slipping into the left.

steps.instruction: Completed bracelet.
steps.visual_description: A finished cylindrical bracelet made of the folded paper, displaying the diamond pattern around its circumference.

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: Fold paper according to steps to create a diamond pattern and form a bracelet.

projects.finished_product_description: A bracelet made of folded paper with a diamond pattern.

projects.name: Zig Zag Bracelet

steps.instruction: Start with a square of paper, white side up. Fold in half along the diagonals as with the previous bracelet.
steps.visual_description: A square of paper folded in half diagonally, with dashed lines indicating the other diagonal and the center horizontal and vertical lines. Arrows show folding the bottom corners towards the center.

steps.instruction: Pleat up as with the previous bracelet, but pleat in fourths, not eighths. Pleat only the top half of the paper.
steps.visual_description: The top half of the folded paper from step 1 is shown pleated into fourths. Curved lines indicate the pleating action.

steps.instruction: Fold the flap up at a distance of two-thirds the total height of the model.
steps.visual_description: The top pleated section is folded upwards. A shaded triangle indicates the area being folded. A dashed line shows the fold line.

steps.instruction: Fold the flap back down, along the horizontal crease made across the center.
steps.visual_description: The flap folded up in step 3 is now folded back down along the horizontal center crease. The shaded area is visible.

steps.instruction: Now, fold upward using the bottom edge of the model as a guide.
steps.visual_description: The bottom edge of the model is folded upwards. An arrow indicates the direction of the fold.

steps.instruction: Finally, fold the tip down to the bottom edge.
steps.visual_description: The tip of the folded section is folded down to meet the bottom edge.

steps.instruction: Pull the coloured flap out in front of the white flap.
steps.visual_description: A long, thin strip with zig-zag patterns is shown. A colored flap is being pulled forward from a white flap.

steps.instruction: To complete the bracelet, bend the two ends backwards and slip the right end inside the left, all the way to the indicated point.
steps.visual_description: The zig-zag strip is shown bent into a bracelet shape. Arrows indicate bending the ends backwards and slipping one end into the other.

steps.instruction: Completed bracelet.

projects.name: THE MULTI - BRACELET

steps.instruction: Start with a square of paper, white side up. Fold in half along the diagonals as with the previous bracelet.
steps.visual_description: A square rotated 45 degrees (diamond shape) with two dashed diagonal lines indicating creases. Two curved arrows show folding along these diagonals.

steps.instruction: Fold the top corner down, but not all the way to the center. The actual distance does not matter. Different distances will affect the size of the coloured regions on the model.
steps.visual_description: A square rotated 45 degrees. The top corner is folded down, indicated by a dashed horizontal line near the top point and a curved arrow pointing downwards.

steps.instruction: Fold the other three flaps the same distance away from the center.
steps.visual_description: A square rotated 45 degrees. All four corners are folded inwards, creating a smaller square in the center. The folded-in corners are shaded. Curved arrows indicate the folding direction for the remaining three corners.

steps.instruction: Thin the top and the bottom by mountain folding in half.
steps.visual_description: A square shape (from step 3) with the top and bottom sections mountain folded inwards. Dashed lines indicate the fold lines. Curved arrows show the folding direction. The resulting shape is a horizontal rectangle with a central square.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold in half again, allowing the center flaps to swing out. Turn the model over.
steps.visual_description: The rectangular shape from step 4, now shown with a central vertical mountain fold. Curved arrows indicate the center flaps swinging out. An arrow pointing right and a circular arrow indicate turning the model over. The resulting shape is a narrower horizontal rectangle with visible flaps.

projects.finished_product_description: A pre-folded modular paper unit, ready for assembly into a bracelet or further configuration.

projects.name: 4 - AMULET

steps.instruction: Bracelet number four - To complete, slip one end inside the other as before. To go on the next bracelet, fold the coloured square in thirds.
steps.visual_description: A horizontal rectangular module with a central diamond shape. Dashed lines and curved arrows indicate folding the central square in thirds. The module is shown interlocked, forming a complete unit.

projects.finished_product_description: An interlocked paper bracelet module, featuring a central diamond with its inner square folded in thirds.

projects.name: 5 - TWO DIAMONDS

steps.instruction: Bracelet number five - To go on to the next bracelet, fold the two small flaps outward.

projects.finished_product_description: A paper bracelet module featuring two central diamond shapes, with small flaps folded outwards.

projects.name: 6 - THREE DIAMONDS

steps.instruction: Bracelet number six - To go on to the next bracelet, tuck the upper and lower flaps, which contain the first and third diamonds, under the large flaps that extend the length of the model.
steps.visual_description: A horizontal rectangular module with three central diamond shapes. Dashed lines and curved arrows indicate tucking the upper and lower flaps (containing the first and third diamonds) under the larger flaps.

projects.finished_product_description: A paper bracelet module featuring three central diamond shapes, with specific flaps tucked to create the pattern.

projects.name: Chain Link Jewelry

materials.notes: 25lb "Astrobite" (neon colors), leather-look wrapping papers, American foil

steps.instruction: Start white side up for a colored unit. Valley/bookfold and unfold short end to short end.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle is shown with a dashed line across the middle, indicating a fold. Arrows indicate folding the top and bottom edges towards the center.

steps.instruction: Fold each end towards the center line leaving a "fudge factor" of slightly less than 1/8" from each side of center, no matter what size your strips. This space is needed to help one link pass through another.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle is shown folded in half. Arrows indicate folding the top and bottom edges towards the center line, leaving a small gap.

steps.instruction: Fold in half at center line to create link.
steps.visual_description: A folded strip is shown being folded in half. A pair of scissors is shown next to the folded strip, indicating a cut.

steps.instruction: One link finished.
steps.visual_description: A single chain link is shown, appearing as a folded strip with a cut end.

steps.instruction: To attach links in "step" fashion (see color pattern charts that follow); Hold #1 link across; #2 link passes down through the slots of #1, #3 link passes across through the slots of #2, etc.
steps.visual_description: Two diagrams show how to link the paper strips. The first shows two links being connected, with arrows indicating the path of the second link through the first. The second diagram shows three links connected in a step pattern, numbered 1, 2, and 3.

steps.instruction: To lock the ends of a finished piece, unfold the last link (it remains in half). Trim ends as shown so they will tuck easily. Slide this link through the slots of the previous link, then around #1 link and tuck it into #1 link. Apply a dab of flue inside to secure (Editor's note: glue is not necessary).
steps.visual_description: A diagram shows the end of a chain being prepared for locking. The last link is shown unfolded, with its ends trimmed. Arrows indicate how the link should be threaded through the previous link and then tucked back into itself.

tips: Bracelets and belts are easier to make than necklaces.
Necklaces are more difficult because the link pattern must be reversed at center front so that the finished necklace curves around the neck and lies flat.
Glue is not necessary for securing the last link.
projects.finished_product_description: Chain link jewelry such as bracelets, belts, and necklaces made from folded paper strips.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing an 8-inch strip of paper folded in half.
Diagram showing a folded strip with ends folded towards the center, leaving a small gap.
Diagram showing a folded strip being folded in half to create a link.
Diagram of a finished chain link.
Diagrams illustrating how to connect multiple chain links in a step pattern.
Diagram showing the process of locking the ends of a finished chain.

projects.name: Belts and Bracelets

steps.instruction: Determine the number of links needed based on your wrist or waist size.
Ensure an even number of links is used.
Link colors in a random pattern or develop your own patterns.

tips: The smaller the strip you use, the more links you will need.
It takes approximately 1/2 hour to make a bracelet using 1" by 8" strips.
projects.finished_product_description: Belts and bracelets made from interconnected paper strips.

projects.name: Necklaces

materials.notes: for a necklace that finishes 11"-14" long
for a necklace that finishes 13" long

steps.instruction: Choose either 3/8" x 3" or 1/4" x 2" strips.
Create a strip of links 6-8" long in your chosen pattern.
Ensure the first link falls at the nape of your neck and is locked to complete the necklace.
To make the necklace curve around and lie flat, reverse the forward linking direction. Refer to variations A and B shown below.
steps.visual_description: Diagrams A and B showing linking variations

tips: The pattern and number of colors in your repeat dictate the length of the necklace.
projects.finished_product_description: Necklaces that curve around the neck and lie flat, made from interconnected paper strips.

Each link has an arrow indicating its orientation: some point up, some down, and some right. The overall arrangement suggests a specific linking pattern. The letter 'A' is circled at the bottom right of this diagram.

Diagram B shows a longer series of interconnected square-like links, similar in style to Diagram A, also forming a curved chain. Arrows indicate the orientation of each link. Some links appear to have small circles or dots inside, possibly indicating a different color or pattern variation. The letter 'B' is circled at the bottom right of this diagram.

Diagram showing a horizontal repeating pattern of V-shapes, composed of small squares with different fill patterns (solid, cross-hatch, diagonal lines, dots).
Diagram showing a vertical repeating pattern of V-shapes, composed of small squares with different fill patterns (solid, cross-hatch, diagonal lines, dots).
Diagram showing a V-shaped pattern made of small squares, with no letters, but with different fill patterns (dots, diagonal lines, cross-hatch, solid vertical lines).
Diagram showing a V-shaped pattern made of small squares, with different fill patterns (solid, diagonal lines, cross-hatch, solid vertical lines).
Diagram showing a V-shaped pattern made of small squares, with different fill patterns (solid, diagonal lines, cross-hatch, solid vertical lines).

projects.name: Wristwatch

steps.instruction: Mountain fold sides (the folds will touch the watch hands), turn over.
steps.visual_description: A hexagonal shape with dashed lines indicating mountain folds on the sides. Two small curved flaps are shown on the bottom corners.

steps.instruction: Valley fold one flap outward.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular strip folded in half vertically. The fold creates a zig-zag pattern with two diagonal lines meeting in the center.

steps.instruction: Swivel in sides.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular strip folded in half vertically. The fold creates a zig-zag pattern with two diagonal lines meeting in the center, with some parts tucked inwards.

steps.instruction: Crimp sides inward.
steps.visual_description: A long, thin shape with pointed ends. The central section is wider and has a square-like appearance. Dashed lines indicate inward folds on the sides of the central section.

steps.instruction: Thin the band.
steps.visual_description: A long, thin shape with pointed ends. The central section is wider and has a square-like appearance. Curved arrows indicate that the sides of the central section are being folded inwards.

steps.instruction: Turn over.
steps.visual_description: A long, thin shape with pointed ends. The central section is wider and has a square-like appearance. The back side is shown, with a small circle at the top center.

steps.instruction: Open out the raw edges.
steps.visual_description: A long, thin shape with pointed ends. The central section is wider and has a square-like appearance. The sides of the central section are being opened outwards, revealing more layers.

steps.instruction: Roll layers over on left. Mountain fold the tip at the right.
steps.visual_description: A long, thin shape with a wider central section. The left side is shown rolled over. The right tip is pointed, with dashed lines indicating a mountain fold.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold sides of band to the back. Shorten one of the watch hands with a reverse fold.
steps.visual_description: A long, thin shape with a wider central section that resembles a watch face. The sides of the band are folded to the back. One of the pointed ends (watch hands) is shorter and has a small fold.

steps.instruction: Round out the watch face with mountain folds. Rabbit ear the hands to set the time.
steps.visual_description: A watch-like shape. The central watch face area is rounded with mountain folds. The pointed ends (hands) have small, ear-like folds.

steps.instruction: Completed wrist watch.
steps.visual_description: A completed paper wrist watch, showing the band and the watch face with hands.

projects.name: Viking Helmet

steps.instruction: White side up.
steps.visual_description: A square sheet of paper, rotated to appear as a diamond, with a vertical and horizontal crease line intersecting at the center.

steps.instruction: Fold the top corner down to the horizontal center crease and the right corner to the vertical center crease.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with the top corner folded down and the right corner folded left, indicated by curved arrows and dashed lines for the new creases.

steps.instruction: Fold all four corners towards the center, creating creases.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with all four corners indicated by curved arrows and dashed lines, showing they are to be folded towards the center.

steps.instruction: Form a kind of fish base: create new valley folds by folding the raw edge to the creases created in step 3.

steps.instruction: Fold the model into a triangular shape, bringing the sides up.

steps.instruction: Fold a flap down from the top point.

steps.instruction: Unfold to step 5. Repeat steps 5 and 6 on right hand side.
steps.visual_description: The triangular shape from step 6, with an arrow pointing to the right, indicating that the previous steps should be repeated on the other side of the model.

tips: 6" paper makes a helmet 4" wide.
projects.finished_product_description: A paper Viking helmet, 4 inches wide when made from 6-inch paper.

projects.name: Origami Star Earring

steps.instruction: Gently pull out paper from center so colored side is up. Star spoke will have to be lifted straight up as paper is pulled out then placed back down and folded as shown.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with a star pattern in the center. An arrow indicates pulling outwards from the center.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold back as shown. Outside corner where two spokes meet will fold neatly behind by spreading.

steps.instruction: Repeat steps 10 and 11 on the other three sides.

steps.instruction: Fold bottom point up to top point.

steps.instruction: Inside reverse both sides.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 14, with the two side points folded inwards using an inside reverse fold. Arrows indicate the direction of the fold.

steps.instruction: Inside reverse along edge of center triangle on all four flaps created in step 15.

steps.instruction: Fold top flap down.

steps.instruction: Reverse flaps down and to the side.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 17, showing the flaps being folded downwards and to the sides.

steps.instruction: Carefully bisect the top layer and fold to outer edge to expose color. Undo step 18 enough to help. Be gentle to avoid tearing paper.

tips: Be gentle to avoid tearing paper.

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: Multiple modules are assembled to form the crown. The number of modules depends on head size and the size of the paper selected. If 7 modules are folded and the crown is inverted, it can be used as a weekly planner by placing pockets on the inside of the circle.

tips: 6" paper makes a 2" high, 3" wide module.
The number of modules needed depends on head size and the size of the paper selected.
If the crown is inverted and 7 modules are folded, it can be used as a weekly planner by placing the pockets on the inside of the circle.

projects.name: Wedding Dress

steps.instruction: Fold paper in half vertically, Then cut.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular piece of paper is shown, divided vertically into two sections labeled 'ruha' (dress) and 'uszly' (train). Below it, the paper is folded in half vertically, and a scissors icon indicates a cut along the fold line.

steps.instruction: Using one of the halves, Valley cupboard fold to the center.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular strip of paper (one of the halves from step 1) is shown. Two dashed lines indicate valley folds, and arrows show the sides being folded inwards towards the vertical center line.

steps.instruction: Cut a slit down the center, It should be less then halfway.
steps.visual_description: The folded rectangular strip from step 2 is shown. A scissors icon is above it, and a vertical dashed line indicates a slit cut down the center from the top edge, extending less than halfway down the length of the paper.

steps.instruction: Mountain crease the two ends.
steps.visual_description: The paper from step 3 is shown. The top corners of the strip are folded outwards and downwards, indicated by arrows, forming mountain creases at the ends.

steps.instruction: Outside reverse fold the two ends.
steps.visual_description: The paper from step 4 is shown. The previously mountain-creased ends are now reversed folded outwards, creating two pointed flaps at the top.

steps.instruction: Skinny the two ends by making mountain folds then sink.
steps.visual_description: The paper from step 5 is shown, now resembling a T-shape. The ends of the horizontal bar (the top part) are folded inwards (mountain folds) and then sunk, making them narrower.

steps.instruction: Outside reverse fold the two ends again. The arms are now starting to form.
steps.visual_description: The T-shaped paper from step 6 is shown. The narrowed ends of the horizontal bar are outside reverse folded again, creating distinct 'arms' or sleeves for the dress.

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: The project involves a sequence of folds and cuts on a single piece of paper to form the wedding dress.

tips: Completed dress is 1/3 the size of the paper.
Use square monocolor paper.
projects.finished_product_description: An origami wedding dress, 1/3 the size of the original paper.

projects.name: Origami Dress

steps.instruction: Another two outside reverse folds will form the bottom part of the arms.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a garment shape with two angled flaps at the top, each with dashed lines indicating folds. Arrows show the direction of the folds.

steps.instruction: Skinny the bottom part of the arms by making two inside reverse folds, pleat the body part as shown in the diagram. Turn over.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the garment shape from step 8. Arrows indicate making inside reverse folds on the lower part of the arms and pleating the body. A curved arrow indicates to turn the model over.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the two loose ends up as far as they will go.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the garment shape after turning over. Two loose ends at the top are shown being folded upwards with arrows indicating the direction.

steps.instruction: Two squash folds appear below the bust. Turn over.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the garment shape. Two triangular flaps are shown below the neckline, with arrows indicating squash folds. A curved arrow indicates to turn the model over.

steps.instruction: The first half of the dress is now complete.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the garment shape after the previous steps, representing the first half of the dress.

projects.finished_product_description: The first half of an origami dress.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing step 8 of an origami dress, illustrating outside reverse folds for the arms.
Diagram showing step 9 of an origami dress, illustrating inside reverse folds for the arms and pleating the body, with an instruction to turn over.
Diagram showing step 10 of an origami dress, illustrating valley folds for loose ends.
Diagram showing step 11 of an origami dress, illustrating squash folds below the bust, with an instruction to turn over.
Diagram showing step 12 of an origami dress, indicating the completion of the first half.

projects.name: Wedding Dress

steps.instruction: Using the other half of the paper, so that the length of the paper is equal to the length of the dress. Place paper behind the dress. Valley fold the left corner to taste. Then valley fold the left side to meet in the center of the dress. Repeat on the right side.
dimensions_mentioned: length of the paper is equal to the length of the dress
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the top portion of a folded paper dress with a collar. Below the collar, the main body of the dress is shown with the paper extended downwards. Dashed lines and curved arrows indicate valley folds on the bottom left and right corners, folding them inwards. Further dashed lines and arrows show the left and right sides of the paper being valley folded inwards towards the vertical center line.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold both ends to taste.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the paper dress after the valley folds from step 13 have been completed, forming the main skirt shape. Dashed lines and curved arrows indicate mountain folds on the bottom left and right corners of the skirt, folding them upwards and slightly outwards to create a flared effect.

steps.instruction: Completed wedding dress.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the final completed paper wedding dress, with the collar and the skirt fully formed, including the flared bottom created by the mountain folds.

projects.finished_product_description: A completed paper wedding dress.

projects.name: Halloween Witch Mask

materials.color: black on one side and white on the other

steps.instruction: Preliminary base, white side out. Lift right side flap up to a vertical position and squash fold.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with the bottom point folded up. The right flap is lifted vertically and a squash fold is indicated.

steps.instruction: Fold the left flap over to the right.
steps.visual_description: The left flap of the diamond shape is folded over to the right, covering part of the right flap.

steps.instruction: Lift the left flap to the vertical and squash fold.
steps.visual_description: The left flap is lifted to a vertical position and a squash fold is indicated.

steps.instruction: Fold the right flap over to the left.
steps.visual_description: The right flap is folded over to the left.

steps.instruction: Petal fold the top layer and rotate the model 180.
steps.visual_description: The top layer of the model is petal folded. A circular arrow indicates a 180 rotation.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the angle bisectors on each side as shown.
steps.visual_description: The angled edges on both sides are valley folded inwards, meeting at the center line.

steps.instruction: There is a small triangle shown in dotted lines behind the colored part. Reach inside and mountain fold the flap down. See circle view on side. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: A diagram shows a small triangle indicated by dotted lines behind a colored section. A close-up view shows a reference point and a mountain fold being made on the flap. The instruction indicates to repeat on the back.

steps.instruction: Valley fold up the pointed flap.
steps.visual_description: The pointed flap at the bottom is valley folded upwards.

steps.instruction: Valley fold each side as shown. Note the fold does not go all the way to the top, or the center line. See step 10.
steps.visual_description: The sides are valley folded inwards. The folds do not reach the top point or the center line. Curved arrows indicate the direction of the folds.

tips: A 6" square produces a mast about 3-1/4" tall.
Use paper that is black on one side and white on the other.
projects.finished_product_description: A Halloween Witch Mask.

Diagram showing the left flap folded over to the right.
Diagram showing the left flap lifted and squash folded.
Diagram showing the right flap folded over to the left.
Diagram showing the top layer petal folded and the model rotated 180 degrees.
Diagram showing angle bisectors valley folded on each side.
Diagram showing a small triangle behind the colored part, with a close-up view of a mountain fold being made.
Diagram showing the pointed flap valley folded up.
Diagram showing the sides valley folded inwards, not reaching the top or center line.

projects.name: Origami Bird

steps.instruction: Valley fold down the narrow point to the center line (point A to point B).
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with a central vertical line. The top point is labeled A. A narrow point at the bottom is folded upwards towards the center line, with the tip of this fold indicated to reach point B on the center line. Two shaded triangular flaps are visible on the sides.

steps.instruction: Valley fold down the two little corners. Valley and mountain fold the center of the nose so that it sticks straight out of the models towards you.
steps.visual_description: The previous step's fold is shown. Two small corners at the top of the folded section are being valley folded downwards. The central 'nose' section is being manipulated with valley and mountain folds to protrude outwards.

steps.instruction: Fold the nose over to one side. Valley fold point A to point B. Repeat on opposite side.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 11. The protruding nose section is folded over to one side. Point A, the top point of the main diamond, is valley folded to point B, which is located on the opposite side of the model. An arrow indicates this fold. A circular arrow indicates repeating the process on the other side.

steps.instruction: Turn the model over.
steps.visual_description: The origami model is flipped to its reverse side.

steps.instruction: Valley fold both sides into the middle.
steps.visual_description: The model is shown from the reverse side. The two outer edges of the diamond shape are being folded inwards to meet at the central vertical crease line. Dashed lines indicate the fold lines, and curved arrows show the direction of the folds.

steps.instruction: Valley fold and unfold each side as shown. Unfold the right side.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 14. A valley fold is made on the left side, folding a portion of the paper inwards and then unfolding it, creating a crease. The right side is then shown unfolded, with a crease line visible. A curved arrow indicates the unfolding action.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the top right side into the center; at the same time, valley fold the flap that is behind. See step 17.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 15. The top right section is being valley folded towards the center line. Simultaneously, a flap located behind this section is also being valley folded. An arrow indicates the direction of the fold for the top right side. A dashed line indicates the fold for the flap behind.

steps.instruction: Valley fold as shown. Repeat steps 15-17 on the opposite side and turn over.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 16. A valley fold is shown on the top left section, mirroring the fold on the right side. The instruction indicates to repeat steps 15 through 17 on the opposite side of the model and then turn the entire model over.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami bird.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing step 10 of an origami bird fold: valley fold down the narrow point to the center line.
Diagram showing step 11 of an origami bird fold: valley fold down two little corners and manipulate the nose.
Diagram showing step 12 of an origami bird fold: fold the nose over and valley fold point A to point B, with a repeat instruction.
Diagram showing step 13 of an origami bird fold: turn the model over.
Diagram showing step 14 of an origami bird fold: valley fold both sides into the middle.
Diagram showing step 15 of an origami bird fold: valley fold and unfold each side, specifically unfolding the right side.
Diagram showing step 16 of an origami bird fold: valley fold the top right side into the center and the flap behind.
Diagram showing step 17 of an origami bird fold: valley fold as shown, repeat on the opposite side and turn over.

projects.name: Star

steps.instruction: Valley fold and unfold A to B. Valley fold A to C.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a star shape with a folded section underneath. Points A, B, and C are labeled. Dashed lines indicate valley folds.

steps.instruction: Valley and mountain fold as shown and fold A to C and B to C (similar to a small preliminary fold).
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a star shape with a folded section underneath. Points A, B, and C are labeled. Dashed lines indicate valley folds and solid lines indicate mountain folds.

steps.instruction: Pull out the small point (point A in step 18) and tuck it back in behind the corners formed by points B and A. This will help lock it in place. Crimp fold the nose to put a hook into it and point it straight out.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the star shape from the previous step. A small point labeled 'A' is being pulled out and tucked behind other points. A side view of the 'nose' is shown separately, indicating a crimp fold.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold the corners of the eyes behind. Make final shape adjustments.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the completed star shape. The corners that form the 'eyes' are being mountain folded inwards. Final shape adjustments are implied.

projects.finished_product_description: A completed origami star with a pointed nose.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram for step 18 showing valley folds.
Diagram for step 19 showing valley and mountain folds.
Diagram for step 20 showing how to tuck and crimp the nose, with a side view of the nose.
Diagram for step 21 showing mountain folds for the eyes and final adjustments.

projects.name: Preliminary Base Modular

steps.instruction: To create preliminary bases for Variation A: Cut 3" squares from 6" paper that has a border. Form the preliminary base ensuring the border pattern shows on both the front and back of the resulting module.
steps.visual_description: Diagrams 1a (Front view of variation A) and 1b (Back view of variation A) illustrate the appearance of the module, showing the floral border pattern on all exposed flaps.

steps.instruction: To create preliminary bases for Variation B: Cut 3" squares from 6" paper that has a border. Form the preliminary base such that the border pattern shows only on the front of the resulting module, and a solid color shows on the back.
steps.visual_description: Diagrams 2a (Front view of variation B) and 2b (Back view of variation B) illustrate the appearance of the module, showing the floral border pattern on the front flaps and a plain white (solid color) on the back flaps.

pieces.name: Initial paper
pieces.details: Used to cut 3" squares for preliminary bases.

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: Assemble eight preliminary bases to create a 4-1/4" by 4-1/4" model. The visual effect of the modules (pattern on both sides or pattern on front/solid on back) is determined by the initial paper preparation and folding of the preliminary base.

tips: Paper with a border such as "Fuchidari Border Color" or "Duo Color Floral Bouquet" works especially well.
projects.finished_product_description: A 4-1/4" by 4-1/4" modular model, assembled from eight preliminary bases. The appearance of the modules (pattern on both sides or pattern on front/solid on back) depends on how the 3" squares are cut from 6" bordered paper and how the preliminary base is formed.

Diagram showing a preliminary base formed from square paper, with a floral border pattern visible on the front flaps, rotated or transformed from the previous diagram. An arrow indicates the transformation.
Front view of Variation A: A preliminary base with a floral border pattern visible on all exposed flaps.
Back view of Variation A: A preliminary base with a floral border pattern visible on all exposed flaps.
Front view of Variation B: A preliminary base with a floral border pattern visible on the exposed flaps.
Back view of Variation B: A preliminary base with plain white (solid color) visible on the exposed flaps.

projects.name: Modular Unit

steps.instruction: To connect, slide the two right flaps of the left modular unit between the left flaps on the right modular unit.
steps.visual_description: Two modular units are shown. The left unit is angled, with its two right flaps extended. The right unit is positioned to receive these flaps, with its left flaps open. An arrow indicates the direction of insertion.

steps.instruction: Result of step 3.
steps.visual_description: Two modular units are connected. The left unit's flaps are inserted into the right unit. Both units have a pattern of four flowers along the top edge and a dotted line forming a diagonal from the bottom left corner upwards.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the inside white triangle on the right unit over the raw edges of the inserted left unit flaps.
steps.visual_description: The connected modular units from step 4 are shown. A dotted line indicates a valley fold for the white triangle on the right unit, which will cover the inserted flaps. The fold line is angled from the top edge down towards the center.

steps.instruction: Result of step 5. Valley fold the inside white triangle along the vertical raw edges of the white triangle to lock unit in place.
steps.visual_description: The modular unit from step 5 is shown with the white triangle folded over, locking the inserted flaps. An arrow indicates a curved fold line from the top edge, moving downwards and to the right, suggesting the locking action. The dotted line from step 4 is still visible.

steps.instruction: Result of step 7. Repeat steps 3 through 6 to connect the other six units.
steps.visual_description: A completed modular unit is shown, similar to step 6, but with the locking fold more clearly defined. The instruction indicates that this process is repeated six more times to create a complete structure.

projects.finished_product_description: A modular unit for a larger paper craft project.

Diagram of a completed modular unit, with instructions to repeat the process.

projects.name: Triangle Module

steps.instruction: Start with the white side of the paper facing up. Divide the paper into thirds vertically. Valley fold the right outer raw edge inwards along the rightmost crease line, as indicated by the diagram.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper is shown, divided vertically into three equal sections by two dashed lines. A curved arrow indicates folding the rightmost section inwards along the right dashed line.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the top flap as shown in the diagram.
steps.visual_description: The paper from step 1, with the right third folded in. A new dashed line extends diagonally from the top-center point to the bottom-right corner of the folded-in section. A curved arrow indicates folding the top-right corner down along this diagonal line.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the left third of the paper as shown.
steps.visual_description: The paper from step 2. The left third of the paper is now folded inwards along the left dashed line. A curved arrow indicates this fold.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the top flap as shown.
steps.visual_description: The paper from step 3. A new dashed line extends diagonally from the top-left point to the bottom-left corner of the folded-in section. A curved arrow indicates folding the top-left corner down along this diagonal line.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the top left and bottom right flaps as shown. Ensure their folded edges lie straight on top of the folded edges beneath them.
steps.visual_description: The paper from step 4, rotated. Two new diagonal dashed lines are shown, one on the top-left flap and one on the bottom-right flap. Curved arrows indicate folding these flaps inwards. The diagram shows the result of these folds, with the edges aligning.

steps.instruction: This is an enlarged view. Valley fold the flap corners outwards as shown. The valley creases for these folds will be on the diagonal lines that bisect the angles of the corners.
steps.visual_description: An enlarged view of the central part of the module. Two small triangular flaps (corners) are shown valley-folded outwards. Dashed lines indicate the creases bisecting the angles of these corners.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the top left and bottom right flaps as shown. The valley crease for these folds will be on the folded edges beneath the flap.
steps.visual_description: Similar to step 5, but with the flaps from step 6 now folded back in. Two new diagonal dashed lines are shown, one on the top-left flap and one on the bottom-right flap. Curved arrows indicate folding these flaps inwards again. The diagram shows the result of these folds.

steps.instruction: Open the paper out, referring to the diagram for the final module shape.
steps.visual_description: The final folded module is shown, with a curved arrow indicating an opening action, likely referring to opening specific parts to prepare for assembly or to reveal the module's structure.

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: This module is designed to interlock with other modules to create various polyhedra. No adhesive is needed for triangular pyramids, but a small amount may be necessary for square or pentagonal pyramids.

tips: This module was created specifically to make a stellated icosahedron.

It can also be used to make: three modules for a triangular pyramid, four modules for a square pyramid, five modules for a pentagonal pyramid, six modules for a stellated tetrahedron, twelve modules for a stellated cube or a stellated octahedron, thirty modules for a stellated icosahedron or a stellated dodecahedron.
The diameter of the stellated icosahedron (tip to tip) is equal to the diagonal of the square used to fold the modules.
projects.finished_product_description: A modular origami unit (triangle module) that can be assembled into various three-dimensional geometric shapes, including pyramids, stellated polyhedra, cubes, octahedra, icosahedra, and dodecahedra.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 1: A square piece of paper with two vertical dashed lines dividing it into three equal sections. A curved arrow indicates folding the rightmost section inwards.

Diagram 2: The paper from Diagram 1, with the right third folded inwards. A new diagonal dashed line is shown from the top-center to the bottom-right of the folded section, with a curved arrow indicating a fold along this line.
Diagram 3: The paper from Diagram 2, with the left third now folded inwards. A curved arrow indicates this fold.
Diagram 4: The paper from Diagram 3. A new diagonal dashed line is shown from the top-left to the bottom-left of the folded section, with a curved arrow indicating a fold along this line.

Diagram 5: The paper from Diagram 4, rotated. Two new diagonal dashed lines are shown on the top-left and bottom-right flaps, with curved arrows indicating inward folds. The resulting folded edges are shown aligned.
Diagram 6: An enlarged view of the central part of the module. Two small triangular corners are shown valley-folded outwards, with dashed lines indicating the creases bisecting their angles.

Diagram 7: The paper from Diagram 6, with the previously folded-out corners now folded back in. Two new diagonal dashed lines are shown on the top-left and bottom-right flaps, with curved arrows indicating inward folds.
Diagram 8: The final folded module, showing a complex, layered structure, with a curved arrow indicating an opening or unfolding action to finalize the module's shape or prepare for assembly.
