projects.name: 3D Octagonal Fold

steps.instruction: Create 90 degree vertical valley fold at the intersection of the slanted line to the outer octagon. Repeat seven times.
steps.visual_description: A circular shape with radial and concentric lines forming an octagon pattern. A dashed line indicates a valley fold near the center, extending outwards, with a 90-degree angle symbol and an arrow. The outer sections of the circle are dotted.

steps.instruction: Create a smaller octagon by connecting the creases created in step 8 with mountain folds. Create a mountain fold from the outside triangle to the adjacent line as shown. Repeat seven times. Turn over.
steps.visual_description: A circular shape similar to the previous diagram. New dot-dash lines (mountain folds) are shown forming a smaller inner octagon. Arrows indicate the direction of these mountain folds from the outer triangles towards the adjacent lines. The outer sections of the circle are dotted.

steps.instruction: Reinforce the valley folds on inner and outer octagons as shown. Reinforce the valley creases from the edge of the circle to the inner octagon. Reinforce the mountain folds from the inner octagon to the edge of the circle as shown. Collapse the model into 3D shape shifting the flaps clockwise as shown. Beware the sides of the box are not flush to the model.
steps.visual_description: A circular shape with complex fold lines (dashed for valley, dot-dash for mountain) indicating a partially collapsed 3D structure. Arrows show the direction of collapse and clockwise shifting of flaps. The text '3D' is present next to the diagram.

tips: Beware the sides of the box are not flush to the model.

Diagram for step 10: A circular pattern illustrating the collapse of the model into a 3D shape, with various fold lines and arrows indicating flap movement. The label '3D' is next to the diagram.

steps.visual_description: The head is folded outwards using an outside reverse fold. The tail has a crimp fold and is shaped to appear three-dimensional.

steps.instruction: Double rabbit ear. Details of head enlarged for clarity.
steps.visual_description: An enlarged view of the head showing a double rabbit ear fold, creating the tusks and snout of the walrus.
The completed walrus model, shown from the side, with its body, flippers, tail, and head clearly defined.

tips: 6" paper makes a 4" model.

projects.name: Turtle

steps.instruction: Fold the front and back flaps upward.
steps.visual_description: A square folded into a diamond shape. The top two flaps are folded upwards along a horizontal dashed line.

steps.instruction: Fold the flap to the left, incorporating a reverse fold. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with arrows indicating a fold to the left and a reverse fold. A small cross symbol is shown near the top point.

steps.instruction: Fold the front and rear flaps inside.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with two flaps on each side. Arrows indicate these flaps are being folded inwards.

steps.instruction: Sink.
steps.visual_description: A triangular shape with a black triangle pointing downwards at the top apex. Dashed lines indicate internal folds.

steps.instruction: Insert fingers in center and flatten the model out.
steps.visual_description: A trapezoidal shape with points labeled A, B, C, and D. Arrows show fingers being inserted into the center and the model being flattened.

steps.instruction: Reverse fold the partially hidden flaps.
steps.visual_description: An octagonal shape with internal creases. Points A, B, C, and D are visible. Arrows indicate reverse folding of flaps.

tips: 10" paper makes a 6 1/2" turtle
projects.finished_product_description: A turtle origami model.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing the initial fold of a preliminary base.
Diagram showing a flap being folded to the left with a reverse fold.
Diagram showing front and rear flaps being folded inside.
Diagram illustrating the 'sink' step.
Diagram showing fingers inserted into the center to flatten the model.
Diagram showing reverse folding of partially hidden flaps.
A faint, unfinished line drawing of what appears to be a bird or a winged creature on the right side of the page.

projects.name: Origami Turtle

steps.instruction: Rabbit ear the four flaps.
steps.visual_description: A square origami base with four flaps pointing outwards. Arrows indicate folding the tips of the flaps inwards to create a thinner point.

steps.instruction: Fold four corners behind.
steps.visual_description: The origami model from step 7, now with four points extending from the sides. Arrows indicate folding these points backwards.

steps.instruction: Pinch tail to make it thinner. Open out head to make it round.
steps.visual_description: The origami model from step 8. One of the points is now a thin tail. Arrows indicate pinching the tail to make it thinner and opening out another point to form a rounded head.

steps.instruction: Round out the body.
steps.visual_description: The origami model from step 9, showing a more rounded body shape. Arrows indicate pushing in the sides of the body to round it.

steps.instruction: Completed model.
steps.visual_description: A completed origami turtle with a head, tail, and four legs.

projects.finished_product_description: A completed origami turtle.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing step 7 of origami turtle construction: Rabbit ear fold on four flaps.
Diagram showing step 8 of origami turtle construction: Folding four corners behind.
Diagram showing step 9 of origami turtle construction: Pinching tail and opening head.
Diagram showing step 10 of origami turtle construction: Rounding out the body.

projects.name: Manatee

steps.instruction: Fold the paper diagonally in half, then unfold. Fold diagonally in half the other way, then unfold. Fold in half horizontally, then unfold. Fold in half vertically, then unfold.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with dashed lines indicating diagonal and horizontal/vertical folds. Arrows show the direction of the folds.

steps.instruction: Bring the left and right edges to the center crease and fold.
steps.visual_description: The paper is folded in half vertically. The left and right edges are brought to the center crease. An arrow indicates the folding action.

steps.instruction: Fold the top point down to the bottom point.
steps.visual_description: The top point of the folded paper is brought down to the bottom point, creating a kite shape.

steps.instruction: Fold the left and right sides of the top flap to the center line.
steps.visual_description: The top diamond shape is folded in half along the center line. The left and right edges of this flap are then folded to meet the center crease.

steps.instruction: Fold the top point down to the bottom point.
steps.visual_description: The top point of the model is folded down to the bottom point. An arrow indicates the fold.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom flaps upwards.
steps.visual_description: The bottom two points of the model are folded upwards. Dotted lines indicate the fold lines. Arrows show the direction of the folds.

steps.instruction: Fold the left and right sides of the bottom flaps inwards.
steps.visual_description: The sides of the flaps folded up in the previous step are folded inwards. An arrow indicates the fold.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom section upwards and then fold the sides inwards.
steps.visual_description: The bottom section of the model is folded upwards. Then, the sides of this folded section are folded inwards. Arrows indicate the folds.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom section upwards.
steps.visual_description: The bottom section of the model is folded upwards. A curved arrow indicates a finishing touch or adjustment.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom tip upwards and then fold the sides inwards.
steps.visual_description: The bottom tip of the model is folded upwards. Then, the sides of this folded tip are folded inwards. Arrows indicate the folds.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom tip upwards.
steps.visual_description: The bottom tip of the model is folded upwards to form the tail of the manatee. A curved arrow indicates a finishing touch or adjustment.

projects.finished_product_description: A folded paper manatee.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing step 1 of folding a square paper into a diamond shape with crease lines.
Diagram showing step 2 of folding the sides of the paper to the center crease.
Diagram showing step 3 of folding the top point down to the bottom point.
Diagram showing step 4 of folding the top flap's sides to the center.
Diagram showing step 5 of folding the top point down.
Diagram showing step 6 of folding the bottom flaps upwards.
Diagram showing step 7 of folding the sides of the bottom flaps inwards.
Diagram showing step 8 of folding the bottom section up and then the sides inwards.
Diagram showing step 9 of folding the bottom section up.
Diagram showing step 10 of folding the bottom tip up and then the sides inwards.
Diagram showing step 11 of folding the bottom tip up to complete the manatee shape.

projects.name: Elasmosaurus

steps.instruction: Fold the paper as shown.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a complex origami fold with shaded areas indicating the direction of the fold. The shape resembles a diamond with four points, and a smaller diamond shape at the bottom.

steps.instruction: Fold the paper as shown.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the next stage of the origami fold. The shape from step 12 is further manipulated, with new folds creating a more defined structure. Two triangular flaps are formed at the bottom.

steps.instruction: Fold the paper as shown.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the origami fold progressing. The shape is becoming more elongated, with the top point extending upwards and the bottom section being folded inwards.

steps.instruction: Fold the paper as shown.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a side view of the origami model. The shape is long and flat, with a curved top edge and a pointed front. Arrows indicate folds and tucks.

steps.instruction: Fold the paper as shown.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the side view of the origami model. The rear section is being folded to create legs or fins. Arrows indicate the direction of folds and creases.

steps.instruction: Fold the paper as shown.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the side view of the origami model. The head section is being shaped, with a fold creating a distinct snout. An arrow indicates a tucking motion.

steps.instruction: Fold the paper as shown.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a more detailed view of the origami model's body and head. Arrows indicate various folds and adjustments to shape the creature. A curved arrow shows a turning motion.

steps.instruction: Fold the paper as shown.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the side view of the nearly completed origami model. The head and body are well-defined. Arrows indicate final shaping folds and tucks for the limbs and tail.

steps.instruction: The finished origami model.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the completed origami model of an Elasmosaurus. It is depicted in profile, with a long neck, a bulky body, and four flipper-like limbs.

diagram_descriptions: Diagrams 12-14 show the top-down construction of an origami figure, progressing from a complex star-like shape to a more defined form with flaps.
Diagrams 15-17 show a side profile of the origami figure, illustrating the shaping of the body, limbs, and head.

projects.name: Elasmosaurus

steps.instruction: Begin with the colored side facing up. Fold diagonally in half, crease well, and unfold.
steps.visual_description: A square with a diagonal dashed line from the top-left to the bottom-right corner. A curved arrow indicates folding along this line and then unfolding.

steps.instruction: Fold to the middle...
steps.visual_description: A square with two diagonal dashed lines forming an 'X' and a horizontal and vertical dashed line forming a '+'. Curved arrows indicate folding the top and bottom edges to the center horizontal line.

steps.instruction: ...then bring down the top triangle as indicated.
steps.visual_description: A square with diagonal and horizontal/vertical dashed lines. The top point of the square is folded down along a horizontal line, forming a triangle. Arrows indicate the folding motion.

steps.instruction: First make two mountain folds as shown, crease well, and unfold. Lift up the triangle folded in step 3.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with dashed lines indicating mountain folds. Curved arrows show the folding and unfolding of the top triangle. Another curved arrow indicates lifting the top triangle.

steps.instruction: Collapse as shown...
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with several folded layers. Arrows indicate collapsing the sides inwards.

steps.instruction: ...like this.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with a central collapsed section. The sides appear to be folded inwards.

steps.instruction: Squash fold on the right. Repeat on the left.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with a central fold. Arrows indicate a squash fold on the right side. A small triangular flap is shown on the right edge. A dashed line indicates a fold.

steps.instruction: Squash fold both sides again. Tuck the large triangle in the middle under. Fold and unfold the two smaller triangles.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with two flaps folded inwards. Arrows indicate squash folding both sides. A large triangle in the center is shown being tucked under. Smaller triangles are indicated for folding and unfolding.

tips: 10" paper makes a model 6" long.
projects.finished_product_description: An origami Elasmosaurus.

Diagram showing step 2 of folding a square to the middle lines.
Diagram showing step 3 of folding the top triangle down.
Diagram showing step 4 of making mountain folds and lifting the top triangle.
Diagram showing step 5 of collapsing the sides of the origami.
Diagram showing step 6 of the collapsed origami shape.
Diagram showing step 7 of performing a squash fold on the right side.
Diagram showing step 8 of performing squash folds and tucking a triangle.

projects.name: Origami Rabbit

steps.instruction: Fold the right half of the top layer to the left.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with a dashed vertical line down the center. A curved arrow indicates folding the right half of the top layer to the left.

steps.instruction: Fold as diagrammed.
steps.visual_description: The previous shape is shown with additional dashed lines indicating folds. A section on the right is folded inwards, and a flap is folded down.

steps.instruction: Close with a rabbit ear.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 10 is shown. A triangular flap is being folded upwards and inwards, creating a 'rabbit ear' shape.

steps.instruction: Repeat steps 9 to 11 on the left.
steps.visual_description: The origami shape from step 11 is shown. A circular arrow with a line through it indicates a reverse fold or unfolding action on the left side. A horizontal dashed line is also indicated.

steps.instruction: Turn two layers on the left to the right.
steps.visual_description: The origami shape from step 12 is shown. Two layers on the left side are being folded over to the right, indicated by curved arrows.

steps.instruction: Make two mountain folds to tuck the excess paper under.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 13 is shown. Dashed lines indicate where mountain folds should be made to tuck excess paper underneath.

steps.instruction: Rabbit's ear...
steps.visual_description: The origami shape from step 14 is shown. A section on the left is being folded upwards and outwards, resembling a rabbit's ear. Curved arrows indicate the folding direction.

steps.instruction: ... and sink here.
steps.visual_description: The origami shape from step 15 is shown. A small triangular flap is being pushed inwards into a pocket, indicated by a dashed line and an arrow.

steps.instruction: One more rabbit's ear. Repeat steps 13 to 17 on the right.
steps.visual_description: The origami shape from step 16 is shown. A section on the right is being folded upwards and outwards, creating a rabbit's ear. An arrow indicates a small fold on the tip of this ear.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami figure that resembles a rabbit.

diagram_descriptions: Page number 225 at the top right.

projects.name: Origami Figure

steps.instruction: Bring the two corners to the top.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a partially folded origami shape with two corners being brought upwards to meet at a central point.

steps.instruction: This is a close up of the upper portion of the assembly after step 18. Squash fold.
steps.visual_description: A close-up circular diagram showing the top part of the origami assembly after step 18, with lines indicating a squash fold.

steps.instruction: Petal fold, then tuck the resultant triangle into the body.
steps.visual_description: A circular diagram showing the origami assembly. A petal fold is indicated, and a triangle is being tucked into the body of the model.

steps.instruction: Mountain folds. These will form the hind legs.
steps.visual_description: A circular diagram showing the origami assembly with dashed lines indicating mountain folds that will form the hind legs.

steps.instruction: Swivel the top layer a little like this...
steps.visual_description: A circular diagram showing the top layer of the origami assembly being swiveled.

steps.instruction: ...then complete as illustrated.
steps.visual_description: A circular diagram showing the final stage of completing the origami assembly as illustrated.

steps.instruction: Crimp the hinds legs to bring them slightly to the back. Bring the point on the right to the left, forming a gusset. See step 25.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the lower part of the origami assembly. The hind legs are being crimped, and a point on the right is being brought to the left to form a gusset.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami figure with distinct hind legs and a gusseted base.

diagram_descriptions: Page number '226' at the top left.
Diagram for step 18 showing a partially folded origami shape.
Circular diagram for step 19, a close-up of the upper portion after step 18, indicating a squash fold.
Circular diagram for step 20, showing a petal fold and tucking a triangle.
Circular diagram for step 21, indicating mountain folds for hind legs.
Circular diagram for step 22, showing the top layer being swiveled.
Circular diagram for step 23, showing the completion of the assembly.
Diagram for step 24, showing the crimping of hind legs and forming a gusset.
A larger, more detailed diagram of the origami figure in a later stage of assembly, below steps 21-23.

projects.name: Plesiosaur

steps.instruction: Fold to the right, while swiveling to broaden the point. This will form one of the forelegs.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows a paper model with a pointed bottom. An arrow indicates a fold to the right and outward, broadening the point. A circular motion is implied.

steps.instruction: Sink the base of the foreleg, then valley fold it upwards.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows the previous step's foreleg. An arrow indicates sinking the base of the foreleg and then folding it upwards.

steps.instruction: Crimp to complete. Repeat steps 24 to 27 on the left foreleg. Sink about 1/16th the length of the body in a reverse crimp as shown.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows the model with one foreleg completed. Arrows indicate a crimp action on the foreleg. A small circle with arrows indicates a reverse crimp on the body, with a measurement indicated.

steps.instruction: Sink both sides.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows a top-down view of the model's body. Arrows indicate sinking the sides.

steps.instruction: Sink both sides to narrow.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows the model from the side. Arrows indicate sinking the sides to narrow the body.

steps.instruction: Make a crimp between neck and body while folding the model in half.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows the model folded in half. An arrow indicates making a crimp between the neck and body.

steps.instruction: Rabbit ear both sides of the tail. Narrow the length of the neck while crimping to bring the head down.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows the tail area with 'rabbit ear' folds indicated. Another diagram shows the neck being narrowed and crimped to bring the head down.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the flippers, splaying these to the sides of the body. Round out the neck and bring down the lower jaw to complete the model.
steps.visual_description: Diagram shows the flippers being valley folded outwards. The neck is shown rounded, and the jaw is brought down. A final diagram shows the completed plesiosaur model in water.

projects.finished_product_description: A paper craft model of a plesiosaur, depicted swimming in water.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing step 25 of the plesiosaur origami, illustrating a fold to broaden a point.
Diagram showing step 26, illustrating sinking and folding a foreleg upwards.
Diagram showing step 27, illustrating crimping a foreleg and a reverse crimp on the body.
Diagram showing step 28, illustrating sinking the sides of the body from a top-down view.
Diagram showing step 29, illustrating sinking the sides to narrow the body from a side view.
Diagram showing step 30, illustrating folding the model in half and making a crimp between the neck and body.
Diagram showing step 31, illustrating rabbit ear folds on the tail and narrowing the neck.
Diagram showing step 32, illustrating valley folding the flippers, rounding the neck, and bringing down the jaw.
Final diagram showing the completed plesiosaur model in water.

projects.name: Logo Bookmark

steps.instruction: Start with a 10" by 1" strip.
steps.visual_description: A long, thin rectangle with a zig-zag cut at the bottom edge. Dashed lines indicate a fold.
The strip from step 1 is shown folded in half vertically. A curved arrow indicates a fold inwards.

A square shape is formed by folding the right side of the paper to the left, creating a triangle on top. A curved arrow indicates a fold of the top triangle down. A circle with '90' and curved arrows indicates a 90-degree turn.
The shape from step 3 is shown with the top triangle folded down. Two smaller triangles are formed at the bottom. A dashed line indicates a fold.

The shape from step 4 is shown with the top point folded down. A dashed line indicates a center fold. A zig-zag pattern is shown at the bottom, indicating the tail of the bookmark. Curved arrows indicate folds.
The finished bookmark is shown. It has a triangular head and a long, thin tail with a zig-zag cut at the end. A separate box contains the text 'Tail of bookmark is bi-colored'.

tips: The tail of the bookmark will be bi-colored.
projects.finished_product_description: A logo bookmark with a triangular head and a bi-colored tail.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing the steps to fold a logo bookmark.
Diagram showing the finished logo bookmark.

projects.name: Display Corner

steps.instruction: Start white side up for a colored model. Bring short edges of rectangle together; fold and unfold.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle with a vertical center crease and two diagonal lines indicating folds, one with an arrow showing direction.

steps.instruction: Valley fold top long edges down to lay along center line.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle with the top two long edges folded down to meet the center vertical crease. Dashed lines indicate the folds and arrows show the direction.

steps.instruction: Turn model over.
steps.visual_description: A house-like shape with a pointed top and a rectangular base, with a curved arrow indicating to turn it over.

steps.instruction: Valley fold bottom corners to center. Unfold left corner.
steps.visual_description: The house-like shape from step 3, with the bottom corners folded inwards to the center vertical line. Dashed lines and arrows indicate the folds. The left corner is shown unfolded.

steps.instruction: Bring bottom center point to left edge ; Model will be 3-dimensional.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with a vertical line down the center, and two diagonal lines forming a triangle at the top. An arrow shows the bottom point being brought to the left edge.

steps.instruction: Tuck left corner into center of model to lock.
steps.visual_description: A triangular shape formed by three intersecting lines, with a small 'M' shape and an arrow pointing downwards, indicating a tucking action.

tips: Author's note: Use 1 X 4 paper. A 10" square cut down makes a model with width 3-1/2", height 2-3/8", depth approximately 1-3/4".
projects.finished_product_description: A 3-dimensional display corner.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing a rectangle with a vertical center line and diagonal fold lines with arrows.
Diagram showing a rectangle with top edges folded to the center line.
Diagram of a house-like shape with a pointed top and rectangular base, with an arrow indicating to turn it over.
Diagram of the house-like shape with bottom corners folded to the center, and the left corner unfolded.
Diagram of a diamond shape with a vertical center line and diagonal lines forming a triangle, with an arrow showing the bottom point moving to the left edge.
Diagram of a triangular shape formed by three intersecting lines, with an arrow indicating a tucking action.

projects.name: Note Holder

steps.instruction: Start with a waterbomb base.
steps.visual_description: A square with dashed lines indicating diagonal and horizontal/vertical creases, forming an 'X' and a '+' in the center.

steps.instruction: Make two vertical mountain creases on all the layers to the center.
steps.visual_description: A square with a pointed bottom. Two vertical dashed lines are shown from the top edge down to the horizontal crease, with arrows indicating mountain folds towards the center.

steps.instruction: With the top layer, make two vertical mountain folds to the center.
steps.visual_description: Similar to step 2, but focusing on the top layer. Arrows indicate mountain folds towards the center along vertical lines.

steps.instruction: With the bottom layer, make two vertical mountain folds to the center.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 3, with the bottom layer now showing two vertical mountain folds towards the center, indicated by dashed lines and arrows.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold the two top corner ends to the center in an airplane fold.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 4. The two top corners are folded inwards towards the center line, resembling the wings of an airplane. Curved arrows indicate the fold direction.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold the bottom part over.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 5. The bottom pointed section is folded upwards. A curved arrow indicates the fold direction.

steps.instruction: Using the top layer only, cut a small slit down the center.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 6. A horizontal line with a small 'X' is shown across the center of the top layer, indicating a cut. Scissors icon is shown.

steps.instruction: Using the top layer again, make two valley folds. The valley folds start from the corners to where the slit ends.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 7. Two dashed lines are shown starting from the bottom corners of the top layer and extending upwards to the cut slit. Arrows indicate valley folds.

steps.instruction: Completed model.
steps.visual_description: The completed note holder, showing the folded sections and the pocket created by the previous folds.

steps.instruction: Completed model with decoration at the top.
steps.visual_description: The completed note holder with a decorative bow or ribbon tied at the top point, and a patterned design on the bottom pocket section.

tips: Editor's note: completed model is 1/4 the size of paper. Use one sheet of rectangular paper with proportions of 2 by 1-1/3 for best results.
projects.finished_product_description: A note holder made by folding paper, with a pocket at the bottom and a decorative top.

projects.name: Origami Stand #2

steps.instruction: Form fish base, with extra folds as shown.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with dashed lines indicating folds. Arrows show folds on the sides. A curved arrow indicates a fold on the right side.

steps.instruction: Turn fish base over.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with horizontal lines indicating folds.

steps.instruction: Crease on existing creases.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with a dashed line down the center and two dashed lines forming a horizontal crease. Arrows indicate folding the sides inward.

steps.instruction: Fold flap over & back. Mountain fold the whole base, at the same time fold one of the original flaps (now on back side) into the other flap (see step 2.)
steps.visual_description: A shape with one flap folded over and back. A dashed line indicates a mountain fold. Arrows show the folding action.

steps.instruction: Side view. Squash fold the top to form a platform.
steps.visual_description: A side view of the origami, showing a triangular top section being squashed to form a platform.

projects.name: Parking Meter

steps.instruction: Start with an 8 x 1 rectangle. Fold the paper in half, quarters & eights. Then fold the paper in half again.
steps.visual_description: Three horizontal rectangular diagrams. The top diagram shows a rectangle with a wavy top edge and dashed vertical lines. The second diagram shows a rectangle with a scalloped top edge and dashed vertical lines. The third diagram shows a rectangle with a curved line and dashed vertical lines, with an arrow pointing to the right.

steps.instruction: Fold both layers of the upper fourth of the model toward you, then fold and unfold the flaps in half, creasing only the edge. Then, fold the flaps back upward, lining the small crease up with the folded edge of the paper. Finally, fold only the top flap downward.
steps.visual_description: Three vertical diagrams showing a folded paper model. The first diagram shows a gray rectangle with a dashed line across the top and a downward arrow. The second diagram shows the top section folded forward with arrows indicating folding and unfolding. The third diagram shows the top section folded back upward, with a small crease aligned with the folded edge, and then the very top flap folded downward.

projects.finished_product_description: A 3" model of a parking meter.

diagram_descriptions: A triangular stamp with text 'FROM THE LILLIAN OPPENHEIMER COLLECTION'.

projects.name: Origami Model

steps.instruction: Fold the two side flaps inward, carefully noting the location of the crease lines. Then, execute an asymmetrical "crimp" fold as indicated. Finally, narrow the point as much as possible with two swivel folds.
steps.visual_description: Three diagrams showing a rectangular piece of paper being folded. The first shows two side flaps folded inward. The second shows an asymmetrical crimp fold being made. The third shows the point being narrowed with two swivel folds. Two separate diagrams show the result of the crimp fold from different angles.

steps.instruction: Fold the assembly upward and turn the model over.
steps.visual_description: Three diagrams showing a rectangular piece of paper being folded upward. The third diagram shows the model turned over, revealing a flat surface with two horizontal crease lines.

steps.instruction: Thin the "pole" with two inward swivel folds. "Crimp" the pole as shown and thin the pole further with two additional swivel folds. Finally, fold the complex assembly downward.
steps.visual_description: Five diagrams showing a pole-like structure being thinned and folded. The first diagram shows the pole with dashed lines indicating inward swivel folds. The second shows the pole after the swivel folds, with arrows indicating a crimp. The third shows the pole after the crimp. The fourth shows further thinning with swivel folds. The fifth shows the final downward fold of the assembly.

steps.instruction: Complete the model by folding the top edge downward, the sides inward and by folding the upper corners and bottom to the back.
steps.visual_description: Four diagrams showing the completion of the origami model. The first shows the top edge being folded down. The second shows the sides being folded inward. The third shows the upper corners being folded to the back. The fourth shows the bottom being folded to the back, resulting in the finished model.

projects.finished_product_description: A completed origami model with a distinct pole-like structure and folded top section.

diagram_descriptions: Page number 233 at the top right corner.

projects.name: Letterfold

steps.instruction: Place the paper with the white side up. Precrease the paper as shown in the diagram.
steps.visual_description: A square sheet of paper with dashed lines indicating creases along both diagonals and both horizontal and vertical midlines, all intersecting at the center.

steps.instruction: Make a valley crease as indicated in the diagram.
steps.visual_description: A square sheet of paper with existing precreases. A new valley crease is shown originating from the bottom edge, extending towards the center, and then curving upwards and outwards. Arrows indicate the direction of the fold.

steps.instruction: Make a valley crease as indicated in the diagram.
steps.visual_description: A partially folded model. The bottom corner of the paper is folded upwards, forming a triangular flap. A valley crease is indicated along the base of this flap. Curved arrows show the folding action.

steps.instruction: Unfold the paper completely back to the state of step 1. Then, turn the paper over to the colored side.
steps.visual_description: A partially folded model (similar to the result of step 3). A curved arrow indicates unfolding. A circular arrow indicates turning the paper over.

steps.instruction: Make a valley crease as indicated in the diagram.
steps.visual_description: A square sheet of paper (now on the colored side) with existing creases. A new valley crease is indicated, similar in style to step 2 but from a different corner/orientation, with arrows showing the folding action.

steps.instruction: This diagram shows the result of step 5. Unfold the paper. Repeat steps 5 and 6 three more times on the other sides of the paper. After completing all repetitions, turn the paper over to the white side.
steps.visual_description: A square sheet of paper with a triangular flap folded up from one corner, showing internal creases. Arrows indicate unfolding and turning the paper over.

steps.instruction: Make a valley crease as shown in the diagram and then unfold it. Repeat this step three more times on the other sides of the paper.
steps.visual_description: A square sheet of paper with multiple valley creases indicated, forming a complex pattern of straight and curved lines. Arrows show the folding and unfolding actions.

steps.instruction: Reinforce all valley and mountain creases. Collapse the model as shown in the diagram.
steps.visual_description: A square sheet of paper with a complex pattern of reinforced valley and mountain creases. Arrows indicate a collapsing action, suggesting the paper is being brought together along these creases.

steps.instruction: The model is now completed.
steps.visual_description: A 3D representation of the finished 'Letterfold' model, which appears as a multi-faceted, somewhat star-shaped or flower-like object.

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: The final model dimensions are 3-3/4" by 3-3/4" when made from a 6" square.

projects.finished_product_description: A multi-faceted, star-shaped or flower-like origami model, referred to as a 'Letterfold'.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 1: A square with dashed lines indicating precreases along both diagonals and both horizontal and vertical midlines.
Diagram 2: A square with existing precreases and a new valley crease indicated by a solid line and curved arrows showing the folding direction.
Diagram 3: A partially folded model with a triangular flap formed by a valley crease, with curved arrows indicating the folding action.
Diagram 4: A partially folded model with an arrow indicating unfolding and a circular arrow indicating turning the paper over.
Diagram 5: A square (colored side up) with existing creases and a new valley crease indicated by a solid line and curved arrows.
Diagram 6: A partially folded model (result of step 5) with arrows indicating unfolding and turning the paper over.
Diagram 7: A square with multiple valley creases indicated by solid lines and curved arrows showing folding and unfolding actions.
Diagram 8: A square with a complex pattern of reinforced valley and mountain creases, with arrows indicating a collapsing action.
Diagram 9: A 3D illustration of the completed 'Letterfold' model.

projects.name: Mushroom

steps.instruction: White side up. Fold in half and unfold. Pinch at top and bottom.
steps.visual_description: A square with a horizontal dashed line in the middle and arrows indicating a fold in half and then unfolding. There are also arrows indicating pinching at the top and bottom center.

steps.instruction: Pleat into eighths and unfold.
steps.visual_description: A square with multiple vertical dashed lines, indicating pleats. Arrows show the pleating action.

steps.instruction: More precreasing.
steps.visual_description: A square with several fold lines indicated by dashed and dotted lines. Arrows show diagonal folds from the corners towards the center, and a horizontal fold line in the middle.

steps.instruction: This is similar to stretch pleating. Collapse using the crease pattern.
steps.visual_description: A square with dotted and dashed lines indicating folds. Arrows show the paper collapsing inwards along the crease lines.

steps.instruction: Valley fold.
steps.visual_description: A shape that resembles the top part of a mushroom, with the sides folded inwards. An arrow indicates a valley fold.

steps.instruction: Result. Turn over.
steps.visual_description: The finished mushroom shape, viewed from the top. It has a cap and a stem. A small doodle of a swirl with an arrow is shown to the right.

tips: 6" paper makes a 3" mushroom.
projects.finished_product_description: A paper mushroom.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing the steps to fold a paper mushroom.
Diagram showing the first step: folding a square in half and unfolding, with pinching indicated.
Diagram showing the second step: pleating a square into eighths and unfolding.
Diagram showing the third step: precreasing with diagonal and horizontal fold lines.
Diagram showing the fourth step: collapsing the paper along crease lines.
Diagram showing the fifth step: a valley fold to form the mushroom shape.
Diagram showing the final result of the paper mushroom.

projects.name: Mushroom

steps.instruction: Squash folds. Turn over.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a folded paper shape with two flaps on top. Arrows indicate squash folds on the flaps. A curved arrow indicates turning the paper over.

steps.instruction: Valley folds.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a trapezoidal shape with a rectangular stem. Dashed lines indicate valley folds on the trapezoidal top. A curved arrow indicates the direction of the fold.

steps.instruction: Fold behind. Turn over.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a folded paper shape. Arrows indicate folding flaps behind. A curved arrow indicates turning the paper over.

steps.instruction: Tuck in. Turn over.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a folded paper shape resembling a T-shirt. Arrows indicate tucking in flaps. A curved arrow indicates turning the paper over.

steps.instruction: Round with reverse folds.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the top part of the mushroom shape. Arrows indicate reverse folds to create a rounded cap. A faint outline of the stem is visible below.

steps.instruction: Complete mushroom.
steps.visual_description: A diagram of a completed mushroom with a rounded cap and a stem. The cap is shaded to indicate texture or form.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami mushroom.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing step 7: Squash folds. Turn over.
Diagram showing step 8: Valley folds.
Diagram showing step 9: Fold behind. Turn over.
Diagram showing step 10: Tuck in. Turn over.
Diagram showing step 11: Round with reverse folds.

projects.name: Free-Standing Flower

materials.color: colored, with circular color in the center

steps.instruction: Start with a colored frog/lily base (see the Introduction Section of this book for instructions).
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with two flaps folded upwards, and an arrow indicating a fold.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold the small triangular flap up inside (it helps to open the model by separating the two lower points). Repeat on other three flaps.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with a small triangular flap folded upwards inside. Arrows indicate the fold direction. The background shows a faint outline of the next step.

steps.instruction: Step 2 completed. Repeat behind. Fold the right flap over to the left. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with the right flap folded over to the left. The background shows a faint outline of the next step.

steps.instruction: Lift up the bottom flap, valley folding at the natural line. See step 5. This is the same move as stretching a bird base.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with the bottom flap being lifted upwards, with a dashed line indicating the fold. An arrow shows the direction of movement. The background shows a faint outline of the next step.

steps.instruction: Reduced size. This is what is should look like. Valley fold as shown. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with the bottom section folded upwards, resembling a smaller diamond. Arrows indicate the fold direction. The background shows a faint outline of the next step.

steps.instruction: This is what is should look like now. Valley fold and unfold the top to taste.. Unfold the whole model and sink the point as you refold the model to step 12. This is not easy, so take your time.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with the top section folded downwards. The background shows a faint outline of the next step.

tips: Foil is strongly recommended.
projects.finished_product_description: A free-standing flower.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing step 1 of folding a paper base.
Diagram showing step 2 of folding a triangular flap upwards.
Diagram showing step 3 of folding a flap over to the left.
Diagram showing step 4 of lifting and valley folding a bottom flap.
Diagram showing step 5, the result of the valley fold.
Diagram showing step 6, a valley fold and unfold of the top section.

projects.name: Origami Flower

steps.instruction: This is what the model looks like now. Lift up the front and rear flaps.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with two flaps on the front, one pointing up and one pointing down. A curved arrow indicates lifting the front flap.

steps.instruction: Valley fold each side in, about 1/3, as shown.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with a vertical center line. Dotted lines indicate where to fold the sides inward. A horizontal dashed line is present in the center.

steps.instruction: Step 8 completed. Repeat step 7 behind.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with the sides folded inward, creating a narrower central section. Two rectangular shapes are visible on each side of the central fold.

steps.instruction: Reverse fold each lower point as far up as it will go.
steps.visual_description: A diamond shape with inward folded sides. Two curved arrows indicate folding the bottom points upwards.

steps.instruction: The model should now look like this. Curl each of the petals downward and slightly spread the sunken point. The bottom view should look like an "X."
steps.visual_description: A model resembling a flower bud with four petals at the top. The bottom section shows a central point with two diverging lines, forming an 'X' shape.

tips: Selecting different patterned papers will vary the flower's appearance.
projects.finished_product_description: The finished model will stand on its own base.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing step 7 of origami flower construction: lifting front and rear flaps.
Diagram showing step 8 of origami flower construction: valley folding sides inward.
Diagram showing step 9 of origami flower construction: completion of step 8 and instruction to repeat on the back.
Diagram showing step 10 of origami flower construction: reverse folding lower points upwards.
Diagram showing step 11 of origami flower construction: curled petals and bottom view resembling an 'X'.
Diagram showing the finished origami flower standing on its base, with curved lines suggesting petals.
Text describing the finished origami flower and how paper choice affects appearance.

projects.name: Corner Frame

steps.instruction: Start white side up. Precrease and pleat as shown.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper, white side up, showing a complex pattern of dashed (valley) and dash-dot (mountain) precrease lines, with arrows indicating pleating. A bracket on the left side marks a section approximately 1/4 of the paper's width.

steps.instruction: Mountain folding using the creases made in step 1 as a guide.
steps.visual_description: The paper from step 1, partially folded. The bottom section is folded upwards, forming a triangular flap. A bracket on the left still indicates a 1/4 width section. A curved arrow shows the direction of a fold, and a circular arrow indicates a rotation.

steps.instruction: Fold as shown. "......" denotes a valley fold in the second layer.
steps.visual_description: The paper further folded, with a small square shape formed in the bottom-left corner. Dotted lines indicate a valley fold in the second layer. A bracket on the left still indicates a 1/4 width section.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold the second layer only.
steps.visual_description: The paper from step 3, with an additional mountain fold applied to the second layer. A 180-degree rotation symbol is present, suggesting the piece should be turned.

details.description: multiple diagonal, horizontal, and vertical precrease lines for pleating, with a 1/4 width section indicated on one side

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: This project creates one corner of a photo frame. To make a complete frame, two pieces are typically required. The left-sided piece is made by reversing steps 6 and 7 (steps not shown on this page).

tips: A 10" square will hold a photo size 6" by 4". For larger photos, make two pieces. The left-sided piece is made by reversing steps 6 and 7.
projects.finished_product_description: An origami corner frame designed to hold a photo.

projects.name: Folded Photo Frame Corners

steps.instruction: Fold the paper according to the diagram to form the first intermediate shape for a frame corner.
steps.visual_description: A complex folded paper shape, viewed from above, showing multiple diagonal and horizontal fold lines indicated by dashed lines. The shape forms a corner with a triangular top section and a more intricate base. An angle is marked in the bottom right corner of the folded piece.

steps.instruction: Continue folding the paper, following the diagram, to create the second intermediate shape, which includes a 10-degree angle.
steps.visual_description: A complex folded paper shape, viewed from above, showing multiple diagonal and vertical fold lines indicated by dashed lines. The shape forms a corner with a distinct angular protrusion on the left side, where a 10 angle is marked.

steps.instruction: The frame corner is finished. Slide the photo into the frame at the point indicated by the arrow.
steps.visual_description: A finished, dark-colored right-hand frame corner. An arrow points towards an opening on the inner side of the corner, indicating where a photo should be inserted. A cartoon image of a girl is shown partially inserted into the frame.

steps.instruction: To create the left corner, reverse or adapt steps 5 and 6.
steps.visual_description: A finished, dark-colored left-hand frame corner, which is a mirror image of the corner in step 7. An arrow points towards an opening on the inner side of the corner. A cartoon image of two figures is shown partially inserted into the frame.

blueprint_data.assembly_notes: Follow folding diagrams to create the frame corners. Adapt steps 5 and 6 to create the mirrored left corner.

projects.finished_product_description: A set of two folded paper frame corners (left and right) designed to hold photos.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 5 illustrates an intermediate stage of paper folding, showing a complex, multi-faceted shape with numerous dashed lines indicating fold lines, forming what appears to be a right-hand corner component.

Diagram 6 illustrates another intermediate stage of paper folding, showing a different complex shape with dashed lines for folds, featuring a distinct angular section on the left side marked with a 10-degree angle.
Diagram 7 displays a finished, dark-colored right-hand photo frame corner, with an arrow pointing to an opening, demonstrating where a cartoon image of a girl is partially inserted.

An unlabeled diagram shows a finished, dark-colored left-hand photo frame corner, which is a mirror image of the corner in diagram 7, with an arrow pointing to an opening, demonstrating where a cartoon image of two figures is partially inserted.

steps.instruction: Fold and unfold.
steps.visual_description: A square with a dashed horizontal line across the middle and a curved arrow indicating a fold downwards.

steps.instruction: Fold and unfold.
steps.visual_description: A square with dashed vertical lines dividing it into thirds, and a curved arrow indicating a fold to the center.

steps.instruction: Fold and unfold.
steps.visual_description: A square with dashed vertical lines dividing it into thirds, and curved arrows indicating folds to the center from both sides.

steps.instruction: Fold and unfold, turn the paper over.
steps.visual_description: A square with a grid of dashed horizontal and vertical lines, and curved arrows indicating folds from the top and bottom edges to the center.

steps.instruction: Like this.
steps.visual_description: A square divided into a 3x3 grid by solid lines, with no fold lines indicated.

steps.instruction: Fold and unfold all four corners, Turn the paper over.
steps.visual_description: A square with a 3x3 grid of solid lines. Dashed lines connect the midpoints of each side to the center. Arrows indicate folding the corners inwards towards the center along the dashed lines.

steps.instruction: Following the existing creases, bring points A and B to the center.
steps.visual_description: A square with a 3x3 grid. Diagonal dashed lines are present in the top-left and bottom-right quadrants. Points labeled A and B are indicated, with curved arrows showing them being brought to the center.

steps.instruction: This is a mid-fold view.
steps.visual_description: A partially folded square. The top-left quadrant shows a folded flap with point A at the center. Point B is also indicated. A diagonal line is visible in the bottom-right quadrant.

steps.instruction: Repeat step 7 on C & D.
steps.visual_description: A partially folded square. Points C and D are indicated in the top-right and bottom-left quadrants respectively. Curved arrows show these points being brought to the center, similar to step 7.

projects.name: Open Sink on Windmill Base

steps.instruction: This is a completed Windmill base. Rotate the model 45 degrees.
steps.visual_description: A square model, divided into four smaller squares by creases radiating from the center, rotated 45 degrees.

steps.instruction: Steps 11-15 show the correct way of executing an open sink on the top corner. When you are comfortable with the sequence, steps 13-15 will be executed as one step without flattening the model. If the sequence confuses you, see the additional explanation in the "Techniques" section. Fold all layers to the center.
steps.visual_description: A square model, rotated 45 degrees. The top corner is being folded downwards along a horizontal dashed line, indicated by a curved arrow, towards the center.

steps.instruction: Fold the layers back up.
steps.visual_description: A square model, rotated 45 degrees. The top corner, previously folded down, is now being folded back up, indicated by a curved arrow.

steps.instruction: Pull flap A all the way upward, opening out B & C.
steps.visual_description: A square model. The top flap, labeled 'A', is being pulled upwards. Curved arrows indicate this upward movement and the outward opening of the side flaps, labeled 'B' and 'C'.

steps.instruction: Fold back up on the previous creases, but turn the three lines of the completely opened flap (shown bolded), inside out.
steps.visual_description: A large diagram showing the model with the top section opened out. Internal creases are visible. Three bolded lines form a triangular shape at the top, indicating where to fold inwards. Curved arrows show the folding motion.

steps.instruction: Complete the sink by folding point A back into place, pulling the side flaps inward as you go.
steps.visual_description: A square model. Point 'A' (the top corner) is being folded downwards, and the side flaps 'B' and 'C' are being pulled inwards. Curved arrows illustrate these movements.

tips: When you are comfortable with the sequence, steps 13-15 will be executed as one step without flattening the model.
If the sequence confuses you, see the additional explanation in the "Techniques" section.
projects.finished_product_description: A paper model with an open sink completed on the top corner of a Windmill base.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram for step 10: A square model, divided into four smaller squares by creases radiating from the center, rotated 45 degrees.
Diagram for step 11: A square model, rotated 45 degrees. The top corner is being folded downwards along a horizontal dashed line, indicated by a curved arrow, towards the center.
Diagram for step 12: A square model, rotated 45 degrees. The top corner, previously folded down, is now being folded back up, indicated by a curved arrow.
Diagram for step 13: A square model. The top flap, labeled 'A', is being pulled upwards. Curved arrows indicate this upward movement and the outward opening of the side flaps, labeled 'B' and 'C'.

Diagram for step 14: A large diagram showing the model with the top section opened out. Internal creases are visible. Three bolded lines form a triangular shape at the top, indicating where to fold inwards. Curved arrows show the folding motion.
Diagram for step 15: A square model. Point 'A' (the top corner) is being folded downwards, and the side flaps 'B' and 'C' are being pulled inwards. Curved arrows illustrate these movements.
Diagram 16 shows a square with four flaps, one flap is being folded down along a dashed line from point B to point C, with an arrow indicating the direction of the fold.
Diagram 17 shows the result of step 16, with the flap folded down. It also shows three other flaps, each with a small black triangle pointing outwards, indicating the direction of a sink fold.

Diagram 21 shows the result of step 20, with the flap folded back up.

Diagram 23 shows a square with dashed lines indicating creases. Arrows show pulling the paper back up on existing creases and folding inward.

projects.name: Origami

steps.instruction: Remember when folding the sink back up, only bring in one layer from each side. It is as easy to grab two layers as one, and you can become lost easily if you aren't careful.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a square with dashed lines indicating folds. Arrows show how to fold the corners inward, with a focus on folding only one layer.

steps.instruction: Repeat the sink on the two remaining corners.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a square with dashed lines. Arrows indicate folding the remaining two corners inward.

steps.instruction: At this point the model should be symmetrical in four directions, if it is not, then a mistake was made in folding up the sinks. If this is the case you must rearrange the flaps or the next level will not work. If all else fails, unfold the model and try again on the same piece of paper. It's always much easier the second time!
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a square with a central square and four triangular flaps. The model is symmetrical.

steps.instruction: Continue sinking on the next level just as with steps 22-27.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a square with a central square and four triangular flaps. Arrows indicate folding the corners of the flaps inward to create a new, smaller square.

steps.instruction: Note that the squashed square is always directly over the center of the model. Fold the squashed area up as before.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the result of step 28. A smaller square is visible in the center. Arrows indicate folding this central area upwards.

steps.instruction: Complete the level by sinking the other 3 corners.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the model after step 29. Arrows indicate sinking the remaining three corners inward.

steps.instruction: At this point three levels of sinks have been completed. Keep adding levels until your eyes explode, your paper shreds irrecoverably, or you feel satiated by the process. As a challenge, I try executing eight levels on an 8" piece of paper.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the model with three levels of sinks completed. The central area is a complex geometric pattern.

steps.instruction: To complete the model, instead of sinking, valley fold the last set of flaps toward the center. Also pull out the flaps from behind.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the model with many levels of sinks. Arrows indicate valley folding the outermost flaps towards the center and pulling out flaps from behind.

steps.instruction: Completed model.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the finished origami model. It is a complex, multi-layered geometric pattern resembling a star or flower.

tips: It is as easy to grab two layers as one, and you can become lost easily if you aren't careful.

If a mistake was made in folding up the sinks, rearrange the flaps or the next level will not work. If all else fails, unfold the model and try again on the same piece of paper. It's always much easier the second time!
projects.finished_product_description: A complex, multi-layered origami geometric pattern.

Diagram showing an origami model with three levels of sinks completed, featuring a complex central geometric pattern.
Diagram showing the final steps of completing the origami model, with arrows indicating valley folds and pulling out flaps.

projects.name: Fire Hydrant

steps.instruction: Start colored side up. Crease in quarters both crosswise and lengthwise.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle with dashed lines indicating creases. There are four vertical dashed lines and two horizontal dashed lines, dividing the rectangle into quarters. Arrows indicate folding actions.

steps.instruction: At the left end make two horizontal creases halfway between center and quarter creases. This crease should extend about 1/8 of the length of the model.
steps.visual_description: The left end of the rectangle from step 1. Two new horizontal dashed lines are added between the center horizontal crease and the top/bottom edges. Arrows indicate folding.

steps.instruction: Crease both outside quarters into eighths.
steps.visual_description: The right end of the rectangle. The two outer quarters are further divided by dashed lines, suggesting division into eighths.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold and unfold.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle with diagonal dashed lines forming an 'X' in the center. Arrows indicate folding and unfolding.

steps.instruction: Pleat as shown.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle with dashed lines forming an 'X' and two vertical dashed lines. Labels '1/2' and '1/4' are present. Arrows indicate pleating actions.

steps.instruction: Valley fold AB to CD. Change this to a mountain fold. Unfold everything.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a section of the paper with points labeled A, B, C, and D. Arrows indicate folding AB to CD, then reversing the fold to a mountain fold, and then unfolding.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold and unfold. Use creases formed in step 6 as a reference point.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle with existing creases. Arrows indicate a mountain fold along a crease, referencing the folds made in step 6.

A rectangle with several horizontal and vertical dashed lines. A diagonal dashed line runs from the bottom left to the top right. A curved line is drawn below the bottom edge, and an upward arrow is shown above the center.

tips: A 2-1/2" by 20" rectangle makes a model 5-3/4" tall.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing the initial creasing of a rectangle into quarters.
Diagram showing additional horizontal creases at the left end of the rectangle.
Diagram showing the right end of the rectangle being creased into eighths.
Diagram showing mountain fold and unfold lines on a rectangle.
Diagram illustrating pleating with fractional measurements.
Diagram showing valley and mountain folds with labeled points A, B, C, D.
Diagram showing a mountain fold and unfold using previous creases as reference.
Diagram showing the final state of the paper with multiple creases and a curved fold.

steps.instruction: Crease #1 connects the ends of the two diagonal folds created in step 7.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular paper base with a section folded upwards. The folded section shows two diagonal creases forming an 'X'. A new diagonal crease (Crease #1) is shown on the main base, connecting to the ends of the previous diagonal folds. A horizontal dashed line labeled '8' and a curved arrow indicating a fold are also present.

steps.instruction: Fold AB to EF for crease #2.
steps.visual_description: The same paper configuration as 9a, with points A, B, E, and F labeled. A curved arrow indicates folding the top edge (AB) down to align with the line EF.

steps.instruction: Valley fold and unfold through both thicknesses on the right.
steps.visual_description: The same paper configuration as 9a/9b. A curved arrow on the right side indicates a valley fold and unfold action, passing through multiple layers of paper.

steps.instruction: Pleat fold.
steps.visual_description: A rectangular piece of paper, with the right end showing a pleat fold. There are two vertical dashed lines and diagonal lines forming an 'X' within the pleat. Measurements '1/4' and '1/2' are indicated at the bottom of the pleat.

steps.instruction: Valley fold so that G barely touches H.
steps.visual_description: A partial view of a paper section with jagged left and right edges. A central section is folded upwards. Points G and H are labeled. A vertical dashed line with an arrow indicates a valley fold, bringing point G towards point H.

steps.instruction: Valley fold top two layers to center line. Form a squash as indicated by the x-ray diagonal lines.
steps.visual_description: A partial view of a paper section. The top two layers of a folded-up section are being valley folded inwards towards a central vertical line. X-ray diagonal lines and arrows indicate the formation of a squash fold.

steps.instruction: Pleat fold both layers simultaneously.
steps.visual_description: A piece of paper with a section folded up and to the right. The rightmost part shows a pleat fold being formed, with two vertical dashed lines and diagonal lines. Arrows indicate the pleat action on both layers.

steps.instruction: View of completed step from the top.
steps.visual_description: A top-down view of the folded paper, showing the completed pleat fold on the right side. Measurements '1/4' and '1/4' are indicated at the bottom of the pleat.

steps.instruction: Unfold diagonal.
steps.visual_description: The same top-down view as 13b, but with an arrow indicating an unfolding action along a diagonal line.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold on crease already in place nearest the bottom edge done in step 3. Fold the top layer only. Be sure crease continues under the collar on the right.
steps.visual_description: A piece of paper with a section folded. A curved arrow indicates a mountain fold being performed on the top layer along an existing crease near the bottom edge. A dashed line shows the crease continuing underneath another layer (collar) on the right.

steps.instruction: Refold diagonal.
steps.visual_description: The same paper configuration as 14a, with an arrow indicating a refold action along a diagonal line.

steps.instruction: Valley fold and squash.
steps.visual_description: A piece of paper with a section folded up. A vertical dashed line with an arrow indicates a valley fold, and a curved arrow indicates a squash fold being performed.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing the paper after an 'unlocking' action, revealing a new configuration of folds with a diagonal crease and a curved arrow, labeled 'Unlock to look like this.'
