projects.name: Completed fire hydrant

steps.instruction: Enlarged for clarity. Mountain fold right and left sides and squash where indicated (right side squash goes between top and bottom layers).
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing a section of a paper craft, likely a fire hydrant, with arrows indicating mountain folds on the right and left sides. A curved arrow indicates a squash action on the right side, with a note that the squash goes between top and bottom layers.

steps.instruction: Pleat as shown. The mountain fold is created by folding GH to IV. The valley fold is created by folding GH to KL.
steps.visual_description: Diagram of a paper craft, likely a fire hydrant, showing pleats. Labels G, H, I, V, K, L are indicated on the paper. Arrows show folding lines.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold behind. Squash upper ends.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing a folded paper section, likely the top of a fire hydrant, with an arrow indicating a mountain fold at the back and a squash action on the upper ends.

steps.instruction: Pleat. There are no reference points. The creases are equidistant from each other. They are approximately 1/8 of the width of the paper (see step 3).
dimensions_mentioned: 1/8 of the width of the paper
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing a paper section with multiple parallel pleats. The pleats are shown as equidistant, and the instruction notes they are approximately 1/8 of the paper's width.

steps.instruction: Under top layer of the pleat there are flaps under the right and left corners. Pull them out and flatten them (see step 29).
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing the underside of a pleated paper section. Arrows indicate pulling out flaps from the right and left corners and flattening them.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold the two corners next to the right side head. Turn over.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing a paper craft, likely a fire hydrant, with two corners next to the right side head being mountain folded. An arrow indicates to turn the piece over.

steps.instruction: Valley fold below as shown (note x-ray lines). Other details omitted for clarity.
steps.visual_description: Diagram of a paper craft, likely a fire hydrant, showing a valley fold below the previously folded sections. Dotted lines indicate internal structure or folding lines.

steps.instruction: Turn over.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing a paper craft, likely a fire hydrant, with an arrow indicating to turn it over.

projects.finished_product_description: A completed paper craft fire hydrant.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing a paper craft, likely a fire hydrant, with various folding instructions. Includes labels and arrows.
Diagram showing a paper craft, likely a fire hydrant, with pleats and folding lines.
Diagram showing a folded paper section, likely the top of a fire hydrant, with folding and squashing actions indicated.
Diagram showing a paper section with multiple parallel pleats.
Diagram showing the underside of a pleated paper section with flaps to be pulled out and flattened.
Diagram showing a paper craft, likely a fire hydrant, with corners being mountain folded.
Diagram of a paper craft, likely a fire hydrant, showing a valley fold.
Diagram showing a paper craft, likely a fire hydrant, with an instruction to turn it over.
Diagram showing a completed fire hydrant craft.

projects.name: Waterlily

steps.instruction: Fold the paper diagonally in both directions, then fold in half horizontally and vertically. Unfold.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with dashed lines indicating diagonal and horizontal/vertical folds. Arrows show the direction of the folds.

steps.instruction: Collapse the paper into a square base.
steps.visual_description: A square base formed from the previous folds, with a smaller square in the center.

steps.instruction: Fold the top layer of the open edges to the center line.
steps.visual_description: The square base with the top layer of the open edges folded towards the center crease.

steps.instruction: This step shows the unfolded paper with all the creases from steps 1-3.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with a grid of dashed lines representing the creases made so far.

steps.instruction: Fold the top flap down along the horizontal crease.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 3, with the top flap folded down. Small arrows indicate folding the side points inwards.

steps.instruction: Fold the side points inwards.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 5, with the side points folded inwards, creating a kite-like shape.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom points up to meet the top point.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 6, with the bottom points folded upwards.

steps.instruction: Fold the side flaps inwards.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 7, with the side flaps folded inwards.

steps.instruction: Unfold points A-D completely and reorder the folds as shown. Fold the lily again with points A-D inside but visible now. Folds are shown on the white side. (Editor's note: unfold points A-D completely; fold as in instructions, then refold points A-D. Repeat with each individually.)
steps.visual_description: The model from step 8, with points A-D unfolded. Arrows indicate reordering the folds. The text describes the next folding action.

tips: 10" paper makes a model 2" high and 5" diameter.
Foil works better.
projects.finished_product_description: A waterlily origami model.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 1 shows a square with diagonal and horizontal/vertical dashed fold lines and arrows indicating fold directions.
Diagram 2 shows a square base with a smaller shaded square in the center.
Diagram 3 shows the square base with the top layer of open edges folded to the center line.
Diagram 4 shows a square with a grid of dashed lines representing creases.
Diagram 5 shows the model from step 3 with the top flap folded down and arrows indicating folding side points inwards.
Diagram 6 shows the model from step 5 with side points folded inwards, forming a kite shape.
Diagram 7 shows the model from step 6 with bottom points folded upwards.
Diagram 8 shows the model from step 7 with side flaps folded inwards.
Diagram 9 shows the model from step 8 with points A-D unfolded and arrows indicating reordering of folds.

projects.name: Origami Flower

steps.instruction: While opening the model, fold each in-between flap to the right, and open up.
steps.visual_description: A 3D diagram showing a diamond-like shape with flaps being folded outwards and upwards.

steps.instruction: Push raised center flat in a spiral movement. (Author's note: Instead of pushing the raised center flat, it is also possible to fold the center inside the model to give the flower a colored heart. Very difficult!)
steps.visual_description: A square with diagonal creases, showing arrows indicating a spiral inward movement of the center flaps. Another diagram shows the result of this step, a square with a twisted center.
A square with a central spiral pattern, with a small swirl and arrow to the right.
A square with dashed lines indicating folds, and arrows showing the outer edges being folded inwards.

steps.instruction: Get points A..D (diagram 1) out.
steps.visual_description: A 3D diagram showing a partially formed flower shape, with several points (petals) being pulled upwards and outwards from the center.

steps.instruction: Curl points.
steps.visual_description: A 3D diagram of the flower, showing arrows indicating the tips of the petals being curled outwards.

steps.instruction: Completed model. (Editor's note: If points A..D are opened and the small two-layered flaps at the base of the petals are curled, the flower will appear to be in full bloom.)
steps.visual_description: A fully bloomed origami flower with multiple petals, shown from a top-down perspective with a dotted circle base.

tips: Instead of pushing the raised center flat, it is also possible to fold the center inside the model to give the flower a colored heart. Very difficult!
projects.finished_product_description: A completed origami flower that can appear to be in full bloom if petals are opened and curled.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 1: A 3D representation of a partially formed origami flower, showing points labeled A, B, C, and D.
Diagram showing a square with dashed lines and arrows indicating inward folds.

projects.name: Simplest Sailboat

steps.instruction: Start white side up for a colored boat with white sails. Bring short edges of rectangle together; fold and unfold.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle with a vertical dashed line down the center and two diagonal dashed lines on each side, indicating folds. An arrow shows a fold and unfold action.

steps.instruction: Valley fold top long edges down to lay along center line.
steps.visual_description: The rectangle from step 1, now with the top long edges folded down to meet the center line, forming a pointed top.

steps.instruction: Valley fold bottom corners to center. Valley fold top point down to center of model.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 2, with the bottom corners folded inwards to meet the center line, and the top point folded down to meet the center. The diagram shows dashed lines indicating these folds and arrows showing the direction of the folds. A circular diagram with '180' and arrows indicates a rotation.

steps.instruction: Turn model over and right side up.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 3, now turned over and right side up, showing the front of the sailboat shape.

steps.instruction: Model will stand.
steps.visual_description: A completed sailboat model standing upright. It has a triangular sail shape and a wider base.

projects.finished_product_description: A simple paper sailboat model.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing a rectangle with fold lines and an arrow indicating a fold and unfold.
Diagram showing the rectangle with top edges folded to the center line.
Diagram showing the shape with bottom corners folded to the center and the top point folded down, with a 180-degree rotation symbol.
Diagram showing the front of the sailboat model.
Diagram of the finished, standing sailboat model.

projects.name: Sailboat

steps.instruction: White side up, valley fold in half.
steps.visual_description: A square with a dashed vertical line down the center and a curved arrow indicating a fold towards the viewer.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the folded edge towards the center.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle, folded in half vertically, with a dashed vertical line in the center. A curved arrow indicates folding the right edge towards the center line.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold half of the last fold.
steps.visual_description: A tall, narrow rectangle with a dashed vertical line in the center. A curved arrow indicates folding the right half of the paper back on itself.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the two corners and tuck them behind the mast.
steps.visual_description: A shape resembling a house with a central mast. Dashed lines indicate where to fold the top two corners inwards and tuck them behind the central mast. Curved arrows show the folding action.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold the bottom rectangle.
steps.visual_description: A shape resembling a house with a central mast. A dashed horizontal line across the bottom section. A curved arrow indicates folding the bottom section upwards.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the bottom rectangle. Turn over.
steps.visual_description: A shape resembling a house with a central mast. A dashed horizontal line across the bottom section. A curved arrow indicates folding the bottom section upwards. A separate small drawing shows a swirl with an arrow, indicating to turn the model over.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the two bottom corners.
steps.visual_description: The bottom of the boat shape is shown. Curved arrows indicate folding the two bottom corners inwards.

steps.instruction: Tuck the flaps inside the boat. Turn over.
steps.visual_description: The bottom of the boat shape is shown with flaps. Arrows indicate tucking these flaps inside. A separate small drawing shows a swirl with an arrow, indicating to turn the model over.

steps.instruction: Completed model.
steps.visual_description: A completed origami sailboat, viewed from the front.

projects.finished_product_description: A simple origami sailboat.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing the steps to fold an origami sailboat, numbered 1 through 9.
Diagram 1: A square with a dashed vertical center line and a fold indicator.
Diagram 2: A folded rectangle with a dashed center line and a fold indicator.
Diagram 3: A narrower folded rectangle with a fold indicator.
Diagram 4: A house-like shape with a mast, showing corner folds.
Diagram 5: The house-like shape with a horizontal dashed line and a fold indicator.
Diagram 6: Similar to Diagram 5, with a 'turn over' symbol.
Diagram 7: The bottom of the boat shape with corner fold indicators.
Diagram 8: The bottom of the boat shape with flaps to be tucked, and a 'turn over' symbol.
Diagram 9: The finished origami sailboat.

projects.name: House

steps.instruction: Make two airplane valley folds, one at the top and one at the bottom.
steps.visual_description: A square divided by a vertical and horizontal line. Dashed lines indicate valley folds at the top and bottom corners, with arrows showing the direction of the folds.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the left corner over to taste.
steps.visual_description: The previous shape with the left corner folded over. A dashed line indicates the fold, and an arrow shows the direction.

steps.instruction: Valley fold along the center so that the bottom point will meet the top point. The house with chimney is now formed.
steps.visual_description: The previous shape folded in half along the center vertical line. The bottom point meets the top point, forming a house shape with a chimney.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold the side ends over to taste, but leave space between the fold and the chimney to indicate a roof.
steps.visual_description: The house shape from step 3. Arrows indicate mountain folds on the sides, with dashed lines showing where the folds will occur, leaving a space for the roof.

steps.instruction: Completed model.
steps.visual_description: A finished origami house with a brick pattern on the walls and a tiled roof. It has two windows and a door.

tips: Completed model is about 1/2 the side of paper.
Use one sheet of rectangular paper with proportions of 2 by 1-1/4 for best results.
projects.finished_product_description: An origami house with a chimney.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing the steps to fold an origami house.
A circular logo with 'ALICE GRAY CHALLENGE' around the edge and 'AG' in the center.

projects.name: Boat in the Lake

steps.instruction: Start with a kite base the color of the lake.
steps.visual_description: A triangular shape with two flaps on each side, resembling a kite base.
The kite base from step 1 is shown from a top-down perspective, with arrows indicating folds towards the center.
The shape from step 2 is shown with one flap folded down, creating a triangular prism shape.
The triangular prism shape from step 3 is shown with one of the side flaps folded inwards.
The shape from step 4 is shown with the other side flap folded inwards, creating a more compact triangular form.
The shape from step 5 is shown with the top point folded down, creating a boat-like hull.
The boat hull from step 6 is shown with arrows indicating the folding of the bottom flaps upwards to form the sides of the boat.
The boat shape from step 7 is shown with the bottom flaps folded up, and a small triangular section folded down on one side.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold and valley fold.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a boat shape with dashed lines indicating mountain and valley folds, and arrows showing the direction of the folds.
The boat shape from step 9 is shown with the sides of the boat formed by the folds, and an arrow indicating a flap being folded outwards.

steps.instruction: Reverse folds.
steps.visual_description: A close-up of the boat's sail area, with arrows indicating reverse folds to shape the sail.
The finished origami boat, with a sail and a hull, resting on a wavy line representing water.

tips: Use a 10" square for a 5" by 6" lake.

steps.instruction: Start colored side up.

A triangle with a dashed line parallel to the base, approximately 1/4 of the way up from the base. An arrow indicates folding the bottom edge upwards along the dashed line.

steps.instruction: Less than half.
steps.visual_description: A triangle with a dashed line parallel to the base, indicating a fold. The bottom section is folded upwards, but not to the full height of the triangle.

steps.instruction: Outside reverse fold on existing crease.
steps.visual_description: A triangle with a dashed line indicating a previous fold. An arrow shows an outside reverse fold being made along this crease.

steps.instruction: Inside reverse fold.
steps.visual_description: A partially folded shape resembling a boat hull. An arrow indicates an inside reverse fold being made on the left side.

steps.instruction: Inside reverse fold.
steps.visual_description: A triangular shape with layers folded at the top. An arrow indicates an inside reverse fold being made on the right side.

tips: 6" paper makes a 5" high boat.

projects.name: Paper Sailboat

steps.instruction: Mountain fold. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: A diagram of a paper sailboat with a sail. A dashed line indicates a mountain fold, and the fraction '1/4' is written near the fold line.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: A diagram of a paper sailboat, similar to step 7, showing the sail being mountain folded. Arrows indicate the direction of the fold.

steps.instruction: Fold and unfold.
steps.visual_description: A rear view of the paper sailboat, showing the base of the sail folded and unfolded, with arrows indicating the movement.

steps.instruction: Slide ends together and pinch to lock.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the ends of the paper sailboat's base being slid together and pinched to lock, with arrows indicating the action.

steps.instruction: It's ready to sail!
steps.visual_description: A diagram of the completed paper sailboat, standing upright and appearing ready to sail.

tips: Try refolding the sail for interesting variations.

projects.name: Plane

steps.instruction: Start with white side up. Fold into waterbomb base.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with dashed lines indicating diagonal and horizontal/vertical center creases.

steps.instruction: Using the bottom edge, Valley fold the two ends over. The folds should be diagonal from the bottom corners to the highest point on the top.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a folded paper shape. Two flaps are folded inwards from the bottom edge, with the fold lines extending diagonally from the bottom corners to the top point.

steps.instruction: Using the top layer, Mountain fold the two side ends to the center. Then reverse fold them.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the top layer of the paper. The two side edges are folded inwards to meet at the center line, and then these folds are reversed.

steps.instruction: Pull out the two side ends until the folded edges form a parallel line to the bottom raw edge.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the partially folded paper. Two flaps are being pulled outwards and downwards, with the folded edges aligning parallel to the bottom edge.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold the model in half. Then valley fold the two ends over.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the model folded in half along the center line. Then, two flaps (presumably wings) are folded outwards.

steps.instruction: The airplane is complete.
steps.visual_description: A finished origami airplane with two wings, decorated with stars. The airplane is shown from a perspective view, with shadows indicating it is a 3D object.

projects.finished_product_description: A completed origami airplane with stars on its wings.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram 1: A square piece of paper with dashed lines indicating diagonal folds and a vertical/horizontal center crease.
Diagram 2: A folded paper shape showing two flaps being folded inwards from the bottom edge diagonally to the top point.
Diagram 3: A diagram showing the top layer of the paper with side edges folded to the center and then reverse folded.
Diagram 4: A diagram illustrating pulling out two side ends to form parallel lines with the bottom edge.
Diagram 5: A diagram showing the model folded in half, with two ends folded over.
Diagram 6: A finished origami airplane with stars on its wings, depicted in a 3D perspective view with shadows.

projects.name: Teepee

steps.instruction: Fold the paper along the diagonals and the horizontal and vertical center lines.
steps.visual_description: A square with dashed lines indicating diagonal folds and solid lines indicating horizontal and vertical center folds. Arrows show the direction of the folds.

steps.instruction: Fold the paper along the horizontal and vertical center lines.
steps.visual_description: A square divided into four smaller squares by solid lines. Dashed lines indicate diagonal folds. Arrows show the direction of the folds.

steps.instruction: Mountain crease and unfold.
steps.visual_description: A square with a grid of horizontal and vertical lines. Diagonal dashed lines are also present. Arrows indicate folding actions.

steps.instruction: Fold the top corners down to the center line.
steps.visual_description: A rectangle with the top edge folded down. The top corners are folded towards the center line, creating a triangular shape at the top. Arrows indicate the folding direction.

steps.instruction: Enlarged view. Turn over.
steps.visual_description: A shape that appears to be the front of the teepee, with a central vertical fold. The sides are angled inwards towards the top. An arrow indicates turning the model over.

steps.instruction: Fold the right side inwards along the dashed line.
steps.visual_description: A square shape with a central vertical fold. A dashed line runs diagonally from the top center to the bottom right corner. An arrow indicates folding the right side inwards along this line.

steps.instruction: Fold the left flap outwards.
steps.visual_description: An enlarged view of the bottom section of the teepee. A flap on the left side is shown being folded outwards. A dashed line indicates a fold, and an arrow shows the direction of the fold.

tips: Use monochromatic paper, 10 inch paper yields 5 1/4 inch model.

projects.name: Tepee

steps.instruction: Fold the left side of the paper diagonally to the center crease, then fold the right side to the center crease.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a piece of paper folded in half vertically. The left flap is folded diagonally inwards, and the right flap is also folded diagonally inwards. Dashed lines indicate the folds.

steps.instruction: Fold the top flap down along the horizontal line.
steps.visual_description: The previous shape is shown with the top triangular flap folded down. A dashed line indicates the fold.

steps.instruction: Fold the two side flaps inwards towards the center, aligning the edges with the center crease.
steps.visual_description: The shape from step 9 is shown. The two side flaps are folded inwards, creating a narrower central section. Dashed lines with arrows indicate the direction of the folds.

steps.instruction: Turn the model over.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the model from step 10 being turned over. A circular arrow indicates the turning motion.

steps.instruction: Fold the bottom edges of the two front flaps inwards to create the base of the tepee. The arrows indicate folding inwards.
steps.visual_description: The model is shown from the front. The bottom edges of the two central flaps are folded inwards, creating triangular shapes at the base. Dashed lines with arrows show the folds.

steps.instruction: Finished tepee.

projects.name: Truck

steps.instruction: Start with white side up. Valley fold to center.
steps.visual_description: A square divided into four smaller squares by horizontal and vertical lines. Diagonal dashed lines connect the corners of the large square to the center. Arrows indicate valley folds towards the center vertical line.

steps.instruction: Valley fold to center.
steps.visual_description: A square divided into four smaller squares. The left and right sides are folded inwards to meet the center vertical line. Arrows indicate valley folds.

steps.instruction: Using the top layer only, valley fold the four corners to the center vertical line.
steps.visual_description: A square divided into four smaller squares. The top layer's four corners are folded inwards to meet the center vertical line. Arrows indicate valley folds.

steps.instruction: Pull out the two top corners. The shape will resemble the roof of a house. Do the same thing with the bottom corners.
steps.visual_description: A square divided into four smaller squares. The top two corners are pulled outwards, creating a shape resembling a house roof. Dotted lines indicate the new edges. Arrows show the outward pull. The bottom corners are also shown being pulled out.

steps.instruction: Starting with the raw edges that meet in the center, valley fold to the top and bottom ends as shown. At this stage, the four corners will not lie flat. To make them flat, valley fold corners over.
steps.visual_description: A shape resembling a flattened diamond with two layers. The raw edges of the top layer are folded to the top and bottom points. Arrows indicate valley folds. The corners are shown folded over to lie flat.

steps.instruction: Starting from the center, valley fold halfway, so that the raw edges will meet the folded edges.
steps.visual_description: A shape resembling a flattened diamond with two layers. The center section is folded inwards. Arrows indicate valley folds towards the center.

steps.instruction: Pleat to taste.
steps.visual_description: A shape with accordion-like folds being made. Arrows indicate the direction of the pleats.

steps.instruction: Valley fold over the four corners part of the way, to taste, so that the four points will become four edges. After that, valley fold the model in half.
steps.visual_description: A shape with four points. The points are folded inwards part of the way. An arrow indicates a valley fold. A 90-degree symbol with a circular arrow is shown next to the model, suggesting a turn or rotation. The model is then shown folded in half.

steps.instruction: At this stage, the vehicle is formed. Reverse fold to taste the front part of the vehicle only. Part of the front layer extends to the back part of the vehicle.
steps.visual_description: A partially formed vehicle shape. The front section is shown with a reverse fold. An arrow indicates the reverse fold. The diagram shows how the front layer extends to the back.

steps.instruction: Completed model.
steps.visual_description: A completed origami truck model. It has a cab and a flatbed. The wheels are formed by the folded paper. The front of the truck has a distinct shape with folded-down flaps.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami truck.

Text reads: 'At this point the model is 3D and will remain 3D for the rest of the folding sequence.'

Diagram 13 shows a side view of the elongated shape, with shading indicating the top surface. Dashed lines and solid lines indicate creases and folds. A small circle is present on the top surface, and several arrows show folding directions.
Diagram 14 shows a similar side view to diagram 13. A dashed line indicates a fold, and arrows show the direction of movement. A vertical dashed line is also present.
Diagram 15 shows another side view, similar to 13 and 14. Dashed lines and solid lines indicate creases and folds. Arrows show folding directions.
Diagram 16 shows the side view of the shape. A curved arrow indicates a lifting or unfolding motion. A small black triangle is positioned below the shape.
Diagram showing step 17: A vertical rectangle is folded in half vertically. The left side is then folded back to create a layered effect. A curved arrow indicates a fold.
Diagram showing step 18: The folded paper from step 17 is shown from a different angle. A triangular flap is indicated.
Diagram showing step 19: The paper is folded horizontally. A dashed line indicates a fold, and an arrow with a cross indicates a cut or fold.
Diagram showing step 20: The paper is shown in a flattened state, with a triangular flap pointing upwards.
Diagram showing step 21: The paper is folded upwards, with dashed lines indicating further folds. Arrows indicate movement.

steps.instruction: Fold the paper as shown.

steps.instruction: Fold the paper as shown.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami model of a speedboat.

projects.name: Cart

steps.instruction: Begin with white side up. Precrease in fourths.
steps.visual_description: A square piece of paper with a 4x4 grid of precrease lines, indicating it has been precreased into fourths both horizontally and vertically.

steps.instruction: Valley fold the top down. Precrease the bottom corners.
steps.visual_description: The square paper from step 1, with the top quarter valley folded down. Diagonal dashed lines indicate precreases for the bottom corners, and arrows show the folding directions.

steps.instruction: Valley fold corners over and over.
steps.visual_description: A trapezoidal shape. The bottom corners have been valley folded upwards, meeting at the central vertical line. Dashed lines indicate previous creases.

steps.instruction: Turn over.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 3, rotated 180 degrees horizontally, now appearing as an inverted trapezoid.

steps.instruction: Valley fold up.
steps.visual_description: The inverted trapezoid from step 4, with its bottom point valley folded upwards along a horizontal dashed line. An arrow indicates the fold.

steps.instruction: Valley fold in half.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 5, now valley folded vertically in half. A vertical dashed line indicates the fold.

steps.instruction: Precrease and then open out to the side that is predominantly colored.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 6, partially opened. An arrow shows a flap being pulled out from the side, revealing a colored section.

steps.instruction: Crimp along existing creases.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 7, showing a crimped section on the side, formed along existing creases.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold in half. Rotate model.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 8, mountain folded vertically in half, then rotated 90 degrees clockwise. Arrows indicate the rotation.
The model from step 9, now standing upright, illustrating its three-dimensional form. It has a pointed top and a broader base.

steps.instruction: Sink the top using existing creases as a guide.
steps.visual_description: The model from step 10, with the top section being 'sunk' inwards. Dashed lines and an arrow indicate the sinking motion.

steps.instruction: Complete.
steps.visual_description: The completed model, resembling a stylized cart or basket shape, with a pointed handle-like feature.

steps.instruction: Spread open. Rotate model; it will not lie flat.
steps.visual_description: The completed model from step 12, spread open to reveal its internal structure, and rotated. It is depicted as a three-dimensional object that does not lie flat.

tips: Use thin or metallic paper.
A 10-inch paper makes a 4-inch long model.
projects.finished_product_description: An origami cart model, approximately 4 inches long when made from 10-inch paper.

projects.name: Origami Airplane

steps.instruction: Spread squash the center point. Swivel the side under the squash.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing the center point being spread and squashed, with one side being swiveled underneath.

steps.instruction: Repeat on the other side.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing the same action as step 14 being performed on the opposite side.

steps.instruction: Valley fold in half. Rotate the model.

steps.instruction: Swivel fold behind.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing a flap being folded behind the main body of the model.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold moving top flap behind.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing the top flap being folded behind the model using a mountain fold.

steps.instruction: Squash both sides.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing both sides of the model being squashed flat, with arrows indicating the direction of the folds.

steps.instruction: Fold up. Bring back flap down (see step 22.)
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing a flap being folded upwards, and then another flap being brought down. An arrow indicates the action.

steps.instruction: Precrease.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing creases being made on a section of the model, indicated by dashed lines and arrows.

steps.instruction: Fold a kind of preliminary base.
steps.visual_description: Diagram showing the model being folded into a preliminary base shape, with multiple creases and arrows indicating the folds.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami airplane.

diagram_descriptions: Diagram showing steps 14, 15, and 16 of an origami project, illustrating squash folds, swivel folds, and a valley fold in half.
Diagram showing steps 17, 18, 19, and 20 of an origami project, illustrating valley folds, swivel folds, mountain folds, and squash folds.

projects.name: Origami Wheel

steps.instruction: Squash both sides.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a square with two opposite corners being squashed inwards, creating a diamond shape with two flaps on each side.

steps.instruction: Sink both corners.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the previous shape with the two pointed corners being pushed inwards and flattened.
A diagram showing a circular shape with a diamond-like structure inside, possibly representing the completed wheel or a stage of its construction.

steps.instruction: Valley fold up.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a diamond shape with a central vertical line. A flap on the right side is folded upwards along the center line.

steps.instruction: Valley fold down.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the previous shape. A flap on the left side is folded downwards along the center line.

steps.instruction: Place the point in the opposite pocket.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a folded shape. A pointed flap is being inserted into a pocket formed by other folds.

steps.instruction: Valley fold up.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a diamond shape with a central vertical line. A flap on the right side is folded upwards along the center line, similar to step 27 but on a different part of the model.

steps.instruction: Place the point in the opposite pocket.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a folded shape. A pointed flap is being inserted into a pocket formed by other folds, similar to step 29.

steps.instruction: Wheel complete. Repeat steps 17-32 on the other side.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a completed wheel-like structure with spokes or blades. The instruction indicates to repeat the process on the reverse side.

steps.instruction: 33a. Precrease above. 33b. Pleat fold below. 33c. Repeat behind.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a rectangular section with dashed lines indicating precreases. Arrows show folding actions, suggesting a pleating motion. The instruction also indicates to repeat this on the back.

projects.finished_product_description: An origami wheel structure.

steps.instruction: Mountain fold rear corner.

steps.visual_description: Implied repetition of the previous step on the opposite side.

projects.name: Baby Carriage

steps.instruction: Start with a colored bird base.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a bird base, which is a kite-like shape with a pointed top and two points at the bottom. Arrows indicate the top point and the two bottom points.

steps.instruction: Continue folding the bird base, collapsing it further.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the bird base partially collapsed. Internal dashed lines indicate existing or new creases, and an 'X' marks a central intersection point.

steps.instruction: Further collapse and shape the base.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a more advanced collapsed base, resembling a crane base, with multiple layers and points formed by previous folds.

steps.instruction: Open and flatten one of the points.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a close-up of one of the points from the previous step being opened and flattened. A curved arrow indicates the direction of the opening fold.

steps.instruction: Perform a color change by reversing the fold, revealing the other side of the paper.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the point from step 4 now flattened, with a distinct area (implied to be the 'color change' side) visible. Dashed lines indicate internal creases.

steps.instruction: Fold a flap inwards or upwards from the flattened section.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a small flap on the flattened section from step 5 being folded, indicated by a small arrow pointing inwards/upwards.

steps.instruction: Complete the fold from step 6.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the result of step 6, with the flap folded. The surrounding area is stippled, indicating the 'color change' side of the paper, forming a distinct shape.

steps.instruction: Repeat steps 4 through 7 on the opposite point of the model.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing the model after repeating the sequence of folds (steps 4-7) on the other side, resulting in a symmetrical structure with two distinct 'color change' sections.

steps.instruction: Further shape the central part of the model, forming the carriage details.
steps.visual_description: A diagram showing a close-up of the central part of the model. It features two diamond-like 'color change' sections (representing wheels or sides) surrounded by stippled areas, indicating the main body of the carriage.

steps.instruction: Make final folds and shaping to complete the baby carriage.
steps.visual_description: A diagram of the completed 'Baby Carriage' model. It shows the two 'color change' sections prominently as wheels/sides, and the overall structure of the carriage. Dashed lines indicate final creases or shaping.

tips: 10" square makes an 8" long cart.
projects.finished_product_description: An origami baby carriage, approximately 8 inches long, made from a 10-inch square of paper.
